She lives in her own house in Boane with her family, her husband works as a painter. She also supports her mother in law who lives in Inhambane sending her money to buy food. She left Inhambane in 1992 and went to Maputo with her husband, looking for better live conditions. She works at an orphanage (casa do Gaiato) as a cook for the past 9 years, she enters at 7am and leaves at 5pm and earns a salary of 4.000MT, and she is able to save some money every month in her bank account. She never had any other loans, and learned about Hluvuku thru a co-worker. This is her 4th loan for 15.000MT which she expects to use to buy construction material (blocks, cement, zinc sheets, sand and others) to keep on building her house. The other previous loans were for the same activity. She promises to pay well this loan in order to access to more loans in the future, finish her house and offer more comfort to her family.

Translated from Portuguese by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials (cement, sand and others)

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou, 38, has three businesses: a piggery, rice farming, and a sari-sari (variety) store. The eldest of her five children is still 15 years old and that's why she works hard in order to support them.

Marilou requested a loan of 8,000 Php from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to buy supplies needed for her businesses. She would like to expand her businesses in order to earn more for the sustenance of her family.

loans.use: To buy feeds and farm supplies

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en: Jackson is a 40 year old married father of five children. All of Jackson's children are in school.  Jackson does small scale farming due to limited space and lack of capital. Jackson is unable to lease more farming space and buy farm inputs.  With a loan of Kshs 30,000, he will be able to use half to get farming space and the remainder to buy farm seeds and prepare the ground for planting.

loans.use: Lease more farm space and purchase seeds

loans.name: Joana

texts.en:
Joana, age 46, is a very hard-working married woman who works hard to provide for her five children, four of whom are in school. She trades in cereals like maize and gari, which is prepared from milled cassava. She sells gari grains in bulk in the market. She acquires her stock from the nearby communities and distributes her wares during market days.

She has a large customer base, but her problem has to do with having adequate funds to buy enough stock. With this loan assistance, she believes she will have full resources in order to realize good profits.

loans.use: To buy cereals like gari and maize grains for sale

loans.name: Estrella Oriental Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal " Estrella Oriental"  Esta representado por la señora Cecilia Andrea y conformado por 12 miembros las cuales 11 son mujeres y un solo varón, todas son amigas muy unidas, activas y emprendedoras las cuales van cursando un segundo ciclo demostrando responsabilidad y capacidad D. pago. Entre las actividades que realizan esta la venta D. venta D. ropa, ropa americana, venta D. comida en pensiones en sus domicilios, venta D. tarjetas calendarios, otras se dedican a la coinfección D. prendas D. vestir, cortinas y la repostería tradicional, algunas cuentan con locales comerciales en sus domicilios propios en casetas en alquiler y otras trabajan D. forma ambulante; algunas tienen ingresos extras con la venta D. cosméticos por catálogo. 

Más a detalle se pueD. mencionar lo siguiente: Cecilia Andrea que es la presidenta del grupo se dedica a la venta D. comida tiene una experiencia D. 15 años en el rubro, Bertha se dedica a la venta D. tarjetas desD. hace 2 años, Elar tiene un puesto donD. venD. celulares	desD. hace 3 años, Karina es peluquera y atienD. en su salón D. belleza desD. hace 2 años, Hilda cuenta con una venta D. comida la que atienD. desD. hace 1 año, Renalia se dedica a la venta polleras desD. hace 2 años atrás, Josefa que se dedica a la venta D. ropa desD. hace 20 años atrás, Fabiola venD. comida hace 1 año, Senovia también se dedica a la venta D. comida solo que ella tiene una experiencia D. 12 años, Melvis también se dedica a la venta D. comida y tiene más experiencia (14 años), Delicia venD. ropa desD. hace 1 año, Marisol percibe un ingreso por concepto D. arrendar una movilidad ella se dedica a este negocio desD. hace 10 años. 

En cuanto al entorno competitivo podemos mencionar que sus competidores siempre están presentes pero las socias se las arreglan para sacar adelantes sus negocios ya sea diversificando su mercadería o con la venta ambulante en zonas periféricas D. la ciudad que eles permite generar el movimiento necesario para el sustento D. sus familias. 

El destino del financiamiento es para la adquisición D. material D. trabajo, insumos al por mayor y la mejora D. sus viviendas para darles mayor comodidad a sus familias. En cuanto a las expectativas D. las socias todas desean poder tener su casa propia por lo que su esfuerzo es para ello ya que desean darles un techo estable a sus hijos y un mejor futuro para cada uno D. ellos.
texts.en:
The Estrella Oriental Communal Bank is represented by Cecilia Andrea and comprised of 12 members. Eleven are women, and there is only one man. All of them are very united friends, who are active and entrepreneurial. They are in their second cycle, and they demonstrate responsibility and the capacity to pay. Among the activities they do is selling clothes, American clothes, selling food in boarding houses in their homes, and selling calendar cards. Others make articles of clothing, curtains, and traditional pastries. Some of them have commercial businesses in their own homes or rent stalls. Others work as street merchants. Some have extra income from selling cosmetics by catalog. In detail, the members' businesses are as follows: Cecilia Andrea, the group's president, sells food and has 15 years of experience. Bertha has been selling cards for the past two years, Elar has had a cell phone stand for the past three years, Karina is a hairdresser and has been working at her salon for the past two years, Hilda has been selling meals for the past year, Renalia has been selling pollera-style skirts for the past two years, Josefa has been selling clothing for 20 years, Fabiola has been selling food for the past year, Senovia also sells food but has 12 years of experience, Mevlis also sells food and has 14 years of experience, Delicia has been selling clothing for the past year, and Marisol generates income by renting out her car; she has been doing so for the past 10 years. As far as competition goes, it is always there. But, the members adjust to get ahead in their businesses. They diversify their merchandise or travel to sell in outlying areas of the city. This allows them to generate the necessary movement to support their families. The loan is to get working materials, wholesale supplies, and to improve their homes to make their families more comfortable. As far as the members’ expectations go, they wish to be able to have their own houses. That is why they put forth so much effort; they want to give their children a stable roof over their heads. They want to give each one of them a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Thơm's Group

texts.en: Thơm Thị

loans.use: To invest in her business

loans.name: Mabb

texts.en:
Mr. Mabb T. is a 26 year old who lives in the village of Pongro in Takeo province. He and his wife, Mrs. Raem Laem, are farmers who own a 5 hectare field to cultivate rice. Aside from farming, they also raise pigs, making a small income to support their family. This couple has one child who is too young for school. 

Mr. Mabb T. is now requesting a 1,000,000 riel loan from AMK to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and gasoline to support the crops. 

His wife is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline

loans.name: Maria Ismelda

texts.es:
La Sra. María Ismelda B. V. es agricultora y comerciante del área rural del Municipio de Pueblo Nuevo.

Ella solita un financiamiento en Ceprodel para la compra de granos tales como el maíz y retenerlo para venderlo en tiempo de verano donde los precios de este son mas altos y el grano es mas escaso.

Este negocio empezó cando María B. empezó a comprar granos en poca cantidad en época de cosecha y venderlo en tiempo de escases hasta comprar cada ves mas granos, ella se a dedicado a esta labor desde hace aproximadamente unos quince años,  cabe señalar que en años anteriores ella era estudiante de secundaria.

Ella espera que con la compra y retención de estos granos pueda venderlos en mejor precio cuando sea el tiempo de escases y esto le generara mejores ganancias y por ende mejores ingresos familiares y de esta manera espera que su negocio crezca cada ves mas.

Este es el crédito numero ocho que Doña María B. solicita en Ceprodel en un periodo de cinco años. Estos financierito le han beneficiado positivamente ya  que a través de esto a logrado asistir sus cultivos de granos básicos y tener segura la cosecha para es sustento de su familia.
texts.en:
María Ismelda B. V. is a farmer and merchant in the rural zone of Pueblo Nuevo. She is asking Ceprodel for funds to buy corn to store and then sell in Summer when prices are higher and the grain is scarcer. The business began when María B. began to buy small amounts of grain during harvest time and then sell it during times of shortage; each time she bought more grain and has been doing this work for about 15 years now. It is worth noting that in the years prior to this she was in secondary school. She hopes that by buying and storing these grains she will be able to sell them for a better price at a time when the grain is scarce. This will generate better profits and thus better family income; she hopes that her business will grow more each time. This is her 8th loan with Ceprodel in a period of 5 years. These loans have been beneficial to her because she has been able to care for her crops and insure a good harvest for the support of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea S., aged 46, is married and lives with his wife in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. He has four children. S. is a soldier in the city, earning an income of $5 USD per day to help cover family expenses. His wife sells groceries and runs a food shop at her home, earning an income of $7 USD per day. She has been running this business since 2005. The family's standard of living has been improved since S.'s wife has had this business. S. is requesting a loan of $300 USD to buy more groceries to stock his wife's store. This is his fifth loan from Kiva partner, CREDIT.
The photograph shows S.'s wife.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to stock his wife's store

loans.name: Ban

texts.en:
Mrs. Ban C. is a 56-year-old widow who currently lives in a village located in Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. She was not available for the photograph so her daughter is pictured instead. Ban C. has given birth to two children: one daughter and one son. Her daughter is now married but still lives with her in her home.

To pursue a daily income, Ban C. owns a farm where she grows crops and has had this job for years. Also she depends on the income from her son and her son-in-law, who are local construction laborers.

Ban C. will be using her loan to pay the bill for connecting a new electricity line for family use.

loans.use: To pay the bill for connecting a new electricity line for family use

loans.name: Toch

texts.en:
Toch C., age 23, is married and resides with her husband and children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. She is a farmer who grows pumpkins and watermelons for an income of about USD $2.00 per day. Her husband is a militant for the province, earning an income of USD $2.50 per day to help cover the family's expenses.  

C. is requesting a loan of USD $1000 to purchase a plot of farmland to grow more melons and pumpkins. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a plot of farmland

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick O. is a 38 year-old business man. He is married with three children and he also has five more dependents, of whom four are in school. He is a resident of Akesi village, Nebbi Town Council.

Patrick owns a retail shop business which he has been running for over three years. He will use his loan to purchase retail shop items such as biscuits, toilet papers, soap, salt, packed milk, sugar, drinks and so forth, to sell.

His future hope is to enlarge his shop for more profits.

loans.use: To purchase retail shop items such as biscuits, toilet papers, soap, salt, packed milk, sugar, drinks and so forth, to sell.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester D., 43, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. She is married to Nelson D., a construction worker, and they are blessed with two children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn enough so that their family can have a better life. She has been managing her own clothing stall, where she sells ready-to-wear-clothing, for quite some time now.

Ester has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her clothing business.

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a PHP 8,000 loan. This amount will be used as added capital for her expanding business, enabling her to buy more products to be incorporated into her current product inventory.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell

loans.name: Muhumuza Women's Group, Ntungamo

texts.en:
A determined N. Shallon has, over the last ten years, been overseeing her growing spare-parts business in Ntungamo town. With a monthly net profit of 100,000 Ugandan shillings a month, this married lady has enjoyed the good circumstances that have come with running this lucrative business. As a result, she has made enormous progress in as far as educating her children is concerned.

Shallon’s business story began with a now defunct secondhand clothes business. With the profits from it, she was able to make progress in her bid to establish herself in her new business. Her first priority after acquiring this loan is to purchase more hardware stock with the sole objective of turning her business into a bid supplies store in her operating area. She also has a side commercial motorcycle business that she runs which also helps her supplement her profits.

Shallon is a lady with a purpose-driven ambition as she is looking at not only business expansion but also the quality education of her children. With this loan, she wants to buy more car and motorcycle parts that she will later resell.

Shallon belongs to a group of members who hold each other accountable and insure one another in paying back the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more car and motorcycle spare parts for resale

loans.name: A Changeable God Group

texts.en:
Helena D., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called A Changeable God. She is 47 years old, single and has five children who range from 15 to 27 years old. 

She was not able to attend school due to lack of financial support. 

For 25 years, she has been selling dried fish in West Point Market in Monrovia, Liberia.
 
She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more dried fish. She describes herself as a peaceful person.

Her dream is to improve her business and continue to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more dried fish

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome M. is from the village of Poblacion, Quezon Bukidnon. She is 49 years old and married with six school-aged children. Salome runs a sari-sari (variety) shop selling both food and daily use products and also runs a small eatery. Salome has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Salome joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Salome from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Deun

texts.en: Mrs. Deun L. has been in the farming business for years. She plants rice crops on her own land, from which she earns a living. Her husband assists her with the farm work. Deun L. has been married for years and has two children, both attending school. Deun L. hopes to improve her daily income. To help meet her goals, Deun L. has applied for a loan to use as capital in order to buy mature rice in bulk from other farmers to store for a while before selling it for a profit.

loans.use: To buy mature rice in bulk from other farmers to store for a while before selling

loans.name: Florentino

texts.es:
Don Florentino es un señor de 39 años de edad  quien vive con su esposa y  4 hijos  en una de Reserva habitada por uno de los grupos  Indígenas mas importantes de Costa Rica los  “Guaimí”.    Esta Ubicada en San Vito de Coto Brus una zona caracterizada por su elevada Ubicación y por estar a solamente una hora del Parque Internacional La  Amistad. Sus principales actividades económicas son la Agricultura, la artesanía y el Turismo  el cual ha aumentando en los últimos años.
Una de los productos más comercializados por los Guamies son los Frijoles. Y don Florentino lleva toda su vida produciendo este grano,   para consumo de su familia y principalmente para la venta. El negocio de los frijoles ha estado un poco bajo debido a que no hay dinero para invertir pero, gracias a este tipo Organizaciones hoy don Florentino  tiene la posibilidad de solicitar un préstamo de ¢100.000 (cien mil colones) para la compra de semilla de frijol y los respectivos insumos que necesite para tener la mejor cosecha de frijol posible.
El asegura que con su negocio mejorara la calidad de vida su familia y les podrá comprar mas ropa y zapatos que necesitan sus hijos para ir a la escuela.
Don Florentino es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Ku Kwata, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y también es la primera vez  que la ECC recibe un préstamo con Fondos de Kiva.
texts.en:
Mr. Florentino is a 39 year old man who lives with his wife and 4 children in a Reserve inhabited by one of the most important indigenous groups of Costa Rica, the "Guaimi." It is located in San Vito of Coto Brus, and area characterized for its elevated location and for being only an hour away from the International Park of Friendship. The main economical work is agriculture, making local art, and tourism which has increased in the last few years.

One of the Guaimis' best selling products is beans and Mr. Florentino has spent his entire life growing grains for his family's consumption but mainly for sale. The bean business has been low due to the lack of money. Thanks to this type of organization Mr. Florentino has the opportunity to request a ¢100.000 (one-hundred thousand colones or Costa Rican Currency) loan for the purchase of bean seeds and the related materials he will need to have the best bean crop possible.

He assures that his business will improve his family's quality of life and he will be able to buy more clothes and shoes for his children to go to school.

Mr. Florentino is a member of the Communal Credit Company Ku Kwata, one of the partner organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his first loan and also the first time ECC receives a loan with funds coming from Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Garza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bean seeds and other supplies.

loans.name: Tumurbaatar

texts.en:
Tumurbaatar S. is 54 years old and lives with his wife in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent in Uvurhangai Province in Mongolia. His son, Boldoo, 22, currently attends university and lives in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.

Tumurbaatar started selling dairy products in a local market, and in 1993 opened a small cafe in his town where he and his wife produce quality meals for their customers. Since opening, this business has expanded, and he continues to sell his dairy products. For the future, Tumurbaatar plans to build a new cafe on land that he bought in order to grow his business. "I hope to build a new restaurant near the market, so that our business can grow 2-3 times larger than now," he says.

A very successful businessman,Tumurbaatar is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase grocery products and meat for his business.

loans.use: To purchase grocery products

loans.name: Nohemi Group

texts.es:
El grupo Nohemi  está con formado por tres mujeres trabajadoras y esforzadas  una de ellas es Yahaira Tomasa B. quien vende carne y delantales desde hace tres años. 

Las otras integrantes del grupo son María Felix R. quien vende ropa usada y nueva y comercializa productos Avon mientras Jenny Lorena U. vende ropa.
texts.en:
The Nohemi Group is composed of three hard-working and forceful women, one of whom is Yahaira who has sold meat and aprons for three years. The other members of the group are Gloria, who has a tiny bakery and sells Avon products, while Cecilia has a general store.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING MEAT AND PRODUCING APRONS TO SELL

loans.name: María Del Pilar

texts.es:
María del Pilar es una madre de familia de 32 años de edad, que vive junto a su esposo y a sus cuatro hijos en el sector San Martín del distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola que produce principalmente frutas como limón y mango. Se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Piura, perteneciente a la región del mismo nombre, a mas de tres horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

María del Pilar se dedica a la venta de comida, ella prepara diversos platos de comida y los ofrece en venta tres veces por semana en un puesto ubicado frente a la puerta principal del mercado de su distrito, gracias al tiempo que lleva en el negocio actualmente ya cuenta con un grupo de clientes fidelizados que prefieren su negocio por la buena sazón con la que prepara sus comidas y por el buen trato con el que los atiende.

Los ingresos que ella percibe los utiliza para ayudar a su esposo a sacar adelante a sus hijos. María está pensando en ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas insumos de tal manera que pueda preparar mas platos de comida y por consiguiente su nivel de ventas aumente. Para realizar su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

María es una mujer bastante trabajadora y que siempre vela por el desarrollo de los suyos. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para poder instalar un restaurante.
texts.en:
Maria del Pilar is a 32 year old mom that lives with her husband and four children in San Martin sector of the Tambogrande district, an agricultural area that mainly produces limes and mangoes.  It is located in the province of Piura which belongs to the region of the same name, more than three and a half hours away from the city of Chiclayo, capital of Lambayeque.

María del Pilar sells food, she prepares different dishes and offers them for sale three times a week in a stand located across the main entrance of the district market, thanks to the time she has been in business she currently has a group of loyal clients that prefer her business because of the great flavor of well seasoned food and the good service she provides.

The income that she gets is used to help her husband and get her kids ahead.  Maria is considering expanding her business by buying more ingredients and this way make more dishes and increase her sales.  To achieve this objective she thought it would be convenient to request a loan of 1000 new soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

Maria is a very hardworking woman and she always looks after the development of her people.  Her biggest dream is to grow as an entrepreneur and be able to open a restaurant.

loans.use: Buy ingredients for food sales

loans.name: C1184 Jyambere Group

texts.en:
Laurence is was born in 1964 and is married with two children; the first one is 5 years old and the younger is two years old. Laurence is businesswoman and her husband is also in business; both work hard for the purpose of making progress in their family. Laurence owns a small business selling soft drinks made of sorghum and she has two years of experience. The hours of her daily activities are from 6 in the morning to 8 in the evening every day. In addition to that, Laurence is the group leader of eleven people who have different business; some of them sell  juice made of bananas or have a store with various products and so on.

Laurence and her group are now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand their business through purchasing the products needed. With this loan the members of group will be able to satisfy their business customers which will be the best way of earning more profits to be used in their families and in their business as well.

loans.use: purchasing the sorghum for making soft drinks

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es:
El señor Rafael Ampié Z. tiene 53 años de edad, trabaja como coordinador de la sala general de la biblioteca municipal del barrio La Reynaga, el tiene aspiraciones personales en su trabajo como es crear un proyecto para incentivar la lectura de cuentos en los niños del barrio La Reynaga, se preocupa por que la niñez actual está muy influenciada por los programas de televisión que en su mayoría no ayudan a enriquecer la cultura general de los niños.

Es casado, con dos hijos en edad escolar. Su esposa es periodista de  Radio Nicaragua.

Es primera vez que hace préstamo, dice que le gustó la política de crédito que le ofreció CEPRODEL y por medio de este crédito podrá mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mr Rafael Ampié Z. is 53 years old.  He works as a co-ordinator in the main area of the  municipal library in La Reynaga neighborhood.  He has personal aspirations in his work such as creating a project to encourage the reading of stories to the children of La Reynaga neighborhood.  He is worried that children today are very much influenced by television programs, most of which do not help to enrich the children's general culture.

Rafael is married with two school-age children.  His wife is a reporter for Radio Nicaragua.

This is the first time that he has taken a loan.  He says that he liked the loan policy which CEPRODEL offered him and with this loan he would be able to improve his house.

loans.use: Improvements to his house: purchase of corrugated metal roofing to improve his kitchen

loans.name: Pariken Ole

texts.en:
Pariken Ole M. is 44 years old, married and a father of eight children. Pariken is a farmer who has been in this business for the last eleven years. His farm is in a productive area, which has proved to be good for wheat farming.

He learned about KADET through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his second loan, which he is going to use to plant four acres of wheat in the current planting season. He hopes to use the profits from this loan to acquire more land for farming to meet the demands for wheat in the area.

His hope and dream is to become a large-scale farmer and buy a bigger piece of land. He is a young and energetic man who is determined to achieve his goals.

loans.use: Planting wheat

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 32 years old and married with three children who are between the ages of 1 and 7 years old. She is commonly known for selling a variety of goods in her boutique.  Jacqueline has been in this business for about five years and works from 6 a.m. until 8 p.m.  She employs 4 people to help her run the business.

Jacqueline has requested a loan from the Kiva partner Vision Finance Company to expand her business by adding more products that she can sell.  With the help of this loan, Jacqueline has hope for the future.

loans.use: To purchase more products for wholesale

loans.name: Veronica Chepkew

texts.en:
Veronica Chepkew T. is 38 years old, married to Andrew Dimakon who is also a  businessman and this is also a source of additional income for the family. They have four school going children of age 14,12, 9 and 5 years, their residence is in Kapenguria-Kenya. She has been a tailor and has been in this business for three years with good income.

Veronica learned about KADET LTD through a credit officer and so she is applying for her second loan of Kshs.40,000 from KADET LTD, which she intends to purchase a sewing machine. With the anticipated profits, she plans to build her own house.

In the future, Veronica wishes to live a better and more comfortable life.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Jane Musangi

texts.en:
Jane Musangi, 45, runs a tailoring shop at Kwa Njenga. She is married to Alex Mutuku and together they have two children: Alex, 18, in form four and Blessy, 16, in form three. Jane was introduced to KADET by other KADET clients.

She has been running her business for two years and her monthly profit is 15,000 Kenyan Shillings (Kshs). This loan of 20,000 Kshs is her second loan from KADET. The previous loan was well paid. Jane intends to use the loan to buy rolls of materials for making clothes. If this boosts the business, she plans to buy another sewing machine.

Jane hopes to expand her business and develop her piece of land in Ruai. This will increase her income allowing her to pay school fees for her children. She describes herself as social and hardworking.

loans.use: To buy rolls of materials.

loans.name: Khishigbayar

texts.en:
Mr. Khishigbayar, 35 years old, lives with his wife and four children in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. Khishigbayar’s family used to live in Khovd, the most remote western province of Mongolia, and in 2006 they moved to Darkhan in search of a better life. When they settled down in Darkhan, they bought a small family house, but it was burnt down accidentally, bringing a big loss to the family. Mr. Khishigbayar has managed to build a new house, thanks to his business and hard work.

In 2000, Khishigbayar and his wife started a shoemaking business and have since accumulated huge experience in making traditional Mongolian handmade shoes. These shoes are very popular in Mongolia and they are very comfortable and warm in winter time. Currently, they use their family house as a workshop. Since the business is expanding and the children are growing, this is becoming a big problem for them. Therefore, they are planning to add an extension to the house and use it as a workshop in the future. Mr. Khishigbayar and his wife are very hardworking people with much motivation and set goals to expand their business and to provide their children with a good education. At the moment, they want to buy a dust remover for the workshop and another sewing machine which will help them increase the varieties of shoes they make.

loans.use: to buy a dust remover for the workshop and another sewing machine

loans.name: Elvin Antonio

texts.es:
El Senor Elvin H., habita en la Comunidad El Coyolito, del Departamento de Esteli; Soltero, no tiene hijos, tiene 32 anos de edad.
Tuvo una ninez muy dura, desde la edad de 12 anos comenzo a trabajar, ayudando a sus padres en las actividades de Agricultura y Ganaderia, ayudando a su Papa a limpiar los huertos; y al mismo tiempo estudiaba, y con muchas dificultades logro terminar a penas la primaria, en el Colegio de su comunidad. Con ayuda de su Papa logro conseguir una beca para estudiar Tecnico Medio Agropecuario, en Muy Muy, Matagalpa, y termino hace 10 anos.
Consiguio un trabajo en la Coperativa SEPROCON, y al mismo tiempo ayudaba a su Papa con las actividades de siembra.
Con el tiempo decidio retirarse de ese trabajo y dedicarse a lo que el habia estudiado; decidio producir la tierra y poner una granja Avicola, es decir de Aves ponedoras, poco a poco fue mejorando y logro instalar un sistema de Riego por Goteo.
Con este credito pretende mejorar la calidad de sus cultivos, dar oportunidad de empleo a otras personas.
Dentro de sus metas esta ser autosostenible, para no necesitar de creditos, activar la granja, mejorar los Invernaderos que tiene y hacerlos producir.
texts.en:
Mr. Elvin H. lives in the community of El Coyolito in the department of Esteli. He is single, he doesn't have children, and he is 32 years of age. 

He had a very difficult childhood. He started to work when he was 12 years old, helping his parents in their agriculture and farming, especially helping his father clear the plantations. He went to school at the same time and with tremendous effort he managed to complete the primary grades at a school in the community. With the help of his father he managed to secure a student loan to learn to be an Agricultural Technician in Muy Muy, Matagalpa. He graduated 10 years ago. 

He became employed at the Coperativa Seprocon and he also continued to help his father with the plantations. 

In time he decided to stop that work and instead to work in his field of study full time. He decided to cultivate land and to set up a chicken farm, more specifically an egg producing facility. He slowly saw improvements and he managed to set up a water irrigation system. 

With this loan he plans on improving the quality of his cultivations and to create employment for others. 

Among his goals is to be financially secure, so as to no longer require loans, to expand his chicken farm, and to improve the greenhouses that he has to make them more productive.

loans.use: To cultivate vegetables.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity, nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children.

She has operated a boda boda (motorcycle) business for the past few months. In addition, she also operates a retail shop which contributes to her other source of income. Emma faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to expand her business and sell as wholesale in the future.

With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase another boda boda (motorcycle) and bundles of maize flour for her retail shop. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase another boda boda (motorcycle) and bundles of maize flour  for her retail shop.

loans.name: Kabirizi Kwetungura Group B, Kihihi

texts.en:
Emmanuel B. is the leader of Kabirizi Kwetungura Group B, Kihihi. He is 34 years old and married with four children. 

Emmanuel is into the business of tea growing in Kabirizi and he is grateful that he is able to sell his tea leaves to the Kayonza tea factory. He is able to make 280,000 shillings as monthly income. 

He needs a loan to be able to expand his tea farm by planting more tea on a large piece of land. This loan will help to employ labor on the farm and to buy more tea for growing. He is a hard worker and results-oriented.

loans.use: Employing labor on the farm and buying more tea for growing

loans.name: Robert

texts.es: El Sr. Robert  vive en la localidad de la Guardia en el km 14,  es nacido en el departamento de La Paz,  su actividad es el transporte de pasajeros en la línea de barrio lindo, su esposa se dedica a la venta de ropa para cama, tienen un hijo en edad escolar, hace unos 10 años que se vino a vivir a la ciudad de Santa Cruz, el destino del crédito es para comprar mercadería por mayor para la venta de su esposa la cual le ayuda en la economía de la familia; su esposa es nacida en el departamento de santa cruz, se dedica a la venta de ropa para cama, hace unos 8 años, el Sr. Robert es un apersona joven y trabajadora, con ganas de salir adelante y mejorar la calidad de vida de toda su familia, esta agradecida con la institución con el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Robert lives in La Guardia at km 14.  He was born in the department of La Paz, and works in passenger transport on the Barrio Lindo line.  His wife sells bed linens.  They have a school-aged son.   About 10 years ago he came to live in the city of Santa Cruz, the destination for the loan, which will be used to buy merchandise in bulk for his wife's business, which helps him with the family finances. His wife was born in the department of Santa Cruz and has been selling bed linens for about 8 years.  Robert is a hardworking young man, with a desire to get ahead and improve his family's quality of life.  He is grateful to the institution for the help they have given him.

loans.use: to buy merchandise in bulk

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred A. is 34 years old, married and the father of two children. For fourteen years he has been selling secondhand shoes in Gikomba’s open air market. He earns an income of 20,000 KES per month.

Alfred learned about KADET LTD through a friend. He has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD, which he plans to use to purchase more shoes to sell.

Alfred intends to use the anticipated profit to improve the living standards of his family. In the future he plans to grow his business and be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell

loans.name: Mustapha

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 35 years old, married and has three children.

In 2008, Mustapha opened a food market; he sells all kinds of foodstuffs and herbs used to prepare alternative medicines. He has two years of experience. He has an excellent reputation and he is becoming well known in his area.

He is requesting a $1500 loan to repair his shop and to expand his inventory. He is aiming to develop his business and to offer the best services for customers and to grow bigger so he will be able to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To repair his shop and to expand the inventory.

loans.name: Froilan

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “OLLANTAY D. WAYRACPUNCU”; Este banco está ubicado en la Provincia D. Ollantaytambo y  departamento D. Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Froilan; es casado; el socio tiene 73 años D. edad; el socio tiene 2 hijos, (23, 21) años D. edad,  el socio se dedica  al engorD. D. animales, el socio tiene animales vacunos y ovinos y se dedica a comprar criar engordar, reproducir y vender los animales gradualmente, el socio también tiene sus cultivos D. quiwicha y también venD. al por mayor a las grandes empresas que elaboran la quiwicha pop y diversos productos en base D. este cereal rico en proteínas, el socio en esta ocasión desea invertir su dinero en ambas actividades para continuar con sus actividades y D. este modo ir creciendo poco a poco. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. animales vacunos (1 vaca) y D. semillas para la siembra D. quiwicha.

El socio está muy agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. dicho préstamo D. forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
Sr. Froilan is a member of the Communal Bank “Ollantay D. Wayracpuncu” which is located in Urubamba Province, Department of Cusco.

He is 73 years old, married, and has two children (ages 23 and 21).  Froilan raises animals for fattening.  He purchases cows and pigs and then fattens them, breeds them, and takes care of them before they are sold a few at a time.  Froilan also grows quinoa and sells it in bulk to large companies that produce quinoa soda and other products maD. from this grain that is rich in protein.  On this occasion, he wants to invest the money in both of his business activities to keep them in operation and to grow them gradually.  Froilan is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of cows and seeds for planting quinoa.  

He is very grateful for the loan and promises to complete his payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to purchase cows and seeds for planting quinoa.

loans.name: Lithman Humberto

texts.es:
Lithman es un hombre soltero de 36 años de edad, vive en casa de unos amiliares, la cual  es propia y cuenta con todos los servicio ( agua, luz y desagüe) en el distrito de la Victoria, que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo.  Los pobladores de éste distrito se dedican al comercio y la mayoría son conductores de transporte público.

Lithman  labora desde hace unos 2 años como personal de apoyo en la Fiscalía, también cuenta con una mototaxi (transporte que se utiliza para movilizarse a distancias cortas, con un cupo máximo de 3 personas) la que alquila para tener otro ingreso económico y a veces por las noches él también la trabaja y así tenga más dinero para solventar sus gastos y necesidades.

El crédito que ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa es de 1000 nuevos soles y su destino será para comprar otra mototaxi de segunda mano, mejorando  la calidad de vida de él y seguir ayudando a los familiares con los que vive.

Lithman es un hombre muy  conocido  por ser trabajador, responsable que a punta de esfuerzo y empeño a sabido salir adelante, con el objetivo que en un futura sea eldueño de una  cantidad considerable de mototaxis para servicio público.
texts.en:
Lithman is 36 years old and single.  He lives with some family members in a house that they own.  The house has all services (water, electricity and sewerage) and is located in Victoria district, in Chiclayo province.  The residents of this district work in buying and selling and most are public transport drivers.

Litham has been working for two years as a support staff member in the district attorney's office.  He also owns a motorcycle taxi (a mode of transport which is used for traveling short distances and holds a maximum of 3 people).  He hires out the motorcycle taxi in order to make additional income.  Sometimes, in the evenings, he drives the vehicle himself in order to make more money with which to cover his expenses and needs.

Litham has requested a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa which he will use to buy another second-hand motorcycle taxi.  This will improve his quality of life and he will be able to continue helping the family members that he lives with.

Lithman is very well known as a hard working and responsible person who, through his efforts and commitment, has known how to get ahead in life.  His future goal is to become the owner of a considerable number of motorcycle taxis which will be used to provide a service to the public.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Dane Dole Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Dane Dolé a été créé le 05 mai 2010. Il est composé de 20 femmes issues du même village 
Leur activité principale est la vente d'huile d'arachide.

Madame AISSATOU  est la responsable du groupement,elle est âgée de 56 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants.

Son prêt lui permettra d'acheter des graines d'arachides qu'elle va ensuite transformer en huile destiné à la vente.Elle a une bonne expérience de son activité pour l'avoir pratiquée depuis plus de 05 ans.

Son objectif est de subvenir aux besoins de la famille: participer à la gestion quotidienne de la maison,la scolarité et la santé de ses enfants.

En outre elle désire faire de l'embauche bovine après l'hivernage .
texts.en:
The Dane Dolé solidarity group was set up on 5th May 2010. It is made up of twenty women who all come from the same village.

Aissatou, who is in charge of the group, is 56 years old. She is married and mother to seven children.

Her loan will enable her to buy peanut grains which she will then transform into oil for selling. She has good experience in this business, having done it for more than five years. 

Her aim is to provide for her family's needs: to contribute to the daily running of the household and her children's schooling and healthcare.

She would also like to take up beef fattening after the rainy season

loans.use: to buy peanuts for producing oil

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is from the city of Maquilao, Tangub City. She is 51 years old. Pacita is married and has three school-age children. To make a living, Pacita owns & operates a business raising fish to sell. Pacita has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Pacita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pacita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. Pacita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase new fishing nets. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Pacita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new fishing nets

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy soil to sell

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Chea (in the photo) has been a weaver for more than twenty-eight years. She also buys finished fabrics from other weavers in her village and sells them in other provinces, away from her house. She is applying for another loan of $100 to continue her weaving business by purchasing weaving materials.

loans.use: to purchase weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah has run her cafe and practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru for the last 20 years. She is 49 years old and married to Paul. She has three school-going children.

She was introduced to KADET by a KADET officer. This is her second loan. She paid the other loan well and in good time. 

She intends to use this loan to boost her cafe by enlarging it and also to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for her farm.

In the future, she aspires to enlarge her cafe and improve her farming to a more profitable level.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides, and also to buy stock for her cafe.

loans.name: Cecilia Margarita

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal La Unión Hace La Fuerza Del Pechiche. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

En este lugar vive a la señora Cecilia, tiene 32 años de edad, está casada  y de esta relación tienen tres hijas de 13, 11 y 8 años, las  dos mayores estudian en colegio y  la menor en escuela. Su esposo es maestro constructor. Ella lleva con su esposo más de 15 años pero recién se caso hace 3 meses.

Nuestra amiga se dedica a la venta  de zapatos y de productos Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Ella recorre puerta a puerta tres días a la semana ofreciendo sus productos los mismos que deja a crédito con la finalidad de tener más ventas y luego  cobra cada fin de semana. Tiene dos años  que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien. También cría pollos en su casa para lo cual ha construido una pequeña granja.

Este crédito es para comprar zapatos, perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y alimento para pollos. Este es el tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer.
 
Sus sueños son tener una boutique.
texts.en:
The members of the communal bank "La Union Hace La Fuerza del Pechiche" of the canton of Rocafuerte meet every two weeks. This place is known for the delicious sweets prepared by the locals and they are renowned throughout the entire country.

This is where Cecilia lives. She is 32 years old, married, and from her relationship she has three daughters, aged 13, 11, and 8. The two eldest are in high school and the youngest is in primary school. Her husband is a master builder. She has been with her husband for more than 15 years but they married only 3 months ago. 

Our friend sells shoes and Avon brand products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and ladies' accessories). She travels from door to door three days per week offering her products to her clients, completing the sales on credit with the goal of making more sales. She collects payments every weekend. She has been in business for two years and it has gone very well for her. She also raises poultry in her house on a small coop she had built.

This loan will be used to purchase shoes, perfumes, skin lotions, cosmetics, and poultry feed. This is her third loan cycle with her communal bank and she appreciates it for the easy payments.

Her dream is to have a boutique.

loans.use: to purchase shoes, perfumes, skin lotions, cosmetics, and poultry feed.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua sells used clothing at Abura. Efua has received junior high education.  She is a single parent taking care of three children. Her business is six years old. She hopes to acquire a loan from Kiva to expand the sale of used clothing. Any profit that would be realized from the sales will be reinvesting into the business for further growth.

loans.use: to expand the sale of used clothing.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is a 21-year-old Lebanese single woman living with her father. After her mother’s death, which was the most terrible accident she had to face, Mariam was forced to move on with her life because she found herself the main person responsible for the family. In 2009, she decided to open her own restaurant where she started to produce delicious traditional Lebanese breakfast and drills. With her requested loan of $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, she will be able to increase her inventory of food products and provisions. She works hard to support her older father. In the future, she is hoping to further expand her business and earn a higher income.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of food products and provisions

loans.name: Eduardo Wilfredo

texts.es: El Señor Eduardo es casado tiene una hija, es muy trabajador con deseos de superación, además tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante con su trabajo y esfuerzo. El Señor Eduardo se dedica a brindar el servicio de taxi en una moto alquilada, el crédito otorgado es para comprar algunos accesorios para su moto como un juego de llantas,  además una cama para para  el dormitorio de su pequeña hija. Su principal desafío es el trabajo arduo y constante que realiza durante el día desde muy temprano hasta altas horas de la noche, su gran sueño es de terminar de construir su casa  y el de tener una moto propia, a la vez está muy agradecido por el crédito otorgado ya que con él va a cumplir sus metas trazadas y va a poder tener una mejor calidad de vida para su hija.
texts.en:
Eduardo is married, and has a daughter. He is very hard-working, and wants to improve himself.  He also is very eager to get ahead through hard work and effort. Eduardo operates a taxi service using a rented motorcycle taxi.  

The loan is needed to buy a few spare parts for his motorcycle taxi such as a set of tires. He also wants to buy a bed for the bedroom of his small daughter. 

His main challenge is the hard and constant work that he does during the day, from very early in the morning to late at night. His greatest dream is to complete the building of his house and to have his own motorcycle taxi. At the same time he is grateful for the loan being granted, since it will enable him to fulfill his planned goals, and provide a better quality of life for his daughter.

loans.use: To buy a set of tires for his motorcycle taxi, and a bed for his small daughter.

loans.name: Rainer

texts.en:
Rainer is married with 2 children. He is 37 years old and lives in Sta. Cruz Jimenez Misamis Occidental.

Rainer owns and manages sari-sari (variety) store to earn a living and has had this business for 15 years. Each month he earns  PHP 5000 doing this type of work. He has requested a loan PHP 15000.  Rainer has been a member of GDMPC for 2 years. In the future, Rainer hope to expand his sari-sari store to sustain his family's daily needs and for the education of his children.


GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

GDMPC people empowering people.

loans.use: Purchase additional goods to sell, and a portion will be used for house repair

loans.name: Omar Ramón

texts.es:
En municipio de Managua, el  señor Omar Ramón  es una persona trabajadora de bueno valores morales  se dedica arduamente a laborar como cajero promotor y se dedica a esta labor desde hace dos años. Es acompañado tiene a su cargo cuatro persona.

Actualmente ha acudido a ceprodel con el fin de solicitar un crédito para mejorar la condición de su vivienda en la compra de materiales de construcción tales como cemento, bloque, hierro y pago de mano de obra para realizar un anexo de un cuarto  de su vivienda así brindarle una condición mejor a su familia, por medio de esta obra.
texts.en:
Omar Ramón is a hard-working person with good moral values who works as a cashier/salesman in Managua.  He has been in this job for two years.  He lives with his partner and has four people in his care.

Omar Ramón has come to Ceprodel to request a loan to improve the condition of his home.  He will buy construction supplies such as cement, blocks, and iron, and pay labor costs so that he can build an extension on a room in his home and thereby provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies

loans.name: Jose Isabel

texts.es:
Don Jose tiene 41 años de edad, esta casado y es padre de tres hijos, Jose se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva para caballero, trabaja duro para sacar adelante a su familia, su esposa se dedica a la venta de carne de res, juntos trabajan para darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus tres hijos.
Jose utilizara el credito para comprar ropa y asi tener mas variedad, Jose se esta preparando para la epoca navideña, asi podra tener mayores ventas y mas ganancias.
la meta de Jose y su esposa es que sus hijos sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Don Jose is 41 years old, married, and the father of three children. He sells new clothing for men. Jose works hard in order for his family to get ahead. His wife sells beef. They work together to provide a better quality of life for their three children.

Jose will use this loan to buy clothing so that he will have more variety. He is preparing for the Christmas season so that he will have better sales and more revenue. The goal of Jose and his wife is to see their children become successful professionals.

loans.use: to buy jeans, shirts, and undergarments.

loans.name: Estrellas Del Mar Azul Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ESTRELLAS DEL MAR AZUL” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II.  Está compuesta por once integrantes dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora  Lidia.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de cosméticos, venta de vajillas, venta de carne, venta de almohadas, venta de cosméticos, venta de comida.
 
La señora Lidia indica que hace cuatro años que integra una asociación comunal en Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una compañera. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de vajillas que viene trabajando hace cuatro años atrás, al iniciar el trabajo con Pro Mujer.

El crédito que sacará ahora es para el aumento de capital (compra de vajillas) que compra de Oruro y posteriormente  lo comercializará en las ferias. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene ocho hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el consultorio.
texts.en:
The 'Estellas del Mar Azul' community bank are about to start their first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Santiago II regional office.  The group has eleven members and is run by a board of directors which is headed by Lidia.  The businesses that the members of the bank are engaged in are varied and include: selling cosmetics, selling dishes, selling meat, selling pillows and selling food.

Lidia says that she has been a member of a Pro Mujer community bank for four years.  She joined through an invitation from a friend.  She currently has a business selling dishes which she has been working in for four years, since she started working with Pro Mujer.

Lidia will use this loan to increase her capital (buying dishes).  She will buy her products in Oruro and then sell them in street markets.  This work allows her to make income with which to support her family.  She is married and has eight children.

When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer, Lidia replied that she likes the doctor's office.

loans.use: to buy dishes

loans.name: Lomas Del Calvario (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal lomas Del Calvario  se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la rica cultura histórica que encierran sus montañas.

Este es un grupo de personas que decidieron unirse y formar este Banco Comunal que les sirve de mucho ya que con los créditos ellos pueden mejorar sus pequeños negocios que tienen. Se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio, servicios, venta de comidas entre otras actividades.

Aquí conocimos a la Señora Eloísa, tiene  25 años  de edad, está separada y no tiene hijos. Ella vive en casa de sus padres. 

Ella para solventar sus  gastos se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo y ropa interior, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, realiza sus ventas al contado y también deja a crédito a sus clientes más confiables, a los mismos que cobra cada 15 días. Ella compra su mercadería en Guayaquil, lleva tres años con este negocio y vende con su papá el cual lleva como 20 años en el negocio y fue quien le incentivó a entrar en el mundo del comercio.

Este crédito fue para comprar pantalones, blusas, camisas y ropa interior. Es su primer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que va a recibir.
 
Su sueño es tener un gran almacén.
texts.en:
The “Lomas del Calvario” (Calvary Hills) communal bank meets every fifteen days in Picoaza Parish in the city of Portoviejo, a zone noted for being very commercial, for its traditional feast day of Saints Peter and Paul and for its rich historic culture enclosed by its mountains.

This is a group of people that decided to join together and form this communal bank which is very useful for them because with the loans they are able to improve the small businesses they have.  They are in a variety of activities like commerce, services and food sales, among other activities.

We met Eloisa, 25, here.  She’s separated and has no children.  She lives in her parents’ house. To cover her expenses, she’s a merchant.  She sells all types of clothes and underwear door to door.  She sells for cash and also on credit to her most trustworthy customers.  She collects payments from them every 15 days.  She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil and has been in business three years.  She sells with her father who has been in the business about 20 years and who encouraged her to go into the world of commerce.

This loan was to buy pants, blouses, shirts and underwear.  It’s her first cycle in the communal bank and she likes it because of the help she’s going to get.  Her dream is to have a large store.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Marifel

texts.en:
Marifel is 29 years old and married, with three children.

Marifel works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell.

Marifel has received and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for seven years and also earns an income by raising livestock.

Marifel aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell.

loans.name: Lolina

texts.en:
Lolina is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Lolina has a shop that sells items such as canned goods, detergents, noodles, and soaps. She has had this business for four years. She has requested a loan for PHP 14000 to buy canned goods, detergents, and soaps for her store.

Lolina has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, detergents, and soaps for her store.

loans.name: Sonia Agustina

texts.es:
En los Arenales de la parroquia Crucita en Portoviejo cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal 6 de Julio. Este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, ofrece diversidad de lugares hermosos y una rica variedad de platos típicos de la región.

En este lugar vive la señora Sonia, tiene 42 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos de 22, 20, 17 y 15 años, el menor estudia en colegio y los dos menores aun viven en su casa. El marido se dedica a la pesca. 

Ella además de ser una muy buena ama de casa, para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a realizar venta y limpieza de filetes de pescado, va en la mañana hasta las playas para comprar el mejor pescado para luego limpiarlo  y filetearlo para llevarlo a vender por toda la localidad o entregar a otros comerciantes que los llevan a otras ciudades. Lleva más de 4 años en este negocio y es así como ella puede ayudar a su marido con los gastos del hogar.

Este crédito es para comprar pescado para vender a sus clientes lo mejor. Lleva cuatro ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son muy bajos en relación a otras instituciones de crédito.

Su sueño es tener otra  lancha para que su esposo realice sus faenas de pesca.
texts.en:
The “6 de Julio” communal bank meets every two weeks in Los Arenales in Crucita Parish in Portoviejo.  This place is known for its beautiful beaches that are very popular with national and international tourists alike; it offers a diversity of beautiful places and a rich variety of dishes that are typical of the region.

Sonia, 42, lives here.  She’s in a common law relationship and has four children who are 22, 20, 17 and 15 years of age.  The youngest is in secondary school and the two youngest still live at home.  Her husband is a fisherman.

In addition to being a very good housewife, in order to obtain her own resources she decided to clean and filet fish.  In the morning she heads out to the beaches to buy the best fish and then clean it and filet it to take to sell throughout the community or to other merchants who take it to other cities.  She’s been in business over four years and this is how she helps her husband with household expenses.

This loan is to buy fish to sell to her customers the best.  She’s been in four cycles in the communal bank and she likes it because the interest rates are very low in comparison to other lending institutions.  Her dream is to have another boat so that her husband can do his fishing.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Koeun

texts.en:
Koeun (pictured with her loom) is a weaver. Weaving is a traditional professional business. Her husband, Son, is a farmer. She is asking for another loan of $500 to assist in her husband’s farming business by purchasing seed, fertilizer and pesticide for maintenance of his farm. 
The couple has been married since 1978 and have six sons and two daughters. Four are married and live outside the family home, two are garment workers and the other two attend school. They live on an island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

loans.use: To assist in her husband’s farming business by buying seed, fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en: Godfrey is 30 years old, married and the father of four children. They live in Hoima, Uganda. He owns a retail shop dealing in radio sales which he has been operating for eight months. He faces the challenge of inadequate capital. His family goal is to educate his children. His business goal is to expand his business to new markets. Godfrey needs a loan to buy radios to sell.

loans.use: to buy radios to sell.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia is from the village of Tangub Cty, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 45 years old. To make a living, Emilia owns and operates a "sari-sari" (general store) business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Emilia has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2011, Emilia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emilia has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Emilia is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Emilia from GDMPC. In the future, Emilia wants to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. 

Jovelyn buys and sells fish in the community. She has had this business for two years. 

She requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy fish to resell.

Jovelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Jovelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Buzurgmehr

texts.en: Buzurgmehr is kind man from a village of north Tajikistan. He is 38 years old. He is married and has 3 children. His wife is housewife. Buzurgmehr 13 years ago began his business with animal husbandry. He feeds cows. He buys cows, feeds some months and sells it in a local market. He always uses his income for providing family with all necessary things. Buzurgmehr is going to repair the roof of his house. The roof of his house has bad condition. He is asking for a loan of 1000 USD to buy slate for repairing the roof of his house. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy slate for repairing the roof of his house

loans.name: Lilliam Damarys

texts.es:
Lilliam Damaris, es muy joven, ella es madre  soltera de tres hijos menores de edad por quienes lucha a diario para darles educaciones. Cuenta con una pequeña ayuda de su ex esposo pero no es suficiente para los gastos.  Al quedar  sola con sus hijos inició su pequeño negocio desde hace tres años vendiendo quesillo en su casa pero no tuvo mucha demanda entonces pensó en viajar hasta el Mercado de Juigalpa donde ha tenido aceptación por las personas que trafican el lugar, al inicio en esta ubicacion vendía 100 quesillos al día ahora vende trescientos y así va poco a poco, pasa algunas dificultades por tener que viajar diario desde las cuatro de la mañana para poder realizar sus ventas antes de las dos pm luego regresa a su domicilio en Santo Tomas a unos 20 Km de distancia para preparar la venta del día siguiente así es como ella realiza su negocio de donde obtiene el sustento diario.  
Lilliam actualmente alquila donde habita, pero ya empezó a construir su vivienda con las ganancias de sus Ventas de quesillo,  aun le faltan detalles para terminarla completamente, con el Crédito anterior  instalo el servicio de Energía Eléctrica que no lo tenía, ahora este crédito lo solicita para Invertir en su Negocio en comprar Toldo, mesas sillas, manteles, Termo plástico Grande y Sombrilla Playera para hacer más atractivo su negocio y llamar más clientes, además brindar comodidad, pues el negocio lo tiene en un andén bajo la sombra de un árbol estando expuesta a las altas temperaturas del Sol o las lluvias, por esta razón necesita invertir y sacar adelante su negocio para el bien de su Familia.

Anhela ver su casa terminada 100% y en condiciones habitables para trasladarse con sus hijos a su vivienda propia que con dignidad y sacrificio ha venido construyendo y espera con otro crédito futuro cumplir su sueño.

loans.use: Comprar equipos y materiales para su negocio, Sillas, Plásticas, Toldo y otros que necesita en su pequeño negocio de venta de quesillos

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase her business stock by purchasing shoes, lingerie and Soft furnishing.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en: Faustina operates a wholesale shop at Pokuase, Accra, Ghana. She sells provisions and soft drinks. She wants to buy more items for her shop. She is seeking a loan of $800.00 from Kiva.

loans.use: To expand product line

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The loan will be used to purchase leather and fabrics, which are the base products needed for him to make his crafts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand her fruit-selling business

loans.name: Ulyana

texts.en:
Ulyana is married with two twin sons. She lives in Stryi, Western Ukraine. Ulyana sells men’s clothing and knitted wear in the city market. Her business stall is well known for having a good selection of inventory and reasonable prices. Ulyana has been in this trade for 10 years. Currently, she has about $3000 in inventory. Her gross income is about $1400 and her monthly net profit is about $400. Ulyana has repaid 4 loans from Nadiya Ukraine without any delinquencies.   

She is requesting a loan of $500 to re-stock her inventory before the fall season so she can increase her income. She wants to invest her profit in her sons’ college education. She believes her main goal as a Mom is to make sure her sons get a good education and do well in life. Moreover, Ulyana wants to provide her family with everything they need and improve their financial situation.

loans.use: To purchase 40 men’s sweaters/pullovers

loans.name: Hang

texts.en: The father was in an accident so now he can no longer work.The mother must work harder to support her family and take care of her husband. She got two loans to add to her capital to sell rice cakes and earned an extra profit of $ 19 in 3 months. Now she wants to borrow the 3rd loan of $ 75 to continue her business to support  5 members of her family. She will pay it back during 5 months.

loans.use: Sell rice cakes

loans.name: Nkechi

texts.en: Nkechi M. is 44 years old, married and has 7 children.  She hails from Okoko in Lagos, Nigeria. She sells foodstuffs.  She learned this from her mother and has been in the business since 2002. She requests a loan of $275 to buy more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.use: To buy more Foodstuffs

loans.name: Sov

texts.en:
Mrs. Sov S., age 27, works with her husband running a butcher shop in her community. They sell pork and beef, and earn about $4 each day of profit. Her one child is too young to attend school.

Mrs. Sov S. requests a loan of $400 to increase the inventory of products to sell so she can meet the demands of the growing day-to-day business. She would like to expand her store so that she can sell more, and thus increase the income for her family. (The picture shows her husband because she was unavailable when the photograph was taken.)

loans.use: Expand the inventory of products for sale in her butcher shop.

loans.name: Khusnul

texts.en: Khusnul, 38, is married to Hamdam and has 3 children aged 14, 10, and 2. Everyday she pushes her wagon carrying 4 gallons of water and sells it door-to-door around the villages, earning $8 a day. She is a member of MBK and asking for a loan of $125 to expand her business and earn more income for her family. She will repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 30 years old. He is married and has two children. One of them is crippled from his birth. The entrepreneur is living in his parents' house with his elderly mother and father. He has a small shop of perfumes, and he applied to borrow $1200 to purchase new and different kinds of perfumes. He wants to make new shelves and improve the shop by painting it in order to expand his project and increase his income. He wants to save for a better life for his family.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new and different kinds of perfumes.

loans.name: Epifania's Group

texts.es:
Amanda, Silvia and Epifania have belonged to the Community Bank “Despertar” (Wake up!) for 8 months, 1 year and 1 year again respectively.

Amanda is married, she is 40 years old and has two children. Amanda sells food as an ambulatory seller in Nery Garcia Zarate market.

On the other hand Silvia is a co-habitee: she is 23 years old and has one son aged 4. Silvia, together with her partner, works as a walking salesperson selling sweatsuits in Santa Clara market: she buys her merchandise in Lima.

Meanwhile Epifania is a widow, she is sixty years old and has 4 children. Epifania sells wood from her house, a product which she acquires from people who deliver it to her house.

Amanda, Silvia and Epifania need loans of 600, 100 and 600 soles respectively, money which will be invested in the purchase of plates, larger pots, tracksuits, coats and wood.

The dreams of Amanda, Silvia and Epifania are to see their children become professionals, to improve their economic situation and to own a grocery store and build a house.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Amanda, Silvia y Epifanía pertenecen al Banco Comunal Despertar hace 8 meses, 1 año, 1 año respectivamente.

Amanda es casada, tiene 40 años y 2 hijos, Amanda vende comida ambulatoriamente en el mercado Nery García Zarate.

Por otro lado Silvia es conviviente, tiene 23 años y 1 hijo de 4 años, Silvia junto a su esposo venden buzos de manera ambulatoria en el mercado Santa Clara, su mercadería lo adquiere en la ciudad de Lima.

Mientras que Epifanía es viuda, tiene 60 años y 4 hijos, Epifanía vende leña en su casa, producto que adquiere de personas que reparten a domicilio.

Amanda, Silvia y Epifanía necesitan préstamos de 600 soles, 1000 soles, 600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de platos, ollas mas grandes, buzos, casacas y leña.

Los sueños de Amanda, Silvia y Epifanía son que sus hijos sean profesionales, mejorar su economía, tener una tienda de abarrotes y construir su casa.

loans.use: Amanda, Silvia y Epifanía need loans of 600 soles, 1000 soles and 600 soles, money which will be invested in the purchase of plates, larger pots, tracksuits, coats and wood.

loans.name: Yeit

texts.en: Mrs. Yeit K. lives in Sambuor Village in Kampong Speu Province. She is 41 and married with two children, one of whom works as a construction worker while the other is studying in state school. Her husband, Vean Phat, is also a construction worker. Mrs. Yeit K. is a farmer who cultivates rice during the monsoon season and grows vegetables during the dry season.  She lacks animals for plowing, and because of the monsoon season coming, it is an immense problem. Since she does not have enough money to buy cows to plow, she asked for a loan. Her husband is on the left of the picture.

loans.use: To buy cows to use for plowing.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
A couple years ago Elizabeth and her husband decided to acquire a vehicle to provide public transportation service in their community and nearby villages. Thanks to this investment they have been able to improve their quality of life and Elizabeth has learned an occupation that benefits their home situation. Nevertheless due to the lack of precaution and service, the vehicle has some maintenance issues that they wish to repair soon and also acquire new tires in order to continue providing their service.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Elizabeth y su esposo hace un par de años decidieron adquirir un vehículo para realizar servicio de transporte público en su comunidad y zonas aledañas. Gracias a esta inversión han podido mejorar su nivel de vida y Elizabeth ha emprendido una ocupación también en beneficio de su hogar.Sin embargo debido a la falta de precaución y chequeo el vehículo ha sufrido algunos desperfectos que desean solucionar cuanto antes y adquirir llantas nuevas para seguir con su labor.

loans.use: Repair her vehicle and acquire new tires

loans.name: Mazakhir

texts.en:
Mazakhir is 59 years old and the father of 3 children. As an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the occupied territory of Azerbaijan, the Kalbadjar region, he and his family are now settled in the Surakhani region.

Mazakhir started his retail business 10 years ago. He needs a loan of $1200 to buy food products to augment his inventory and increase his sales.

loans.use: To buy food products to expand inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in costume jewelry.
