loans.name: Diénabou

texts.fr: Diénabou K. est mariée mère de 05 enfants. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour améliorer les conditions de vie, de santé et de scolarité de ses enfants. Elle veut renforcer le capital de son activité qui consiste à acheter de la graine d’arachide, à la transformer en pate afin de la revendre.  Elle veut aussi en même temps acheter et revendre du nététou (graine d’un arbre transformée en produit alimentaire local), commerce très rentable. <b>Elle compte rembourser en une seule échéance au bout de six mois<b/>.
texts.en:
Diénabou K. is married and the mother of 5 children. She is asking for this loan to improve the living conditions, health, and education of her children. She wants to bolster the working capital of her business which consists in buying peanuts and transforming them into peanut butter which she then sells. At the same time, she wants to sell nététou (the seeds of a tree which are transformed into a local food product), a very lucrative business. She intends to reimburse this loan in one single repayment at the end of 6 months.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of peanuts and transformation into peanut butter for re-sale

loans.name: Sandra Patricia

texts.es:
En el municipio de Ciudad Sandino en Managua, la señora Sandra Calderon se dedica con mucho esfuerzo a su negocio de pulpería atendido por ella misma en su casa de habitación. Como todo negocio en desarrollo, la pulpería de la señora Sandra requiera de inversión y para ello ha buscado el apoyo financiero en Ceprodel para solicitar el crédito para la compra de la mercadería.

Actualmente ella posee un record de dos créditos en Ceprodel y se ha destacado como fiel cliente de la institución por haber cancelado satisfactoriamente sus anteriores créditos.
texts.en:
In the town Cuidad Sandino of Managua, Mrs. Sandra Calderon makes a living by putting forth a strong effort in her business, a small grocery store run from her home. Like all businesses in development, Sandra’s small store requires investment, and for this, she is asking for financial support from Ceprodel by applying for a loan to buy merchandise. Currently, she has a record of two loans from Ceprodel and has stood out as a loyal customer for having sufficiently paid back her previous loans.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Bimize

texts.en:
Bimize H. has been selling clothes and perfume in Zanzibar for 15 years. She is able to earn a monthly profit of approximately $90. She is taking out her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more inventory for her shop and increase her profit.

Bimize is 35 years old, married, and has four children, aged 16, 14, 11, and 3-and-a-half.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and perfume to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
Mrs. Phok O. lives in Preak Thom village in Kandal Province. She is a Khmer cake maker who can make a small income from this business. Her husband, Mr. Suon Chea, is a motorbike taxi driver. They have eight children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory, while another two stay at home and do housework. The fifth child is a construction worker, while the others attend the local school.

Since the first two children's workplace is too far from their house, Mrs. Phok O. spends a lot of money on transportation. In order to reduce her expanses, Mrs. Phok O. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to buy a motorbike for her children to use to go to work. Her husband is present on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To add to her savings to buy a motorbike for her children to use to go to work.

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants, Madame A. Abla, a pour activité principale, le commerce de pagnes. Cette activité très rentable, lui procure le minimum possible pour s’occuper de sa famille. Son mari n’ayant pas d’emploi, n’arrive pas à l’aider dans les besoins de la famille. Ainsi, pour augmenter son revenu et de mieux s’occuper de ses enfants, elle sollicite ce financement pour gonfler son fonds de commerce. Très douée dans la gestion financière, elle est capable gérer son commerce et assurer sa rentabilité.
texts.en:
Mrs. Abla A. is married and the mother of three children, her main activity is the sale of pagnes [Traditional African fabric]. This profitable business brings in just the minimum income to provide for her family. Her husband is unemployed and cannot help her provide for the family's needs. Thus to increase her income and to better take care of her children, she is requesting this loan to increase her business. She is very talented in financial management, and she is able to manage her business and ensure profitability.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of pagnes [Traditional African fabric]

loans.name: At

texts.en:
Mrs. At C., 39, and her husband, Mr. Bros Sun, 45, live in a small village across Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.  They were married in 1983 and have six children: three sons and three daughters. One child is married, two children are fish sellers, one child is a silk weaver, and the other children assist their parents in farming. 

At has been a silk weaver for ten years.  She sells her finished products to a middleman that then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh.  Her husband has been a farmer for twenty years.  He grows sugar cane and other farm crops.  At is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase silk material for weaving; also, part of the loan will be used to grow sugar cane and buy smoked fish for resale.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving, sugar cane for growing and smoked fish for resale.

loans.name: Arnel

texts.en:
Arnel A. is 28 years old and lives in Barangay Lapogan Tumauini, Isabela. He is married to Juanita and they have an eleven-month-old child named Gian Carlo. Arnel works hard in order to support his family. Their source of income is his passenger tricycle.

Arnel is requesting a loan of $150 to maintain his motorcycle. He will also use part of the loan to buy a piglet, which will be raised in their backyard. He hopes to expand his business to improve his family's life. Arnel hopes for his loan request to be granted so he can earn more money and be able to support the educational needs of his children and the basic needs of his family.

loans.use: Maintenance of motorcycle and to buy a piglet

loans.name: Ea

texts.en: EA A. is 45 years old, married and has 4 children. She sells cold drinks. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more drinks to sell. She says "thank you" to the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase drinks

loans.name: Saida

texts.ru: Каримова Саида проживает в городе ТУрсун-Заде. Возраст 37 лет , замужем и имеет шестерых детй. Муж работает в пекарне по выпечке лепешек. Сама занимается торговлей яиц. Занимается этим видом бизнеса один год. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот для себя и закупить муку для деятельности мужа. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Saida K. lives in Tursun-zoda. She is 37 years old, married, and has six children. Her husband works in a bakery making flat bread. She sells eggs. She has been doing this one year. She plans to take out a loan to increase her sales and to buy flour for her husband’s work. She plans to pay off the loan in twelve months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase sales

loans.name: Alma Leticia

texts.es:
La señora Alma Leticia R. tiene ya más de dos años con su negocio de salón de belleza el cual es el ingreso de su familia ya que es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos bajo su responsabilidad. 
Al negocio le está haciendo falta algo de maquinaria y artículos de belleza, pero en esté momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para invertir. Es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar la maquinaria y los artículos que necesita.
texts.en:
Señora Alma Leticia R. is a single mother with two children for whom she is responsible. For more than two years now she has had her beauty parlor which provides her family's income. Her business needs some equipment and beauty products but at the moment she doesn't have the money to obtain them. For this reason she is seeking a loan so that she can buy the equipment and other things that she needs.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products and equipment

loans.name: Sinjiya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  Sinjiya  est  constitué de quatre femmes  mariées (dont deux sont polygames et  les deux autres monogames) qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans et 2 enfants. Elles habitent à Médine un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur troisième  collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de pouvoir combler le vœux de leur clientèle et augmenter leur chiffre d’affaire.
 Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente d’habillements,  de pomme de terre, et de   fruits.
 Avec ce prêt, elles comptent acheter  40 sacs de 100 kg d’oranges, 20 paniers  mange. Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de la ville de Sikasso auprès des grossistes et des producteurs. 
Les marchandises sont vendues au comptant, en détail et à crédit au grand marché de Sikasso ville   et souvent de façon ambulante à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25 000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour aider les maris à subvenir aux charges de famille et  l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The group Sinjiya is composed of four married women (two are polygamous, and the other two are monogamous). They average 36 years of age and 2 children each and live in Médine, a district in Sikasso City, third administrative region of Mali.

The group members are on their third collaboration with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to fulfill the wishes of their customers and to increase their turnover. They do a diversity of work, including the sale of clothing, potatoes, and fruit.

With this loan, they intend to buy forty 100-kg sacks of oranges and twenty baskets of mangoes. Supplies are gotten at the grand marketplace of Sikasso City from wholesalers and producers. The merchandise is sold retail to customers composed of women and men, cash or credit accepted, at the grand marketplace of Sikasso City and often door-to-door.

The group members each envision realizing an average monthly profit of 25,000 francs CFA. A portion of the profits will be used for helping their husbands to meet family expenses, and the other portion will be invested in business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruit

loans.name: Norma Elena

texts.es: la sra NORMA ELENA C. se dedica al comercio, cuenta con un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa actividad a la cual se dedica hace mas de tres años, es madre de 2 hijos,  con los ingresos que le genera este negocio le permite cubrir algunos gastos personales y del hogar, de esta forma contribuye a su esposo para sacar adelante su familia y su casa ya que en estos tiempos se necesita que las dos cabezas del hogar trabajen para salir adelante, nos comento que con este credito que esta solicitando es para invertirlo en su negocio y obtener mejores ganancias ya que tiene que comprar por fardos la ropa y asi sale mucho mas barata y se obtienen muchas ganancias.
texts.en:
Mrs. Norma Elena C. is in commerce, having a small business selling clothes, which she has done for more than three years. She is the mother of two children. With the income that her business generates she is able to cover some personal and household expenses. In this manner she contributes with her husband to get their family ahead. In these times their home requires that both of them work in order to get ahead.

She tells us that this loan that she is asking for is for investing in her business and to have better income. Now she will buy the clothes in bulk and thereby sell them much cheaper which will bring a lot of income.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of clothes in bulk

loans.name: Apai

texts.en:
Apai F. makes a living running a shop where she sells various goods, and is applying for this loan to buy more items to sell to her customers. She is 50 years old, married to a police officer and has four children, one of whom is studying management and information technology while the other three are in primary school. She plans to use the additional income generated by this loan to pay her children's school fees.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education and human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as  measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell in her shop

loans.name: Botir

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 


Джаникулов  Ботир  – мужчина  1959  года  рождения,  женат,  имеет   5  детей.  Занимается  откормом  и  продажей  скота.  Каждое  утро  он  отправляет  скот  на  пастбище  вместе  с  пастухом,  которому  платит  по  договорной  цене.  Его  жена  вместе  с  дочерьми  работает  в  колхозе.  Кроме  того  Джаникулов  Ботир  покупает  у  пастухов  молодых  бычков  по  низкой  цене  и,  откормив,  через некоторое  время  перепродаёт  их  мясникам  по  хорошей  цене.  На  новый  кредит  он  рассчитывает  купить  партию  мелкорогатого  скота  и  отправить  их  на  пастбище  до  осени.  Кроме  того  он  работает  трактористом  в  колхозе.
texts.en:
Botir D. was born in 1959, is married and has five children. He is involved in the care and sale of cattle. Every morning he dispatches the cattle to pasture together with a shepherd, whom he pays an agreed amount. His wife and daughters work in a "kolhoz" (collective farm). Besides that, Botir D. buys young calves from shepherds at low prices, tends them for some time, then resells them to a butcher at a good price. With the new loan, he is considering purchasing a group of small-horn cattle and to send them into the pasture as an investment. Besides this, he works as a tractor operator in a collective farm. --- MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Translated from Russian by JD Bergeron, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Veronica Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Verónica López, tiene la edad de 42 años, reside en el barrio Memorial Sandino, casada y con un hijo de 18 años de edad, que estudia, su esposo es albañil, doña Verónica trabaja como conserje en una empresa privada desde hace tres años. Lo difícil es que no le han aumentado su salario. Este es su tercer ciclo en Afodenic el cual da las gracias por el apoyo de prestar a plazos para llevar a cabo sus objetivos de hacer mejoras a su vivienda, con este crédito va invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción para repellar su cuarto. Sus planes es poder cambiar de trabajo donde gane mejor y le permita sastifacer sus necesidades.
texts.en:
42-year old Señora Verónica López lives in the neighbourhood of Memorial Sandino. She is married and has an 18-year old son who is a student. Her husband is a bricklayer. Verónica has been working as a janitor in a private company for three years. The problem is that her wages have not increased. This is her third loan with Kiva partner Afodenic; Verónica is very grateful that she can pay off her loan in instalments and achieve her goal of improving her home. She plans to use the money to buy building material and plaster the walls of her bedroom. In the future she would like to change job where she will earn more money and allow her to buy the things she needs.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy building material

loans.name: Neves

texts.pt:
Neves K. nasceu na província de tete (dista a 1600 km a norte de Maputo) tem 48 anos de idade, casado e pai de 6 filhos todos em idade escolar.

Neves saiu da província de tete no ano de 1977 para maputo onde mais tarde foi incorporado para o serviço militar obrigatório, continua soldado efectivo nas forcas armadas de Moçambique e exerce a tarefa de administrativo no quartel de boane. Continua a estudar estando a frenquentar a 10 clssse na escola secundária Joaquim chissano de Boane. Tem um salário mensal no valor de 6.000,00MT que dedica para o sustento da família (esposa e os seus 6 filhos) e uma parte paga a divida.
Neves conheceu a Hluvuku-Adsema desde a sua implantação no distrito de boane através de informações obtidas dos colegas.

Nunca tinha tido empréstimos com outras instituições. Com a Hluvuku-Adsema, toma o quarto credito no valor de 20.000,00MT para compra de materiais de construção da sua casa. Os primeiros créditos também foram para compra de materiais (7.500,00MT; 9.000,00MT e 15.000,00MT, respectivamente).

Já reuniu boa parte de material que é ampliar a sua moradia. Propõe se a pagar sem problemas para no futuro mais breve, para criação de frangos de corte assim como agricultura de rendimento.
texts.en:
Neves K. was born in the province of Tete, 1600 km north of Maputo. He is 48 years old and married, and has six school-age children. Neves left Tete in 1977 for Maputo, and was then drafted for compulsory military service. He is still a soldier in Mozambique's armed forces and is commander of the Boane headquarters. He is still in school, attending 10th grade classes in Joaquim Chissano School in Boane. He earns 6000 meticals a month, which he uses to support his wife and six children, and to pay off his debts. Neves has known about Hluvuku-Adsema since he was stationed in Boane. He heard about it through his colleagues. He's never received loans from other institutions. This is his fourth loan with Hluvuku-Adsema, in the amount of 20,000 meticals to buy materials to build his house. His prior loans were also for this purpose (7500, 9000, and 15,000 meticals, respectively). He has already acquired a good bit of the materials needed to expand his house. He intends to pay off his loan quickly and without difficulty, and will raise chickens to subsist.

Translated from Portuguese by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Greetings from Emmanuel S. in Gicumbi District, Byumba Sector, Ruhengeli Province. This 41-year-old married father of three children aged 13, 10, and 7 also takes care of four other persons who are 35, 25, 20, and 16 years of age.

This entrepreneur owns a small shop where he has sold spare parts for the past five years. Assisted by one employee, he works daily from 7 a.m to 6 p.m., earning a monthly profit of 20000 Rwandan francs. Emmanuel is requesting a loan worth 500000 Rwf from Vision Finance Company to expand his store and pay school fees.

loans.use: Expanding his store

loans.name: Rosabella S.

texts.en: Rosabella C. is from the village of Taguima, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Rosabella owns and operates a business providing hairdressing and beauty services to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over thirty-two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Rosabella joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase materials needed to provide service. Rosabella is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be her 2nd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy palm nuts to produce palm oil

loans.name: The Five Trusted Brothers Group

texts.en: Anthony N., a 30-year-old high school graduate who is preparing for college, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called The Five Trusted Brothers. He is married with two children. His children are three and six years old and attend Kindergarten and first grade. Anthony and his family live around the Sea Port of Monrovia, Liberia. Buying used clothing wholesale, selling at retail is the business Anthony and his family depends on to take care of their daily expenses. By introducing new goods to the market, Anthony attracts customers. Anthony has been running this business for eight years and hopes to become an importer of used clothing to Liberia. Anthony needs this loan to increase his capital in order to accomplish his goal. He dreams of educating his children and preparing them for the future.

loans.use: To increase his capital

loans.name: Phorn

texts.en: Mrs. Phorn L. lives in Tralach village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. On this plantation, she faces an obstacle because her field has infertile soil. In order to deal this problem, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and a water pump to support her plantation. Her husband, Mr. Pen Vang, is a village chief. Mrs. Phorn L. is 47 years old and the mother of seven children. Two of them are employed in a garment factory, two are employed in Thailand, one is a soldier and the others are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is presented with her in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and a water pump

loans.name: Ibrahima

texts.fr:
M. Ibrahima T. est un pécheur et commerçant à Ouakam, Dakar.  La péche est son activité principale, mais avec ce crédit il voudrait investir dans son activité secondaire: le commerce de tissus.  Il voudrait faire une mission au Mali, le pays voisin, pour chercher des tissus de hautes qualités, en particulier les Thioup (les tissus teintés).  Cette diversification de revenus, M. T. espére qu'il va lui permettre de survenir aux besoins de sa femme et de ses six enfants.

Le poisson sur la photo est un exemple magnifique de Thiof – un poisson vraiment aimé par les senegalais.
texts.en:
Mr. Ibrahima T. is a fisherman and a trader in Oukam, Dakar. Fishing is his main business but with the loan he would like to invest in fabric trading, his minor business. He would like to make a business trip to Mali, a neighboring country, to look for high quality fabrics especially 'Thioup' (tye and dye fabrics). Mr. T. hopes that this diversification of income will enable him to provide for the needs of his wife and six children. The photo of the fish is a magnificent example of Thiof, a fish that Senegalese really love.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fabrics to diversify his income

loans.name: Soeu

texts.en: Like many Cambodians, Mrs. Soeu S. is a rice cultivator.  She has been working in this sector since 2000. She and her husband were married a year ago and have no children. They grow rice on their own farmland, which they inherited from their grandparents. From this business they generate an income of around US $3 per day. Soeu S. is requesting a loan for her husband to buy a bamboo ladder to climb palm trees and tap palm juice, which he will then sell. Her husband is pictured in this photo.

loans.use: to buy a bamboo ladder to climb a palm tree and tap palm juice

loans.name: Apolonio Daniel

texts.es: El Sr. Apolonio T. tiene 42 años de edad vive en casa propia en el Caserío Puno distrito de Santiago junto a su esposa y sus dos menores hijos. Trabaja en una Empresa Agrícola denominada Agro Victoria desempeñando la labor de encargado de almacén desde hace ocho años.Su esposa se dedica a la crianza de animales de granja en su casa. Son personas muy trabajadoras que se vieron afectadas por el terremoto ya que su casa es de caña y adobe. Actualmente han sido beneficiados con la construcción de un módulo de material noble gracias a ONG  Caritas del Perú y requiere apoyo para cubrir gastos de mano de obra para la colocación de puertas y ventanas. Su sueño es terminar de construir su vivienda para poder brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. Ambos agradecen el apoyo que le podamos brindar a través de financiamientos para el mejoramiento de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mr. Apolonio T. is 42 years old and lives in his own house in the Puno settlement, District of Santiago, with his wife and his two young children. He works in the Agro Victoria Agricultural Enterprise, in charge of a warehouse for the past 8 years. His wife raises farm animals at home.

They are hard working people who were affected by an earthquake and their house is made of cane and mud. At present, they have benefited from the construction of a modular home with decent materials, thanks to Caritas of Peru, and require help to cover the costs of labor to install doors and windows.

His dream is to finish construction of this house in order to offer a better quality of life to their children. Both are grateful for the help they may receive by means of financing for improvements on their home.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: IMPROVEMENTS TO THEIR MODULAR HOME

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en: Faustina is thirty-six years old. She is married and has given birth to three children who are all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Axim. Axim is along the coastal area in the western region of Ghana. Fishing is the major occupation of the people. Faustina is a food vendor. She prepares and sells rice with stew. Faustina also runs a provision store. She has been in business for seven years and wants a loan to buy bags of rice and other ingredients in bulk.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina, vive en la calle Uruguay de la zona Urbanización Mercurio de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Vive junto a su esposo y sus hijos menores  con los cuales trabaja, en su propio domicilio.


Tiene una pequeña planta donde elabora frituras  (papitas fritas, postres fritos, en bolsitas), de manera artesanal, los cuales los distribuye en los varios kioskos que existen en la ciudad de El Alto. 

El crédito lo destinará para la compra de insumos, papa, postre, etc. Al por mayor, y así mejorar sus ventas.

Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgar el crédito.
texts.en:
Paulina lives on Uruguay Street in the Ubanización Mercurio area of the city of El Alto. She lives in her own home with her husband and their children, with whom she works. She has a small plant where she makes fried foods (fried potatoes, fried desserts in little bags) by hand. She distributes them to the various kiosks that exist in the city of El Alto. The loan is to buy supplies, potatoes, and desserts, etc. wholesale. That way she will improve her sales. This is her first loan with Impro. The completed evaluation qualifies her for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy potatoes and desserts (bananas) to make snacks to sell

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Margarita es socia del Banco Comunal “Alto Alianza” desde hace 3 años, vive en el distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene 34 años de edad, es casada y tiene 02 hijos. Ella estudió secundaria completa, se dedica a la compra y venta de zapatillas.

Margarita nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles con el cual podrá comprar zapatillas de diversas tallas y modelos.

Su sueño para el futuro es hacer crecer su negocio y así progresar junto a su familia.

Lo que mas le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las capacitaciones que da la promotora.
texts.en:
Miss Margarita has been a member of the Community Bank "Alto Alianza” for the last 3 years, She lives in the district and province of Yunguyo, state of Puno. She is 34 years old, married and has 2 children. She finished high school and is dedicated to the purchase and sale of shoes. ;

Margaret tells us that with the first loan requested to the Manuela Ramos group, which was for 300 nuevos soles; she was able to increase the working capital. She is requesting a loan for $350 which she will invest in the purchase of shoes of different sizes and styles.

Her dream for the future is to grow her business and progress with her family. What she likes the best about her Community Bank is the training that they give.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: COMPRA DE ZAPATILLAS

loans.name: Minh's Group

texts.en:
Minh Thị Nguyễn (id: 010107050021) was born in 1955 and has two children. Currently, she is living in Văn Thượng village earning a living as a kindergarten teacher. Even though it doesn’t bring her a decent salary (only 2,600,00 VND in total), it’s the career that she has been following since her twenties.

Starting in 2006, in order to increase her income, Minh joined SEDA to borrow money for raising chickens. At the present time, she would like to take out a loan of 5,450,000 VND (approximately 300 USD) to invest in her business, hoping that it will make a profit so that her family may afford to buy more furniture.

Minh is leading a group that includes the following four other members:

Tuyết Ánh Thị Nguyễn (id: 010107050024) is 30 years old. She would like to borrow 5,014,000 VND (approximately 275 USD) to invest in selling flowers.

Doan Thị Hoàng (id: 010107050022) is 43 years old. She also wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND (approximately 275 USD) to invest in selling flowers.

Cúc Thị Hoàng (id: 010107050033) is 52 years old. She needs to take out a loan of 5,014,000 VND (approximately 275 USD) to invest in selling fast food.

Xuyên Thị Hoàng (id: 010107050023) is 40 years old. She would like to borrow 5,014,000 VND (approximately 275 USD) to buy groceries to sell.

loans.use: To invest in her business

loans.name: Gavharoy

texts.en:
K. Gavharoy operates a small business selling blankets, towels, and tablecloths and supplies in Istaravshan, Tajikistan. She has an attractively arranged store at Dushanbe market where she carries all sorts of necessary items. Gavharoy has been in this business for about six years and has developed a stable, profitable enterprise based on products that are always in demand. Her business has become the main source of income for her and her family. Gavharoy’s business is growing. She has requested a loan of $1500 USD to increase her working capital and help boost the further development of her business. With your help, this will be possible.   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase blankets, towels and tablecloths to sell

loans.name: Flor De María

texts.es:
La señora Flor de María, se dedica a la Venta de Ropa, todos los días se ubica en puesto fijo en el mercado la terminal – León, oferta su producto desde temprana hora finalizando al medio día ,la tarde es dedicada a su familia. 
Este crédito que solicito es  para aumentar su inventario para ofertar a su clientela variedad de productos con el objetivo de satisfacer la necesidad de  sus clientes.
texts.en:
Flor de María sells clothing every day in a stall in the Terminal-León Market, where she offers her products from early in the morning until mid-day. In the afternoons, she spends time with her family.

She seeks this loan in order to increase her inventory to offer her clients a wider variety of products and thus satisfy their needs.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of blouses, t-shirts, ankle bracelets, and undergarments

loans.name: Mrs. Phea Long Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan is made up of 15 people who are villagers in Kam Nab village in Kandal province. Mrs. Phea L. is the village bank president who has been selected by all the members. The members will use their loans for different purposes.
Mrs. Phea L. is a farmer who owns a 1.5-hectare piece of land to cultivate rice to support her family. She is a widow who lives with her four children, two of whom are seamstresses in a garment factory while the other two attend the local public school. They work hard but do not earn sufficient income. Therefore, Mrs. Phea L. has decided to ask for a loan to buy some chickens for breeding to start a new business.

All the members of the group are shown in the picture, but some of them are obscured.

loans.use: To buy some chickens for breeding

loans.name: Phait

texts.en:
Mrs. S., 53, is a farmer who grows rice in the village, in Phnom Penh City. She has been growing rice since 2000. She is married and lives with her husband and five children. One is a garment laborer. Another daughter is a hairdresser and helps provide support for this loan repayment. Her husband is assisting her at the farming activity.

S. sees that her daughter's hairdressing business is very profitable, thus she hopes to enlarge this business. Because S. doesn’t have money, she is looking to assist her daughter in the improvement of her salon shop and to purchase more salon equipment for her services.

loans.use: To purchase more salon equipment for her daughter's salon shop

loans.name: Mela

texts.en: Mela P. runs a sari-sari (variety retail shop) selling both food and daily use products in her community. She is 44 years old, married and has four grown-up children.They are from the village of Kalawaig, Banisilan, Cotabato. Mela has been in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Mela joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Mela has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Mela is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower from Lebanon is a 23-year-old, single man. He is living with 6 family members: his parents and 4 siblings. Three of his siblings are not working. He has been running a ladies beauty salon since 2004.  

He is requesting a loan of $1,000 from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l. This will be his first loan from Ameen. He is planning to use the loan to enhance his salon’s décor as well as purchase new merchandise for his work. 

Note: Based on the politicA. and sociA. challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.). Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loan from Kiva to offer lower interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high quality financiA. services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling US $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit: http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: to decorate his salon and purchase new merchandise

loans.name: Abla Alaba

texts.en: Abla Alaba was born in 1956. She is married to a teacher and they have 3 children. Abla Alaba makes bread, yams, and other traditional Togolaise food that she sells from her stall outside her home. She has requested a loan of 200,000 CFA to purchase yams, oil, and other products she uses to make her cuisine.

loans.use: To purchase yams, oil, and other products.

loans.name: Gideon Meteurr

texts.en:
Gideon Meteurr K. is 58 years old. He is married to Joice K. and is the father of six children.

Gideon is a small-scale farmer and he does the farming on his own piece of land which he has been doing for the last six years.

Gideon learned about KADET through a friend who is already a registered member of KADET. This will be Gideon’s first loan which he is planning to use to plant more maize which normally does well in his area due to good climatic conditions.

Gideon hopes to use the profit from the loan to expand his farming activity from small-scale to commercial farming. His dream is do large-scale farming and attain financial independence. 

Gideon is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: To prepare five acres of land for planting more maize

loans.name: Dora Elizabeth

texts.es:
Dora tiene 42 años de edad, reside en San Miguel, es casada tiene dos hijos vannesa y David de 14 y 16 respectiva, están estudiando, se dedica a elaboración y venta pupusas (tortilla de maíz con queso y chicharon).
Dora necesita el préstamo para la compra de materiales para la elaboración de pupusas (harina de maíz, aceite, queso, carne de cerdo, gas, cafe, cholate), con la compra de estos productos considera que contribuirá a continuar con su negocio, para que generar ingresos y solventar las necesidades de su familia. 
Su objetivo es tener más clientes y ofrecer nuevos productos, mejorar los ingresos de su negocio para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Dora is 42 years old, she resides in San Miguel and is married and has two children, Vannesa and David ages 14 and 16 respectively. They are studying. She is in the business of preparing and selling pupusas (corn tortillas with cheese and pork rinds). Dora needs the loan to buy cooking ingredients for making pupusas (corn flour, oil, cheese, pork, cooking gas, coffee and cholate). With the purchase of these products, she feels it will contribute to her continuing her business, generate earnings and cover her family's needs. Her objective is to have more clients and to offer new products, improving her earnings and the quality of her family's life.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purhase of corn flour, oil, cheese, pork, cooking gas, coffee and cholate.

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry C. is from the village of  Gingoog  City. She is 37 years old. Cherry is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Cherry owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Cherry has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Cherry joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cherry has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Cherry is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Cherry from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth C. is from the village of Rizal, Lopez Jaena. She is 57 years old. Elizabeth is married and has six adult children. To make a living, Elizabeth owns and operates a business selling home products. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling personal home products to tourists and local community members. Elizabeth has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Elizabeth joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Elizabeth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Elizabeth is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Elizabeth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Jehova Nice Group

texts.es:
Ángela Dominga M. encabeza el grupo Jehová Nice, ella tiene una pulpería en su casa, la cual inició hace más de 12 años y ha evolucionado y cambiado mucho con el paso de los años y la experiencia adquirida, hoy en día dicho negocio no se parece en nada a esos pocos productos que tenía en la puerta esperando todo el día clientes que los comprarán.

Antonia Hernández Alonso también tiene una pulpería en su casa y a sus 68 años sueña aún convertirla en una distribuidora; por otro lado María Magdalena López Fuentes se dedica a la venta de casi todo lo que es derivado del maíz, tortilla, masa, cosa de horno, elote, chicha, etcétera. Estas mujeres utilizarán el dinero producto del crédito otorgado para la compra de más materiales e insumos para la producción de sus productos.
texts.en:
Ángela Dominga M. heads up the group Jehová Nice. She has a grocery store in her house which she began more than 12 years ago. It has evolved and changed greatly over the years and with the experience she has acquired. Today the business looks nothing like the one with the few products that used to be sold, when Ángela used to spend all day waiting in the doorway for customers to buy things. Antonia Hernández Alonso also has a grocery store in her house. At 68 she dreams of converting it into a distributorship. María Magdalena López Fuentes works selling maize and related products, such as tortillas, dough, oven products, corncobs, maize liquor etc. These women will use the granted loan to purchase more materials and goods to make their products.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is married and has three children, all of whom are still in school. He earns a living by running a retail store, and has one employee who works for him. He is also a part-time farmer, an occupation which he shares with his wife. Joseph dreams of becoming a retailer, and is applying for a loan for 70,000 Kes to expand his business. By taking this step, he hopes to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Mariano

texts.es:
Mariano tiene 62 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a sus hermanas en la ciudad de Ferreñafe, ubicada a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se ha dedicado durante casi toda su vida a la agricultura, el cuenta con un terreno de cultivo en donde suele sembrar cultivos como camote, frijol y pallar. En esta oportunidad el ha instalado pallar y actualmente trabaja a diario para poder segurarse una buena producción, ya que de estos ingresos depende el sustento de su familia.

Mariano desea asegurarse una buena producción, para lo cual ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le permitan adquirir abonos y foliares con los cuales la producción de su parcela quede asegurada.

El ya ha trabajado anteriormente con el fondo Kiva y nos cuenta que gracias al préstamo brindado su cultivo anterior pudo producir del modo esperado. Mariano tiene muy buenas referencias entre sus vecinos, tanto de la ciudad como del campo, los cuales lo consideran una persona muy responsable y trabajadora.
texts.en:
Mariano is 62 years old, he is single and lives with his sisters in the town of Ferreñafe, located 15 minutes away from the town of Chiclayo. For almost all of his life he has engaged in agriculture: he owns some land where he generally plants crops such as sweet potatoes, beans and lima beans. In this occasion he has sown lima beans and he is currently working daily in order to get a good production, as his family’s livelihood depends on the income of this activity. Mariano wishes to make sure his production will be good, and for this reason he thought it wise to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 PEN: he will use it to buy fertilizers and plant nutrients which will guarantee the productiveness of his land. He has already worked with Kiva, and he says that thanks to the loan he had received his previous crops could grow and produce as expected. Mariano has good references from both his country and his town neighbors, who consider him a very responsible and hard-working person.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and plant nutrients to care for and protect his crops.

loans.name: Gumercindo

texts.es: Gumercindo Macías S. es un comerciante y agricultor de 50 años de edad y junto a su esposa y sus seis hijos reside en la comunidad de Las Guacamayas, Manto, Olancho.  Gumercindo se dedica a la agricultura desde hace mucho tiempo atrás y un día su esposa le sugirió que con las ganancias que él estaba obteniendo debían instalar una pequeña pulpería en su casa de habitación y así tener una entrada de dinero más para poder brindarles a sus hijos todo lo básico y necesario para su sostenimiento. Ahora él tiene su pulpería y cuando tiene que ir a revisar su cultivo, su esposa o sus hijos le ayudan a atenderla. El préstamo lo solicita para comprar una mayor y variada cantidad de productos de abarrotería y así mantener bien surtida su pulpería. Con el apoyo de este préstamo él podrá seguir apoyando a sus hijos para que sigan estudiando y seguir teniendo una fuente de ingreso. Es su segundo ciclo en  FAMA y espera seguir pagando puntualmente sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Gumercindo Macías S. is a 50-year-old merchant and farmer. He lives with his wife and their six children in the community of Las Guacamayas (the Scarlet Macaw) in Manto, Olancho.

Gumercindo had been farming for a long time when one day his wife suggested that he use his profits to set up a small store in their home. This would provide an additional source of income and help provide all their children’s basic and necessary needs. Now he has his store and when he needs to tend to his crops, his wife and children help him take care of it.

The loan request will be used to buy a larger and more varied quantity of grocery products to keep the store well stocked. The support of this loan will enable him to continue supporting the children in their studies and still have a source of income. This is his second lending cycle with FAMA and he expects to continue making regular repayments.

loans.use: Comprar abarroteria en general

loans.name: Samoeu

texts.en:
Mrs. Samoeu L., 50, and her husband, Mr. Phany Chhauk, 53, have two children-a son who is in university, and a daughter who assists her parents in the business. The family lives in a village aL. National Road Number Two about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Samoeun and her husband grow and sell small trees and flowers at their home. She is now requesting a loan of $600 to pay school fees for her son and grow more small trees and flowers to sell.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her son and grow small trees and flowers for sale.

loans.name: Erlinda Isabel

texts.es: La Señora Erlinda Isabel C. U. es comerciante del Mercado central su negocio es el de venta de verduras es madre de 2 hijos que están a su cargo y por los que lucha para sacarlos adelante estos financiamientos  los ha solicitado para invertirlo en su negocio y comprar tomate, piña, cebolla, chiltoma. La señora C. U. se siente muy agradecida con Ceprodel ya que le hemos ayudado cuando nos ha necesitado y su negocio ha incrementado bastante sus ventas y sus ganancias las cuales las ha invertido en su casa y con su familia para salir adelante poco a poco
texts.en: Mrs. Erlinda Isabel C. U. is a merchant in the Central Market.  She sells vegetables.  She is the mother of two children who are at home and these are why she struggles to get ahead.  She has requested the loans to use for her business by buying tomatoes, pineapples, onions and sweet peppers.  Mrs C. U. feels very appreciative of Ceprodel since we have helped her when she needed it.  Her business has grown substantially both in sales and in income-which she has used for her house and so that her family will have a better standard of living little by little.

loans.use: To buy vegetables: tomatoes, onions, sweet peppers, limes, etc.

loans.name: Kalsoom's Group

texts.en:
Kalsoom comes from Mianchannu which is a small city in Punjab, Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry. She lives there in a single-room brick house with her family in the area called Shamspura. She moved here 12 years ago. She is a housewife and stays at home to do her household responsibilities. She is a very good mother who is raising her son very well. Her son is 6 years old and has not started getting an education yet. 

Her husband is a private entrepreneur and involved in rice selling. He has a shop in the market and offers his customers different qualities of rice. He imports rice from a city  called Kamokay which is famous for its rice growing. He has been doing this business for over 6 years and getting good income from it every month. 

Kalsoom has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy more rice to sell in his shop. She is hopeful that through this loan investment, her husband will successfully be able to increase his monthly income by increasing his sales. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application.

loans.use: To buy rice for resale

loans.name: Lorena Pilar

texts.es:
Lorena Pilar M. P. tiene 24 años. Vive en Unión Libre, vive con el compañero y los hijos viven  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 3 hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDOS SOMO MAS, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto el Marañon, por la parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo viejo, esta ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz fréjol. 

Lorena  se dedica de manera especial al cultivo de maíz, arroz y fréjol desde hace 2 años. Los productos lo comprar en Comercial López en Ventanas y los vende en el mercado de Ventanas y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener casa propia.
Le gusta cocinar toda clase de comidas.
texts.en:
Lorena Pilar M. P. is 24 years old. She has a common-law marriage and lives with her partner and children in the canton of Ventanas, located in the Los Ríos province. She has three children.

The members of the Unidos Somos Más solidarity group are located in the Marañon area, in the Puerto Pechiche parish which is part of the canton of Pueblo Viejo. This rural cooperative works in short cycle farming planting corn, rice, and beans.

Lorena has worked growing corn, rice and beans especially for the past two years. She buys her products in Comercial López in Ventanas and sells them in the Ventanas market and in the same area.

She is requesting the loan for the purchase of farming supplies and fertilizers for her crops. The loan support will help her financially to meet her needs. She faces challenges such as pests, diseases, and the change in climate. Her dream is to have her own house.

She likes to cook all types of food.

loans.use: Agricultural supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated an open-air food business for the past three years, selling from home to her neighbors, passersby, and school-going children. The major challenge Mwanasiti faces in her business is seasonality. She hopes to be self-reliant in the future.

With the 35,000 KES she wants to purchase stock of food, maize flour, wheat flour, and rice. She decided to join Yehu to get a loan to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase stock of food, maize flour, wheat flour, and rice

loans.name: Jacha Taki Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal  “Jacha Taki” está solicitando su primer crédito en el centro focal de Cascada, un total de  8  socias integran este grupo.
Los negocios de las señoras son diferentes, como por ejemplo: tienda de carnicería, venta de mote y condimentos, tejido de chompas, macramé por encargo, venta de sombreros, costura de polleras, elaboración de colchones, venta de cemento – ladrillo -  estuco, tienda de barrio, macramé.

La Banca Comunal Jacha Taki está dirigida por una mesa directiva, a la cabeza se encuentra la presidenta, la señora  Eugenia.

La señora Eugenia tiene un hogar conformado por su esposo y sus dos hijos.   El negocio de la señora Eugenia es la venta de carne de res.  Ha iniciado este negocio por necesidad hace unos seis meses, ella piensa que con el crédito puede comprar mayor cantidad de carne.  El lugar de venta esta en su propio domicilio, por ello la venta es realizada todos los días de 8:00 a 20:00, cuando es necesario le colaboran sus hijos. Este tipo de negocio le permite atender su hogar y cuidar a sus hijos.

Cuando le consultamos a la señora Eugenia sobre lo que le gusta de Pro Mujer ella responde que es la reunión de pago.
texts.en:
The "Jacha Taki" communal bank, comprised of eight members, is requesting its first loan through the Cascada center.  The ladies have different businesses such as: butcher shop, corn and condiments sales, knitted jackets, macramé orders, hat manufacturer, seamstress, mattress maker, cement, brick and plaster sales, and neighborhood store.

The Jacha Taki community bank is governed by a board of directors with Mrs. Eugenia as their chairwoman.

Eugenia lives with her husband and two children.  She began her business of selling beef some six months ago.  She plans to use the loan to buy more meat.  She runs her store out of her own home between 8:00 a.m. and 8:00 p.m., and sometimes requires the help of her children.  The income is used to help with household expenses and caring for her children.

When we asked Eugenia what she liked about Pro Women she responded by saying it was mainly the payment meeting.

loans.use: To buy meat

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: Keo K. is 38 years old and has been selling a few fresh fish and vegetables in her community for more than 10 years. She sells fish that she buys from other fishermen in bulk for reasonable prices and sells it out to gain profit. She is married to Chein Tin, 44, who works at a construction field as a building worker, as well as being a local chef. Due to the fact that the rice-harvesting season is coming, Keo K. has decided to seek a loan on Kiva for capital to buy more rice while it is commanding its lowest price. Then she will sell it later when the price is increasing.

loans.use: To buy rice to stock while prices are low for future sales

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia es socia del Banco Comunal Granito de Mostaza, tiene 40 años y es soltera. Tiene una bodega en la que vende gas y aguas gaseosas. Ella solicita un préstamo para invertir en la compra de mercaderia para su negocio.
sonia está en Finca desde hace 2 ciclos, ingreso por la invitación de su prima y le gusta por la capacitaciones que recibe de la institución. En Finca aprendió a ahorrar a veces en la casa no se puede, le gusta porque se práctica mucho los valores, el compañerismo entre las socias.
Su sueño es poder ampliar su negocio, construir su casa y formar una familia.
texts.en:
Sonia is a member of the communal bank named Granito de Mostaza (meaning Little Grain of Mustard). She is 40 years old and she is single. She has a store from where she sells propane gas and soft drinks. She requests a loan to invest in the purchase of merchandise for her business. 

Sonia has been a member of Finca (Kiva Field Partner) for the past 2 cycles. She joined following an invitation from her cousin. She enjoys taking part for the training that she receives from the organization. It was through Finca that she learned to save money because sometimes at home it is not possible. She enjoys it for its values and for the collegiality among the members. 

Her dream is to expand her business, to build a house and to start a family.

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks and other merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Fatimata Malick

texts.fr: Madame Fatimata Malick S. est une jeune dame de 29 ans qui habite à Yoff depuis des années. Depuis plus de 3 ans madame S. s’adonne à la vente de jus et de glace. Auparavant elle  était habituée  à  vendre des produits divers. Elle a choisi cette activité sur recommandation de son mari. Elle est surtout intéressée par la réalisation de bénéfices que lui procure son activité. Elle est membre du guichet de Yoff depuis juin 2010. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs  dans le but d’acheter une petite machine qui lui permet de conditionner ses sachets de jus. Son but est de mieux développer son activité, accroitre ses bénéfices et améliorer les conditions sociales de sa famille.
texts.en: Mrs Fatimata Malick S. is a young lady of 29 years who has lived in Yoff for years. She has been selling juice and ice for over three years. Before that, she used to sell various products. She began her new activity because her husband recommended it to her. She is especially motivated by the profit that she earns in her business. She has been a member of our branch in Yoff since June 2010. She applies for a loan of 100,000 CFA francs to buy a small machine to fill juice into small bags. Her aim is to better develop her activity, increase her profit and improve the social condition of her family.

loans.use: To buy a machine

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” SEÑOR D. LOS MILAGROS D. CHIMPAHUAYLLA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. San Jerónimo,  perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Isabel; la socia tiene 52 años D. edad, conviviente y tiene 6 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades con el negocio D. compra y venta D. ganados (corderos) ella lleva años en este negocio trabajando conjuntamente con su pareja, a la vez la socia tiene su picantería lugar donD. venden platos a base D. carne D. cordero y vaca también venD. chicha (hecha a base D. jora) y cerveza, ambos negocios realiza la socia los cuales son negocios que le gustan mucho.

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar más insumo para su picantería como aceite, maíz, azúcar, arroz, papas entre otros más.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Señor D. Chimpahuaylla” communal bank. The bank is located in the district of San Jerónimo, which belongs to the province of Cusco, in the department of Cusco.

The member is Isabel. She is 52 years old, lives with her partner, and has 6 children. She alternates her daily activities with her business of buying and selling sheep. She has been in this business for years, working together with her partner. She also has a small restaurant where she sells meals of mutton and beef. She also sells corn chicha [mildly alcoholic  home-maD. drink] and beer. She enjoys both businesses very much.

Isabel is requesting the loan to buy more ingredients for her restaurant, such as cooking oil, corn, sugar, rice, and potatoes, among others.

Isabel is happy about the loan and she promises to make her repayments.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for her restaurant, such as cooking oil, corn, sugar, rice, and potatoes, among others

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard, aged 41, is a farmer in Kitale Town, Western Kenya. He has been in mixed farming for ten years, producing and selling milk, tomatoes and vegetables to the local market. He also operates a motorcycle transport business to subsidize the farming income.

He has requested for a loan of 70,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to set up a poultry unit and to purchase poultry birds. He says the loan will allow him to venture into the poultry business and help him diversify his businesses. He also plans to own four quality dairy cows to improve his milk production capacity to over 30 litres per day.

Richard points out that a poor roads network is a great challenge and frequently results in delay of produce to the market.

loans.use: To purchase poultry birds and to set up a poultry unit.

loans.name: Karia Ole

texts.en:
Karia Ole S. is 36 years old.  He is married and supports six people. His monthly income is Ksh 10,000. He has been a farmer for the past five years. Wheat farming is doing well in his area due to favorable conditions.

Karia Ole learned about KADET LTD through advertisements done by KADET staff. He has been a good client and repaid his previous loan well.  He has applied for a second loan of KES 80,000 from KADET to buy farm supplies (wheat seeds & fertilizers). 

Karia Ole plans to use the proceed from the loan to plough back into his farm. He has never taken a loan from any other MFI. He is a genuine man who struggles and can achieve his goals if supported financially.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies (wheat seeds & fertilizers)

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia  es una persona muy responsable con su trabajo, desde hace 11 años adquirió su vivienda de interés social que por lo regular estas vivienda son muy pequeñas y en parte frontal están expuestas (sin ninguna protección). A Sonia lo que mas le interesa en este momento es poner una barda al frente de su casa para ofrecer mayor seguridad a su familia ya que esta es el patrimonio que le pueden ofrecer a sus 4 hijos. Para realizar su proyecto necesita comprar material de construcción y pagar mano de obra.
texts.en:
Sonia is a person who is very responsible with her work.  She acquired her house 11 years ago which, like most social welfare housing of this type, is very small and exposed (without any protection).  

What interests Sonia the most at this time is putting a wall up around her house to provide more security for her family, which is an endowment she can offer her 4 children.  In order to carry out her project, she needs to buy construction materials and pay for manual labor.

loans.use: buy construction materials and pay for manual labor to build a wall around her house.

loans.name: Santos Cristino

texts.es:
El joven Santos tiene 23 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Choluteca y se dedica a la venta de productos de uso personal como ser cremas, lociones, perfumes, etcetera.
Santos le vende sus productos a una gran cantidad de clientes que trabajan en centros comerciales y tambien en la azucarera la Grecia, le hacen encargos todas las semanas.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia y asi satisfacer las necesidades de cada uno de sus clientes, tiene mucha demanda por la buena calidad de sus productos.
texts.en:
Young Santos is 23 years of age.  He lives in the city of Choluteca and is dedicated to the sale of personal products such as creams, lotions, perfumes, etc.
Santos sells his products to a large number of clients who work in commercial centers and also in the la Grecia sweet shop.  He places orders every week.
The loan will be used to buy merchandise and in that way satisfy the needs of each one of his clients.  He has great demand for the good quality of his products.

loans.use: to buy lotions, perfumes, creams, foundations & cosmetics.

loans.name: Jose Ramiro

texts.es:
Ramiro es un cliente de 32 años de edad que vive junto a su novia y su menor hijo en casa de sus padres en la ciudad de Chepén – La Libertad. Ramiro y su familia gozan de ciertas comodidades pues su casa se encuentra en la zona urbana y cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. 

Desde hace 5 años, Ramiro, se dedica a ofrecer el servicio de transporte público de mototaxi. La mototaxi consta de una moto con una cabina en la parte trasera donde se pueden transportar pasajeros. Este es un servicio muy común en las pequeñas comunidades del Perú, las rutas que cubren son rutas pequeñas y el costo de este servicio es barato.

Ramiro solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que utilizará para mejoras en su moto para que esta le siga siendo rentable, así como para gastos personales que su familia actualmente requiere.

Ramiro y su familia cuentan con buenas referencias personales y él estaría muy agradecido de concedérsele el préstamo pues le sería de gran utilidad.
texts.en:
Ramiro is a 32 year old man who lives together with his girlfriend and their young son in his parents' house in the city of Chepen, La Libertad. Ramiro and his family enjoy certain commodities as their house is located in an urban region and they have all the basic services.

For the past 5 years Ramiro has been offering public transport services with his motorcycle taxi. A motorcycle taxi consists of a motorcycle and a cabin in the rear section where passengers are transported. This is a very common service in the small communities in Peru. The routes which they cover are short routes and the cost of this service is affordable.

Ramiro requests a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 nuevos soles. He will use it to make improvements to his motorcycle to keep his business profitable. He will also use it for personal expenses currently required by his family.

Ramiro and his family have good personal references and he would be very thankful to have a loan as it would be very helpful.

loans.use: to carry out maintenance to his motorcycle and to cover some personal expenses.

loans.name: San

texts.en: The old woman in the photograph is San, aged 60, who lives in the province of Kompong Cham, which is the best territory for farming. San is a widow as her husband died of illness four years ago and now she lives with five children; four of them have already married and the remaining one is single and works as a worker in Rattanakiri Province. San owns a few farms that she inherited from her grandmother. She grows various crops. San has another farm that she owns, but she has not yet planted crops on it. She hopes to use her Kiva loan to purchase peanut seed, insecticides, fertilizer for growing and to pay for plowing costs which she has hired before.

loans.use: to purchase peanut seed, insecticides, fertilizer and to pay for plowing.

loans.name: Timane

texts.pt:
Nasceu na  Provincia de Cabo Delgado, Norte de Moçambique casado e é pai de 3 fillhos de 08, 12 e 14 anos de idade e todos vaõ a Escola. Fez 9ª classe e naõ continuou devido as dificuldades financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem.
Saiu de Cabo Delgado para Maputo concretamente no Distrito de Boane afim de continuar com os estudos e acbou formando seu lar. Trabalha numa fabrica de produçaõ e venda de cimento ha mais de 7 anos e tem um salario de 3.800.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria e conta com o ajuda da sua esposa.
Nunca teve emprestimos em outros bancos, Conheceu Hluvuku atravez de colegas que tambem são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro emprestimo no valor de 10.000.00mt, com qual pretende pagar a legalização do seu terreno onde ira erguer obra para o seu negocio.
Espera pagar sem problemas e vai solicitar novos emprestimos na Hluvuku para aplicar na construção de um etabelecimento e iniciar o seu negocio.
texts.en:
Timane was born in the province of Cabo Delgado in northern Mozambique. He is married nd the father of three children 8, 12, and 14 years of age. All of his children attend school. He went to school through the ninth grade but had to drop out because of financial difficulties. He lives with his family in a home they own, and isn't financially responsible for anyone else.
He left Cabo Delgado for Maputo, specifically the district of Boane, in order to continue his studies, and ended up settling down. He's worked in a cement plant for more than 7 years and earns a salary of 3,800 meticals a month, which he uses to cover household expenses. He is able to save a little in his bank account and his wife also contributes to the household income.
He's never had loans from other banks. He learned about Hluvuku from coworkers who are also clients of the institution. This is his first loan, in the amount of 10,000 meticals, which he will use to pay for the legal paperwork for his land, where he plans to start construction for his business.
He intends to pay off the loan without difficulty and request new loans from Hluvuku, which he will use to construct a building and start a business.

loans.use: for legal paperwork for his land.

loans.name: Manala

texts.en: At present, she is working in another saloon. she want to rent a shop and make a saloon.

loans.use: to rent a shop and make a saloon.

loans.name: Rahim

texts.ru: Rahim ne jenat i ne imeyet detey. On jivet v Absheron regione vmeste so svoyey mamoy. Rahim rodilsya v 1989 qodu. Rahim uje 2 qoda kak imeyet svayo kafe. Etomu biznessu on nauchilsya u svoyego otca kotoriy i pomog yemu otkrit eto kafe. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi rasshirit pomesheniye kafe dlya razvitiya svoyego biznessa.
texts.en: Rahim is not married and does not have children. He lives in the Absheron region together with his mother. Rahim was born in 1989. He's had his own cafe for two years now. He learned about this business from his father who helped him open the cafe. Right now Rahim needs 2000 AZN to expand the space of the cafe to grow his business.

loans.use: to expand the cafe space

loans.name: Hortencia

texts.es:
La señora Hortencia es madres soltera y tiene dos hijos bajo su responsabilidad y quienes este años entran a estudiar la primaria y no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder comprar los uniformes (ropa y zapatos) y útiles que son libros, cuadernos, colores, hojas de papel, lápices y mochilas. 
Solicita su cooperación para este préstamo ya que desea que sus hijos estudien y tenga la educación necesaria y así podrán tener un mejor futuro. 
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte del sueldo que recibe de su trabajo en una fábrica en el aria de producción, es el ingreso que tiene para su familia.
texts.en:
Hortencia is a single mother; she has two children in her care who will start elementary school this year and she does not have the money she needs to buy uniforms (clothes and shoes) and school supplies (textbooks, notebooks, crayons, sheets of paper, pencils and backpacks.)

She is asking for your cooperation for this loan because she wants her children to go to school and have the necessary education to have a better future.

She plans to repay the loan with part of the salary she earns working in the production department in a factory; this is her family’s source of income.

loans.use: to buy school supplies and uniforms.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is 40 years old and lives in the town of Nasana in the Kampala east region of Uganda.  She is married and has four children. Three of her children are currently in school. Sylvia has a business selling clothes, which she has had for five years.         

To help expand her business, Sylvia has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase clothes for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Sylvia hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children.  In the future, Sylvia hopes to expand her business. Sylvia is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise (SEP) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale.

loans.name: Diosdado

texts.en:
"I continually dream for a better life of my family" says Diosdado. He is 49 years of age with only one child. His wife is a teacher, teaching elementary school pupils.

Diosdado has managed his farming business for almost 30 years. He wants to earn a higher income, to have savings for the future of his family. Financial assistance from the traders comes with a high interest rate, so Diosdado wanted to finance his farm expenditures himself. He is requesting a loan of P25,000 to buy farm inputs like fertilizers, insecticides and hybrid seeds for farming. In the future, Diosdado wants his dreams to come true.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like fertilizers, insecticides and hybrid seeds for farming.

loans.name: Maritza Monserrate

texts.es:
En el balneario de San Clemente  cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal 1 de Diciembre. Este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que son visitadas por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros,  ofrece diversidad de lugares hermosos y una rica variedad de platos típicos de la región.

En este lugar vive la señora Maritza, tiene 25 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 4 y 2 años de edad. El marido se dedica  a la pesca. Lleva 9 ciclos en el banco comunal y le agrada por los beneficios que ofrece la institución.
 
Nuestra amiga además de ser una muy buena ama de casa también se dedica al comercio, vende de ropa de todo tipo, para lo cual ella tres a cuatro veces por semana se desplaza por toda su localidad ofreciendo sus productos.
