El cliente solicita ha solicitado este crédito para la compra de mas insumos para la heladería, así también más variedad de bebidas y golosinas y así incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Señor Severiano V. is 59 years old. He has been married for a long time to Señora Severiana Villalba, and they live in their own house, which is located in the San Francisco district of Cambyreta. Señor Severiano and Señora Severiana are the proprietors of an ice cream shop in the very center of the city of Encarnación. They have worked at this business for more than 20 years, since it was one of the first ice cream shops in the city and is now one of the most well-known. Thanks to this business, they have been able to raise their children and give them a good education, and they are now independent adults. The client has applied for this loan to purchase more ingredients for the ice cream shop as well as a greater variety of drinks and candies and thus increase their income.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquire ingredients for the ice cream shop, as well as drinks and candies

loans.name: Lesver Miguel

texts.es: El Sr. Lesver Suncín es originario del municipio de El Sauce, se graduó como médico general y actualmente estudia la especialidad en Pediatría la cual está por culminar, se desempeña como tal en el Hospital Alemán Nicaragüense donde tiene cinco años de laborar. Es el primer crédito que solicita en Ceprodel el cual lo requiere para realizar su monografía, pago de matrícula, memoria y aseso metodológico con el objetivo de obtener su título como pediatra.
texts.en:
Lesver Suncín is from the municipality of El Sauce. He is a university graduate with a general degree in Medicine and currently is finishing up his studies in Pediatrics. He is employed as such at the Hospital Alemán Nicaragüense [Nicaraguan German Hospital] where he has worked for five years. This is his first loan with Ceprodel which he requires in order to cover costs for his dissertation, enrollment fees, written report and a methodology advisor for obtaining his qualifications as a pediatrician.

Translated from Spanish by Margaret Wolfe-Roberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To cover costs for enrollment, dissertation, written report and methodology advisor

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana G. is 54 years old, married and supports her family by operating a general store and by raising livestock. She lives in Prk Rose, Brgy Plaridel, Sagay City, Negros Occidental and has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004. She has improved her living conditions with the help of 16 loans from NWTF and her own hard work. She is succeeding in gradually making her family more economically stable, and now earns an average monthly income of PHP 13,000. She is applying for a new loan, for PHP 25,000, so that she can buy feed for her livestock and items to sell in her general store.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through its poverty alleviation program, NWTF is empowering women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To buy feed for her livestock and additional items to sell in her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To change the electrical wiring and to whitewash some walls of her house.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 32-year-old married man living in Tyre with his wife and only child. Mohammad has owned a grocery store since 2007, with four years of experience in the field. He used to sell mobile phones, but he realized that a food business brings in a better income, so he’s working hard on improving this business to insure a better living for his family. 

Mohammad has a disability concerning his eyesight, but for him it was never an obstacle, and he insists on overcoming any obstacle or difficulty. Mohammad is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua for the third time, in order to buy new products to his store and to increase his working capital. 

Mohammad states that the previous loans were of great benefit and they helped in increasing his income. Mohammad’s a man with a good reputation; his customers like the quality of products he sells in his store. Mohammad hopes to expand his store.

loans.use: To buy new products for his store

loans.name: Roger Enrique

texts.es: El Sr. Roger Enrique G. G. es trabajador Activo de la  Cooperativa de Ahorro y Crédito San Rafael del Sur desempeñándose como Gestor de Cobro, tiene dos años de trabajar para esta institución, es casado actualmente. Ha tenido  dos  créditos con CEPRODEL y  cada uno lo ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción para  ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación y este lo está solicitando para gastos personales en su hogar, de cuales  los créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera el  ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en: Roger Enrique G. G. works as a collections manager for the San Rafael del Sur Savings and Loan Cooperative. He has worked there for the past two years and is currently married. He has had two loans with Kiva partner CEPRODEL and has used each one to purchase construction materials to expand and improve his home. He is requesting the current loan to use for personal expenses for his home. The loans from CEPRODEL have helped Roger greatly in improving the quality of life for himself and his family.

loans.use: Personal expenses

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres Kuña Guapa, se conformó en agosto del 2008, en la zona de Trinidad, sus habitantes se dedican en su mayoría al sector informal de la economía y se trasladan a diferentes zonas para realizar sus actividades por el poco movimiento comercial en la zona.
 Las señoras comentan que están contentas con el crédito recibido y tiene muchos deseos  de continuar accediendo al crédito que les es de mucha ayuda para seguir adelante con sus actividades. 
 
Renuevan por 7 vez, pasando al siguiente ciclo por el excelente pago en sus cuotas. 
Ellas se sientes con más autoestima por el sentido de pertenencia a un comité y por el hecho de que hace 2 años que ya son clientes de la institución. 
La Señora Francisca G., directora general del comité tiene 29 años de edad, a quien al principio de asumir su cargo, le fue un poco difícil tomar las riendas del comité por su falta de experiencia para estar a cargo de un grupo y porque es una de las más jóvenes del grupo.  Pero con el tiempo fue tomando confianza y escuchando las recomendaciones para dirigir un grupo, hasta el punto de que hoy se desempeña de forma excelente en su comité y es muy apreciada por sus compañeras. 
Ella se dedica a atención de una cantina que posee donde vende comestibles de todo tipo y también bebidas y golosinas y solicita el préstamo para la abastecerse nuevamente de sus mercaderías y más aun en esta época en que la ventas de bebidas aumenta mucho.
Siempre agradecen la confianza de la fundación hacia las integrantes, ya que en ninguna otra institución financiera tendrían posibilidad de crédito.
texts.en:
The Women of Kuña Guapa Committee was formed in August of 2008 in the area of Trinidad. Its inhabitants mostly work in the informal sector of the economy and they go to different places to do their jobs because their is little commercial movement in the area.  The women state that they are happy with the loans they have received and they really want to continue to access the credit because it is a lot of help for getting ahead in their activities.  
 
They are renewing for the 7th time, going into the next cycle because of their excellent payment history. 
They have more self esteem from belonging to a committee and from being clients of the institution for 2 years. Mrs. Francisca G., general director of the committee, is 29 years old. When she first took over the job, it was a little difficult to take the reins of the committee because of a lack of experience of leading a group and because she is one of the youngest people in the group.  But with time she gained confidence and listened to recommendations for directing a group and today she performs excellently in the committee and is very appreciated by the other members. 
 
She works in a cantina she owns where she sells food of all types and also drinks and snacks. She is asking for the loan to supply herself again with merchandise, especially since beverage sales increase a lot at this time. 

They are always grateful for the trust the Foundation has in the members, since they would have no chance of a loan in any other institution.

loans.use: To purchase beverages, snacks and more.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is 41 years old. She is married and has five children who are between five and twenty years old. All her children go to school. Her husband works as a driver. She sells art crafts and she has had this business for a period of four years. She needs this loan to buy more shoes, necklaces and bags to sell. 

Pauline says that the profit from her business will be used to expand her house.  She says that her business succeeds because of customer satisfaction and the way she manages to raise school fees for her children also indicates her business success.

loans.use: To buy more shoes, necklaces and bags to sell.

loans.name: Vukanathi Group

texts.en:
Thomozani is 50 years old and single with three children between the ages of 13 and 31. She also cares for two relatives. She operates a retail business around the Richards Bay area of KwaZulu-Natal, South Africa.

She has been selling chickens, hand bags, and perfumes for a year and hopes to also begin selling goats and providing public phones. She faces challenges when customers buy bags on credit and fail to pay on time. She has requested this loan through WDB and Kiva to purchase additional chickens, hand bags, and perfumes for resale. She hopes that the extra income generated will help her pay her childrens' school fees to allow them to graduate. 

Thomozani is happy that WDB and Kiva have come together and hopes that her business will grow bigger and that her children will have better lives.

Thmozani is the leader of her borrower group and is pictured above in the center of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase chickens, bags, and perfumes for resale

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma M. opened Bistro Six to fulfill her dream of working in the food industry.  She decided to start a food truck because she wanted to make buying excellent food more convenient for people.  Norma and her husband used to grab breakfast at food trucks before work.  These experiences helped Norma learn about this model of food production.  Bistro Six is successful because of the commitment of Norma and her family.  Her oldest son, Javier, is the executive chef and her stepdaughter, Stacey, is the sous chef.  

Norma says that receiving the loan from ACCION Texas-Louisiana could not have been more perfectly timed.  She and her husband had depleted personal funds to remodel the truck, but the truck was still not outfitted with kitchen supplies.  They used part of the loan to pay off the remodeling, which included upgrading the electric wires, adding the logo, and buying a new generator.  The day that Norma received the loan, she and her son went shopping for all the pots, pans, and other necessary cooking equipment.  As soon as they bought the supplies, the family “started cooking and didn’t stop for four days” until the food truck’s opening.  Norma and her family would not have been able to achieve their goal without the loan.   

Norma says the most difficult part of owning a food truck is finding a legal place to park.  She has struggled to negotiate the rules surrounding food trucks in San Antonio.  Some challenges are that there are not many curb spaces to fit a food truck and that the truck is not allowed to park within 300 feet of another eatery.  In order to work through these challenges, Norma and a number of other food truck owners have come together to support one another.  They are all parking on one piece of land and are calling the area the Boardwalk on Bulverde.  Norma says that the food trucks are not competition for one another, but rather are fighting through the same problems and banding together to come up with solutions.  

Norma believes that it is important for anyone who has an entrepreneurial inkling to recognize his or her talent and act on it.  Norma says, “once you have a dream, never quit and believe that you can do it.”

loans.use: To pay for pots, pans, and other kitchen equipment and remodeling of her food truck

loans.name: Beatriz's Group

texts.en:
Beatriz G. is from the village of San Jose. She is 45 years old. Beatriz is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Beatriz G.'s Group.

Beatriz is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Beatriz owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Beatriz has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Beatriz joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Beatriz has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Beatriz is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Beatriz from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees for her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase products to sell

loans.name: Maura

texts.es: Maura casada, mujer trabajadora, inicio su propio negocio para apoyar a su esposo con los gasto de la casa, tiene una pulpería en donde también tiene ropa en venta desde hace un tiempo, no se le ha presentado dificulta alguna ya que lo inicio con fondo de ahorros propios y ha ido creciendo mediante el apoyo del financiamiento. Como planes a futuro es seguir incrementando las ventas. El préstamo que solicitad será invertido en la compra de granos básico, ropa para dama, caballero y niño, artículos escolares, productos enlatados y otros. Generandole mayores ventas, mayores ganancia.
texts.en:
Maura is married and a hardworking woman. She started her own business in order to help her husband with the household expenses. Maura has a store where she also sells seasonal clothing. She has not had any difficulties since she started out using her own savings and has grown with the help of loans. Her plans for the future include continuing to increase her sales.

The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of basic grains, clothing (for women, men, and children), school supplies, canned goods, and other products. She hopes to generate better sales and earn more income.

loans.use: Purchase a variety of products to sell

loans.name: Wilber

texts.en:
Wilber is 24 and single. He is an artisan, embroidering cloths and sending his products to family members to sell in Lima and Cuzco, where there is greater demand.   He will be using his loan of 1,500 nuevos soles to buy cloth to make embroideries. 

Wilber has 4 brothers and 2 sisters who also help in the business.  They have run this business together out of their home in Ayacucho for 6 years. 

Wilber is a member of the communal bank "Margaritas" at FINCA Peru. He has been with FINCA for 1.5 years and joined because his sister was also a member. He likes to save for the future before he has a family to support. His dream is to have regular clients to sell his products to. He would also like to modernize his operations.

loans.use: To buy wool for embroidery business

loans.name: Kristia

texts.en:
Kristia is a 28-year-old lady who runs a kiosk business. Kristia lives with her husband, Maxi, who is 34 years old and their three children: Prasetyo, who is 9 years old and in the 4th grade of Elementary School; Misel, who is 6 years old and in the 1st grade of Elementary School, and; Arthur, who is 2 years old.

Kristia and her family live in Kelapa Lima Village. Kristia spends her days taking care of her family and running her own kiosk business. It is situated about 200 meters from her house. She usually operates her business from at 10.00 am to 09.00 pm. Kristia really enjoys running this business which she has had for four years. She decided to initiate a kiosk business as the income generated by her husband is not enough to finance her family's needs and cover their children's educational needs. 

Kristia would like to improve her income by selling mobile phone recharges and add more stock at her kiosk. Kristia would like to sell the mobile phone recharges as she believes that it can support her in generating more income for her family since the potential market for the mobile phone recharges is large. Kristia is sure that they will be sold out quickly.  Hence, Kristia is requesting a loan of IDR 3,000,000 from TLM. She is optimistic the loan will bring benefits for her business and her family life.

loans.use: To buy mobile phone recharges and add more stock

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: La señora Ana Maria tiene la edad de 55 años, habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe, ella es madre soltera, tiene cuatro hijos ya todos mayores e independiente, una de ella le apoya con los gastos del hogar y en el negocio, los planes hacia un futuro es poder mejorar la infraestructura del negocio, ya que ella desde hace diez años se dedica a la venta de ornadas, como rosquillas, pan, picos, etc. La mayor dificultad que se le presenta es alza de precios en los productos como harina, huevo, leche, entre otros lo cual tiene que hacer un poco más pequeño y poder acomodarle al cliente  para no dejarlo de vender .Ella inicio este negocio con sus propios esfuerzo . El crédito lo quiere para la compra de sacos de harina, bidones de aceite, azúcar, levadura, polvo de ornear, maíz, etc.
texts.en: Ana Maria is 55 years old and lives in Ticuantepe.  She is a single mother and has four children who are grown up and independent.  One of her daughters supports her with the household expenses and in her business.  Ana Maria's plan for the future is to improve the infrastructure of her business.  For ten years, she has been selling baked goods such as 'rosquillas' (a type of doughnut), bread, 'picos' (mini breadsticks), etc.  The biggest difficulty that she faces is the rise in the price of products such as flour, eggs and milk.  This means that she has to make things a little smaller and accommodate her customers so that she doesn't have to stop selling.  Ana Maria started her business through her own efforts.  She would like this loan to buy sacks of flour, containers of oil, sugar, yeast, baking powder, corn, etc.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making bread.

loans.name: Safina

texts.en:
Safina N. lives in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has two children, both of whom are in school. Safina has a tailoring business. She has been in this business for ten years and she works seven days a week. Safina has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to purchase more materials for her sewing business.The main business challenge for Safina is transportation. Her goal is to expand her business and to earn more profit. 

Safina lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent and food.

loans.use: to buy more material for tailoring

loans.name: Kalamera Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Kalamera” group. They are small scale businesswomen based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT/Kiva lenders in order to seek a loan of 1,400,000.00 SLL. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve on their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Rugiatu C.. Rugiatu is age 33. She was born in Makeni city where she is currently residing together with her two children. Her children are attending primary and secondary school. For ten years now, Rugiatu has been selling palm-oil and clothes. With her share of this loan, she is going to expand her business by buying palm-oil and clothes in large quantities to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy palm-oil and clothes in large quantities

loans.name: Gildardo De Jesùs

texts.es:
Desde niño, Gildardo de Jesús M. C. conoció la ley del rebusque, pues la falta de recursos en su hogar lo obligaron a trabajar en diferentes oficios desde pequeño, fue asì como se convirtió en un luchador incansable que desde hace algún tiempo decidió montar su propio negocio, una salsamentaría que ofrece diversos productos a sus clientes y vecinos, pues ya es reconocido en el sector. 

A sus 39 años y como padre responsable de sus dos hijos, Gildardo es un gran ahorrador pues sus sueño es tener su casa propia para darle tranquilidad a su familia. Asì mismo espera que su negocio se posicione con el  tiempo y se convierta en un gran supermercado. 

Actualmente Gildardo necesita de un préstamo para comprar un televisor que ubicará en su negocio con el fin de atraer a sus clientes y lograra asì que se queden por màs tiempo para incrementar sus ventas, como el mismo lo dice el conocimiento popular me ha enseñado a traer la clientela y estoy seguro que esta será una forma.
texts.en:
Since he was a child, Gildardo de Jesús M. C. has known the importance of hard work. A lack of resources in the home meant that Gildardo had to work a range of different jobs from a young age, turning him into a tireless worker. A little while back he decided to set up his own general store that offers many products to his customers and neighbours, as he is well known in the area.

At 39 years of age and as a responsible father to two children, Gildardo is a great saver, as his dream is to have his own home to give his family peace of mind. He hopes that with time his business will grow to be a large supermarket.

Gildardo currently needs a loan to purchase a televison set which he will install in his store to attract customers who, once there, will stay for longer, make more purchases and increase his sales. Gildardo's knowledge of the public has taught him how to attract customers and he is certain that this is the way to bring them in.

loans.use: to purchase a television set

loans.name: Fátima Narciza

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Divino Niño se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Fátima, tiene 52 años de edad, está separada y de esta relación tienen cinco hijos, cuatro de ellos mayores de edad y una chica de 15 años que estudia en colegio, dos de sus hijos aun viven en su casa. 

Ella es una gran madre que para ganarse la vida y para que a su hija no le falte nada hace dos años arrendo un pequeño local en el mercado de Picoaza, allí vende carne de pollo por libras, trabaja todos días desde las 6h00 hasta las 18h00 con la ayuda de sus hijos.  Los pollos compra en granjas que hay por la localidad y le dejan a muy buen precio por que los compra vivos y luego ella los faena de acuerdo a como vaya vendiendo, esto lo hace para que sus clientes lleven lo mejor.

Este crédito es para comprar pollos para la venta. Lleva tres ciclos en el Banco Comunal  y le gusta por la rapidez para conseguir los créditos.
  
Su sueño es tener un local propio para no tener que pagar arriendo.
texts.en:
The “Divine Son” Community Bank meets every fifteen days in the Picoaza Parrish in the town of Portoviejo, a place known for its business center, its traditional celebrations of Saint Peter and Saint Paul, and the joyfulness of its people. 
In this place we meet Mrs. Fatima who is 52 years old, separated, with five children. Four of the children are grown and the last one, a  fifteen year old girl,  studies at the high school. Two of her children live at home.
Fátima is a wonderful mother. In order to earn a living and to insure her daughter has everything that she needs, for the past two years she has had a small stand in the Picoaza market. She sells chicken meat by the pound. She works everyday from 6am until 6pm with the assistance of her children. She buys the chickens from local farms. They give her a good price as she buys them live and she kills them based on her sales needs. This she does so her customers have the best product.
She will use this loan to buy chickens that she will later sell. She has had three loans with the community bank and she appreciates the ability to rapidly attain the loan.
Her dream is to have her own booth that she doesn’t have to rent from someone else.

loans.use: to buy chickents.

loans.name: Flor Idalia

texts.es: Flor Idalia D. 31 años D. edad vive con su compañero D. vida y sus dos hijos, los cuales asisten a la escuela D. la comunidad donD. residen. Flor posee un negocio, una sala D. belleza que es la que le permite mantener a flote su hogar; la sala D. belleza D. Flor es muy conocida en el lugar porque ofrece a los clientes buena calidad D. trabajo y a precios accesibles, además Flor piensa que la belleza viene desD. el corazón y le transmite a sus clientes ese amor a su trabajo y la alegría que la caracteriza. Ella quiere ver crecer su negocio y por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le dé la oportunidad D. comprar cremas, maquillaje, esmaltes, shampo, acondicionadores, peines entre otros, para así  mantener mucha clientela y lograr darle a su familia seguridad económica y una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en: Flor Idalia is 31 years old, and lives with her partner and their two children, who attend the community school.  Flor has a beauty salon, which permits her to maintain her lifestyle. The beauty salong is very well-known in the area because Flor offers her clients high-quality work and reasonable prices. Additionally, Flor believes that beauty comes from the heart, and she conveys this love for her work to her clients. As a result, she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL, which gave her the opportunity to buy creams, make-up, nailpolish, shampoo, conditioners, and combs, among other items. This will enable her to maintain many clients and to succeed in giving her family economic security and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy creams, make-up, nailpolish, shampoo, conditioners, and combs

loans.name: Surriya's Group

texts.en:
Surriya is 55 years old and has given birth to two sons. Both of them work. The elder one is an embroidery expert while the younger works in a hostel. Her husband operates a construction supplies business. He supplies construction supplies to different construction companies and people looking to build homes. 

Surriya is very supportive by nature. In order to financially support her family, she works in people's homes. She is also a very good housewife and does her household responsibilities very well.  

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the expansion of her son’s embroidery business. With the loan, he will purchase embroidery material in bulk to be able to provide better quality services to his customers and increase his profits. 

Surriya is expecting that after the loan investment, her son’s business will improve which will help her family to live a better financial life. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Surriya.

loans.use: To purchase embroidery material for embroidery business.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is 43 years old and lives in Fatima, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with 3 children. 

To earn a living, Annie has a restaurant business. She earns about 8,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. Annie has a requested a loan to purchase food and drinks for her restaurant. Annie has been a member of PMPC for 1 year.

loans.use: to purchase food and drinks for her restaurant business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To pay the rent for a garden to grow fruit

loans.name: Necitas

texts.en:
Necitas, a 38-year-old resident of Pasay City, Philippines, is married to Larry, a tricycle operator, and the mother of four children. She, her husband and children manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to provide income for her everyday expenses.

Necitas is a mineral water distributor, buying from wholesalers and then selling in five-gallon containers for a profit. She earns additional income by selling cell phone air time loads to her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php1000 in sales every day.

To help her continue business operations, Necitas is requesting a Php35,000 loan to buy more stocks of mineral water and cell phone airtime loads. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands.

Necitas dreams of enabling all of her children to attain a good and high quality education through her hard work. She also hopes to have a growing network of customers. Faithfully meeting up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase additional mineral water stocks and cell phone loads.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a married woman with two children who attend school. She is 42 years old and, for almost 20 years, has run a business where she sells food and fish to the people in her community. She has used the income generated from her business for school fees.

Marilyn is requesting a 23,000 PHP loan to purchase fish, beef, and pork, and to add vegetables to her food offerings. This will help increase her sales. In the future, Marilyn hopes to diversify her business and generate more income to be able to continuously send her children to school to earn their degrees and have a brighter future.

loans.use: to purchase fish, beef, and pork, and add vegetables to her food offerings to increase sales

loans.name: Ana Lisa

texts.es:
La señorita Ana es comerciante, se dedica a la compra y venta de ropas para damas y caballeros. Ella es soltera tiene una hija de 4 años y es madre soltera. Vive y posee su negocio en casa de sus padres. Su papá trabaja en un negocio renombrado de la ciudad de Pilar como Transportista y su mamá es funcionaria del Instituto de Previsión Social.
Es una persona muy trabajadora y con muy buenas referencias en la sociedad. Uno de sus sueños es tener su casa propia y poder trasladar su negocio. Desea un mejor futuro para su hija y que algún día se convierta en una gran profesional.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas, pues de esa forma podrá cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes. Está muy esperanzada en el crédito, pues de obtenerlo le será de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
Srta. Ana is a merchant who buys and sells clothing for women and men. She is a single mother with a four-year-old daughter. Ana lives at the home of her parents, which is also where her business is located. Her father works for a well-known company in the city of Pilar as a truck driver and her mother is an employee of the Institute for Social Welfare.

Ana is a hardworking woman with very good references. One of her dreams is to have her own house so that she can move her business. She wants a good future for her daughter so that someday she can become a successful professional.

Ana is requesting a loan to buy outfits so that she can meet the demands of her customers. She is very hopeful that the loan she received will be of great help.

loans.use: to buy outfits for women and men.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James has operated in the transport industry in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last seven years. He is 31 years old, married to Naomi, and they have two children. 

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his second loan. He has been loaned KES 60,000, which he plans to use to buy a dairy cow to try selling milk. This will boost the income he gets from his motorbike business. 

In the future, James hopes to focus more on dairy farming and become a leading supplier of dairy products in Ndunyu Njeru town.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to try selling milk.

loans.name: Mach

texts.en:
Mach (in the photo), age 31, is single. She lives with her parents about twenty-five kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Mach is a garment worker. She is asking for a loan of 1100 USD to assist in her brother's farming business by buying fertilizer and a water pumping machine.

loans.use: to assist in her brother's farming business by buying fertilizer and a water pumping machine.

loans.name: Raya

texts.en:
Raya, age 52, has been engaged to farming for 15 years. She acquired her skills in this field when she was very young from working with her parents. Agriculture has become her principal source of income and she dedicates most of her time to the attention and care of her agricultural products, together with her father. She generally sells her crops in the central bazaar. Through her daily work, she looks to give her family security and economic stability. 

Her husband is a taxi driver and they help each other to support their family.

Raya has applied for a 1,500 AZN loan in order to improve her products and increase her sales. This will be her second loan from AqroInvest.

loans.use: purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Sopheng

texts.en: Sopheng, 32 years-old, is a motor taxi driver around Phnom Penh city and he earns $10 per day. His wife works in a garment factory and earns $4 per day. This couple has three children, two are studying and another is too young for school. Every month, they spend $110 on food, $6 on electricity, $40 on school fees, and $10 on other expenses. He would like to request a loan of $1,100 in order to buy a new motorbike to pull a tok tok for his career. His current motorbike is old and needs a lot of fixing so he decided to buy a new motorbike for his convenience.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to pull a Tok Tok for his career.

loans.name: Ana Ruth

texts.es:
La señora Ruth, es madre soltera, vive en casa propiedad de un hermano, convive con sus tres hijos: una hija de 19 años que estudia un técnico en agente de ventas, otra hija de 16 años que estudia bachillerato y un hijo de 12 años que cursa el quinto grado de básica.

Por tradición familiar se dedican a comprar y engordar cerdos, estos los compran pequeños, los engordan y los venden cuando ya son grandes. Esta actividad la realiza en un espacio del terreno de su casa. Debido a las exigencias económicas de su familia y a que el negocio de engordar cerdos no le permitían obtener ingresos constantes, desde hace 8 años se dedica a la venta de joyas enchapadas y productos cosméticos por catalogo. Esta actividad le ha permitido a su familia que viva dignamente y puedan realizar sus estudios.

Para alimentar los cerdos, ella compra suero que sale de la leche de vaca cuando se procesa, esta la compra todos los días a procesadores de lácteos de la zona y el concentrado lo compra en la ciudad que esta ubicada a 25 kilómetros de su vivienda. Para transpórtalos hace uso de los autobuses, luego paga un pick up para que le lleve el producto hasta su casa de donde la deja el bus. Las compras las realiza una vez a la semana, debido a que si compra mucho el producto pierde su calidad. Las joyas y los cosméticos también los compra en la ciudad.

Ella solicita un préstamo para continuar engordando a 20 cerdos que tienen mes y medio de edad, alimentar 2 cerdas parinderas y un berraco (macho) y la otra parte para comprar productos nuevos para la venta. Esto le permitirá a ruth continuar con sus actividades para generar ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia y no deje de trabajar con las joyas y los cosméticos que son los que le generan un flujo constante a su familia.

Ruth desea a mediano plazo apoyar a sus hijos para que estudien una carrera técnica y se puedan defender por su propia cuenta, también quiere construir instalaciones adecuadas para el engorde de los cerdos, y construir una casa en la propiedad que le heredo su mamá, ya que actualmente vive en casa de un hermano.
texts.en:
Ruth is a single mother and she lives in a house that is owned by her brother. She lives with her three children: a 19-year old daughter who is studying commerce at a technical school; another daughter, 16 years old who is in high school. And a 12-year old son who is in grade five.

As a family tradition they buy and raise pigs. They are purchased as piglets and they raise them and sell them when they have grown. She carries out her business from a space on the property. Given the financial needs of her family and the fact that raising pigs does not permit them to have a steady source of income, she decided 8 years ago to sell fashion jewelry and cosmetics by catalogue. This business has permitted her family to live in a dignified manner and to send her children to school.

To feed her pigs, she buys the whey that is produced from cow milk when it is processed. And she busy every day from the daily producers in the region. The concentrated feed is purchased from the city, located 25 kilometers from her home. She uses public buses to transport her products and then she pays a pick-up truck service to take her products all the way to her house from the bus stop. She makes her purchases once per week, especially because the product loses its quality if bought in larger volumes. The jewelry and the cosmetics are also purchased in the city.

She requests a loan to keep raising her 20 pigs, which are 6 weeks old. She needs to feed her sows and a boar. The other part of her loan will be used to purchase more and new products for resale. This will let Ruth continue with her income generating activities for the support of her family. She must not stop selling the jewelry and cosmetics because they generate the constant source of income for the family.

Ruth wishes to support her children in the medium-long term, so that they will earn a technical career and so that they will earn themselves a living. She also wants to build adequate barns for the pigs and to build a house that was inherited to her by her mother. She currently lives in her brother's house.

loans.use: to purchase feed to raise her pigs, and to purchase fashion jewelry and cosmetics.

loans.name: Tham

texts.en: Tham is 26 years old with two children. She is running a shop that sells fresh fruits in the local market. Her business started in 2010. Every month, she earns 5,500,000 VND profit. She used the loans from SEDA credit program in 2008 to invest in a fruit shop. She finds that it is very suitable to her earning activity. Currently, she wants to borrow 9,184,000 VND to buy fruits for retail selling.

loans.use: to buy fruits to sell

loans.name: Fridah

texts.en: Fridah is 31 years old, married and has three children who range in age from three to 12 years old. She is committed to improve and expand her business, which consists of selling produce she grows on her farm. She has been in this line of work for 10 years and now has two employees. She describes her biggest business challenge as an insufficient water supply. She will use this Kes 30,000 loan to buy sprinklers. Her goals for the future are to expand into large-scale farming and educate all of her children to the university level.

loans.use: to buy sprinklers for her farm.

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona is 52 years old and lives in Binoongan, Enrique Villanueva, Siquijor.  She is married with four children. 
Chona is engaged in selling fish to earn a living and has had this business for 14 years. She earns a PHP 24,000 gross income doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase more fish to sell.
Chona has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for 10 months. Chona hopes to grow her business and have more savings for the future.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Yon

texts.en:
Yon is 39 years old. She and her husband Heng, who is 44 years old, live in a village about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1989 and have two sons and three daughters. Two of their children are garment workers, two attend school, and the other one assists his parents in their farming business.

Yon and her husband are farmers. They grow papaya, corn, and tomatoes on their farmland in the village where they live. Yon is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and pesticide to maintain their farm.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer, and pesticide to maintain her farm.

loans.name: Renato

texts.en:
Renato is 65 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with six children. 

Renato has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Renato has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Renato hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for sale.

loans.name: Hanh

texts.en:
Hanh is 51 years old and single. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Hanh has been running a food stall for six years. She sells noodles for people in the local community. She intends to take a loan to buy furniture, bowls, chopsticks, and meat to expand her business and to meet her customers' demand. 

She hopes that through this loan she can earn more money through her current business and save additional amounts for reinvestment.

loans.use: to buy furniture, bowls, chopsticks, and meat

loans.name: Ayen

texts.en:
Ayen is a 25-year-old married woman with two children, one of whom is in school. She has had a food-selling stall in Bor, South Sudan for two years.

Ayen is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her child.

loans.use: to purchase beans and rice for resale.

loans.name: Colette Sourou

texts.fr: Âgée de 34 ans, Colette Sourou vit au Bénin et n'a pas fréquenté l’école. Colette Sourou est mariée à un menuisier du nom de Michel. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Colette Sourou vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari les différentes charges du ménage. Colette Sourou vend des condiments, de l'huile, du lait à son domicile depuis cinq ans à son domicile ; ce qui lui permet de contribuer à l'éducation et à l'entretien des enfants. Colette Sourou s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. La clientèle de Colette Sourou devient de plus en plus grandissante. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d'affaire et son revenu, Colette Sourou sollicite une troisième fois l’appui financier de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des condiments, de l'huile et du lait.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa has been a seamstress for over 35 years. When she was 13 she began studying at an arts and crafts school where she focused on sewing. Rosa already had her own workshop when she finished school thanks to her mother who provided her first sewing machine. When she got married Rosa took her small business to her new home but soon found work at the school she once attended. Three years ago she chose to restart her business as a part time operation. She has now quit her job and found a new business partner, her daughter.

She is requesting the loan in order to get buy sewing materials (threads, fabric etc.) and boost her production. Rosa is 50 years old and has two daughter’s who are grown up. She hopes that she can be successful in business with her daughter so she may fix up her home which is still only made out of wood.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Purchase sewing materials

loans.name: Lumumba

texts.en:
P. Lumumba is a nursing officer managing his own private facility in Muumandu, Machakos District, in Kenya's Eastern Province. He is 45 years old and lives with his wife and two children, aged 12 and 1 year.

He has run his facility for the last seven years since graduating from college in this remotest part of Kenya. He focused his efforts on building a larger out-patient facility at this location. Besides general curative services and an observation ward, his facility offers a pharmacy, a laboratory, and maternal and child health services. He also offers mobile outreach clinics to the community.

P. attributes his success to hard work, winning the community's confidence, the active involvement of the community, and assistance from KMET. He has been able to expand his facility, increase the number of services he offers and improve the quality of care he provides. He plans to further expand his facility and has applied for a loan of Kshs 200,000 (approximately US $2857).

loans.use: To expand the space and services at his medical clinc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To diversify and expand his business

loans.name: Alsi

texts.es:
Business Description

Alsi has been buying and selling bottled water for the past 8 years, he started his business with little money he saved from the company he used to work. He bought large water bottles and started distributing them in different domiciles around the area where the lives. He works from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. At present he has 3 persons helping him in the distribution of the water.

Loan Use

Alsi wants to use the loan to improve the premises where the water is bottled. This way, he will be able to sell water of better quality and he will be able to get more clients in other areas, since the demand of bottled water is growing.

Personal information

Alsi is 39 years old, he is married and has 2 young children who are in school. His wife has a canteen, this business helps as well with the family’s expenses. Alsi lives in his mother’s house, she gave him the upstairs part of the house so he could live there with his family. The house is of cement and still needs to be finished. Alsi wants to use the loan to help in the grow of his business and in this way grow with his family as well.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Alsi tiene 8 años dedicado a la compra y venta de botellones de agua, el empezó su negocio con un pequeño dinero que tenia de un empresa donde laboró. Compro botellones de agua y empezó a distribuirlos en diferentes domicilios por el sector donde el vive. El trabaja desde las 8am hasta las 17pm. Actualmente tiene 3 personas que le ayudan en la distribución del agua.

Uso del Préstamo

Alsi desea el crédito para mejorar su local donde embasan el agua. Para de esta manera vender agua de mejor calidad y poder captar mas números de clientes en otros sectores. Ya que la demanda que el tiene de los botellones de agua esta en crecimiento.

Información Personal

Alsi tiene 39 años de edad, es casado y tiene 2 hijos menores de edad que están estudiando en el colegio. Su esposa tiene un comedor y también con esto ayuda para los gastos de la casa. Alsi vive en la casa de su mamá que le dio parte de arriba de la casa para que viva el con su familia. La casa es de cemento y aun falta de terminarla. Alsi desea el crédito con el fin de crecer en su negocio y de esta manera ir creciendo con su familia.

loans.use: Refit his business premises

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
Manulea works as an artisan making wallets, blouses and pillows and selling them from home. She sells to customers that already know her work and visit her to purchase these crafts. She is single and 18 years old. She helps to maintain her parents' family with her income. She belongs to the group Espina 4, togheter with doña Maria Hernández Díaz (artisan). They will invest this loan into purchasing threads, fabrics and looms to increment their craft production.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

MANUELA, se dedica a la artesanía haciendo monederos, blusas, cojines y los vende en su casa a clientes que conocen de su trabajo y la visitan para comprar las artesanías, es soltera y tiene 18 años y con sus ingresos ayuda a la manutención de la familia de sus padres. Pertenece al grupo Espina 4 junto con doña Maria Hernández Díaz (artesana). Invertirán el préstamo en la compra de hilos, telas y telares para aumentar la producción de sus artesanías.

loans.use: ARTESANA

loans.name: Komi Franck

texts.fr: Mr. S. Komi Franck was born on August 30th 1975 in Ahepe, but he lives in Lome in the Hountigome district.  He is married and has two children, and looks after two of his sister's children.  He is an electrician apprentice. Not having all the materials, he is limited in being able to make a living and works with his friends who can help provide some income to bring home.  He is tired of this situation but does not want to borrow from his friends, so he is requesting a loan of $1000 to buy his own materials and open his own workshop.

loans.use: Open an electrician workshop and purchase of materials

loans.name: Asata

texts.en: Asata Odusowon is 32 years old, married with 5 children. She comes from Mushin in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells foodstuff provision and drinks. Asata has been in business since 1997 and needs the loan to buy more foodstuff provisions and drinks for sale.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs provisions and drinks

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Mrs Olga has been selling typical Peruvian food (like salchipollos, salchipapas and others) at night for a long time, with success. She is 30 years old and has 2 children, Gianpol and Nicolle. Her children have become her biggest strength and motivation to improve and provide them wellbeing and safety.

Together with her beloved husband, Javier, who works as a teacher, they have decided to offer their children an excellent education so that they can reach the goals they set for their respective futures.

Olga would like to improve her business and that is why she would like to build a well-established food stand so she can offer a better service to her clients.

With your help, Olga will be able to reach her objective.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Olga, se dedica a la venta de comida por las noches (salchipollos, salchipapas y otros) desde hace mucho tiempo con éxito, ella a sus 30 años de edad es madre de dos hijos Gianpol y Nicolle, que se han convertido en su mayor fortaleza y motivo para progresar con el objetivo de otorgarles bienestar y seguridad.

En compañía de su querido esposo, Javier, quien trabaja como profesor se han propuesto brindarles una excelente educación con el propósito de que cada uno de ellos alcancen los planes que se propongan en un futuro. Olga desea progresar con su negocio y para ello quiere construir un local para brindar un mejor servicios a sus clientes.

Con tu ayuda la señora Olga logrará su objetivo.

loans.use: To improve her business building  a well-established food stand so she can offer a better service to her clients

loans.name: Margret's Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is N. Margret. She is currently in the business of frying edibles and is requesting a loan to invest in her business. N. is 48 years old and married with a husband who is a businessman. She has 3 children ranging from age 8 to 16 and her children go to school. Each week, N. makes approximately UGX 50000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to invest more in the business. N. has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to expand her business and the loan was paid back on time.

N. is joined in her small group by Sarah K., Margret N., Annet N., and Margret K.. Sarah K. is currently in the tailoring business and is requesting a loan to buy more equipment. Margret N. is also a tailor and is requesting a loan to buy materials. Annet N. is currently sells shoes and is requesting a loan to buy more shoes. Margret K. is currently in the business of selling airtime and sim cards and is requesting a loan to invest in more airtime.

loans.use: Invest in food business

loans.name: Namuleme Immaculate's Group

texts.en: Immaculate,52, is a widow left to care for her nine children.  She now also looks after four grandchildren. For the last 10 years, she has been preparing a local brew called “waragi” from her home, which she sells wholesale to neighboring towns while some customers drink from her home. She also has a retail shop at her home that was opened using the savings from the sell of waragi. She has been our client of over 10 years and with us, she has been able to pay her children’s school fees promptly. With this loan, she intends to renovate her house by providing shelter for her customers as well as secure some fees for her daughter that is seating senior 6 this year.

loans.use: To buy cement and bricks and to employ manpower for renovating her house for business.  Also, to buy more sugar, bread and cakes for her retail shop.

loans.name: Pastora

texts.es:
Selling firewood has become the most important source of income for Mrs. Pastora and her beloved family. This diligent mother is from the district of Conima. Since her children started college she decided, along with her husband Teófilo, to live in the city of Juliaca with the aim of being close to her kids and keeping the family together. Since that time this eager mother decided to sell firewood to help her dear husband with the household expenses as well as the cost of university for her children.

Now that she is observing the demand for her products she is thinking about increasing the amount of her merchandise and it's for that reason that she appeals to your good heart to request a loan. She plans to invest the loan in her business, allowing her to realize her dreams of seeing her children with a promising future.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

La venta de leña se ha convertido en el ingreso económico más importante de Doña Pastora y su amada familia, ésta diligente madre es natural del distrito de Conima, desde que sus hijos emprendieron sus estudios superiores decidió junto a su esposo Teófilo radicar en la ciudad de Juliaca con el fin de estar más cerca de sus retoños y conservar a su familia unida.Desde ese momento esta afanosa madre decidió dedicarse a la venta de leña y de esa manera apoyar a su querido esposo con los gastos del hogar y educación de sus hijos, ahora observando la demanda de sus productos tiene pensado aumentar la cantidad de su mercadería y es por ello que toca tu buen corazón para solicitarte un préstamo ya que tiene pensado invertir esta cantidad en su negocio, permitiéndole concretar sus sueños de ver a sus hijos con un futuro promisorio.

loans.use: Increasing capital to be able to offer larger quantities of firewood

loans.name: Mwatima's Umoja Group

texts.en:
Mwatima is married and takes care of her parents financially. She runs a phone business, where she sells time vouchers. She started this business in 2003 and now makes about $60 a month from her sales. She works from 7 A.M. to 6 P.M. daily.

Mwatima hopes for a loan to purchase more vouchers to sell. She will share this loan with Amina, another member of the loan group Umoja. These members guarantee one another in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more phone vouchers to sell

loans.name: Marculino Augusto

texts.en:
Marculino is 41 years old and originally from Manjacaze in the Gaza Province. Marculino is married and has five children, all of whom attend school. In addition to his immediate family, he also supports a nephew, who lives with him.

Marculino studied until 4th grade and had to stop due to his family’s difficult financial situation. In 1984 he moved to the capital city of Maputo to search for a job and worked first as a fisherman, and later at CFM, the Mozambican Railway Company. Marculino decided to move to Catembe, a fishing village that is a 10-minute ferry boat ride away from Maputo, as the cost of life was significantly lower than in the capital. He started working with commerce and has never stopped.

He has a small general store near Catembe’s central market, where he sells mainly food and basic needs products. He works daily from 8:30 am to 7:00 pm and relies on the help of his eldest daughter when she is not in school. Marculino’s most sold products are rice, sugar and cigarettes. He daily earnings range between MTn 1,500 to MTn 2,000, but he is still not saving as he has a large family to support.

Marculino is an old client of Hluvuku. This MTn 15,095 loan will be used to buy merchandise in large quantity and increase his stock. Marculino intends to buy mainly rice, sugar, oil and cigarettes. He hopes to attract more clients and increase his daily sales. In the future, Marculino would like to see his general store profits improve and, potentially, build a new store and offer many more products for his clients.

loans.use: Increase Inventory

loans.name: Gift

texts.en: Gift S. is a hair stylist and she also sells weave-ons and other hair attachments. She learned this business for 3 years and has been in this business since 1998. Gift is 29 years old and married with three children.  She lives in Ojo Igbede, Lagos State, Nigeria. Gift has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past 2 years.  She needs a loan of $700 USD to buy more weave-ons, hair attachments and to introduce the sale of rechargeable phone cards. This, she believes, will increase her profits and it will have a positive effect on her family. she thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more weave-ons and hair attachments

loans.name: Sugran

texts.en: Sugran baji is the wife of M. A. and has a sugarcane juice business. Sugran baji has been living in an area named Yadgar (a famous historical place) in Lahore for the last 20 years. Her husband M. A. sells sugarcane juice and has been in this profession for the last 25 years. Sugran baji currently has two juice machines running. She is the mother of nine children: four sons and five daughters. All of her sons sell sugarcane juice in different places. Her elder daughter sews clothes. Her younger daughters are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood.  Sugran baji successfully completed three loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan), with all payments on time. Now she is requesting a loan to buy materials (motor engine, generator and wheel) for a new sugarcane juice machine, so that she can expand her business.

loans.use: To buy machinery for her sugarcane juice business

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
Asma is 30 years old. She is married with one child, aged 12 years old. She has been a clothes seller since 1998. Every day, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Asma now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes (bedsheets) for her business.

loans.name: Yaneth Melania

texts.es:
Yaneth tiene 25 años de edad, estudió cuarto de secundaria, es casada y madre de tres hijos (dos mujeres de 08 y 02 años, y un varón de 04 años de edad). Vive en el Jr. Puno s/n, distrito de Mazocruz, provincia El Collao, Puno.

Es socia del Banco Comunal “Generación 2000” en Mazocruz. Decidió integrar el Banco Comunal desde hace 05 años porque le faltaba capital para equipar su tienda de abarrotes. Con el crédito inicial de S/.300 Nuevos Soles compró 01 bolsa de arroz, 01 bolsa de azúcar, etc. Desde los 06 años de edad su padre las abandonó y ella tenía que salir a vender gelatina, desde los 09 hasta los 18 años de edad vendía abarrotes en las ferias de Tupala, Huacullani, Huaitiri y otros. A los 19 años de edad convivió con su pareja y ambos instalaron su tienda de abarrotes. Con un capital acumulado actualmente vende combustible, carne de alpaca, llama, ovino y entrega a los mayoristas de Tacna.

Con este crédito de S/.1,500 nuevos soles, el cual será cancelado en 04 cuotas, tiene presupuestado comprar 01 cilindro de combustible con S/.600 y con el resto del capital comprará alpacas para la venta en carne. Cada alpaca tiene un costo de S/.180.00 a S/.200.00.

Su meta es tener una casa muy bonita en Mazocruz, instalar una tienda comercial, contar con empleados para la atención al público y ella sólo lo administraría, además que sus hijos estudien y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Yaneth is 25 years old and completed a fourth of secondary school. She is married and mother of three children (two girls who are two and eight years old, and a boy who is four years old). She lives in Jr. Puno, district of Mazocruz, province of El Collao, Puno. She is a member of the community bank "Generación 2000" in Mazocruz. She decided to join the community bank five years ago because she lacked capital to stock her grocery shop. With the initial credit of 300 Soles, she bought one bag of rice, one bag of sugar, etc. At six years of age, her father abandoned her and she had to go out to sell gelatin. From age nine to eighteen, she sold groceries in the markets of Tupala, Huacullani, Huaitiri, and others. At age nineteen she married her husband and they installed their grocery shops. With a capital accumulated, she presently sells fuel, alpaca, llama, and sheep meat, mostly to the wholesalers of Tacna. With this loan of 1500 Soles, which she will repay in four months, she proposes to buy one cylinder of fuel with 600 Soles and with the rest of the capital she will buy alpacas for the sale of meat. Each alpaca costs 180 to 200 Soles. Her goal is to have a very beautiful home in Mazocruz, set up a commercial shop, hire employees to attend to the public, and she will just administer it. Her goal is also that her kids study and become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fuel and alpacas for the cost of meat.

loans.name: Suraiya

texts.en:
Suraiya baji is the wife of Mr. S. and lives in a historical place named Yadgar in the city of Lahore, Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house, where she has lived for 30 years. She is the mother of two sons. Her elder son drives an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). The younger son is in kindergarten.

Suraiya baji’s husband drives a horse cart for deliveries. Unfortunately, his horse fell ill, and he can't use it for pulling the cart, because he treats the horse like his child. Suraiya baji is a housewife and prefers doing household work and taking care of her family. She successfully repaid her previous two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Suraiya baji requests a loan to buy another horse so that her husband can continue working and earning a profit.

loans.use: Buy a horse to pull the delivery cart

loans.name: Kosim

texts.ru: Турсунов Косим проживает в районе Хуросон. Уже 10 лет занимается торговлей тканями. Торгует на рынке "Фахробод" района Хуросон. Возраст 46 лет,женат и имеет пятерых детей. Для увеличения товарооборота планирует получить кредит сроком на 12 месяцев. Это даст возможность развивать бизнес и увеличить доходы , необходимые для обеспечения его семьи.
texts.en:
Kosim T. lives in the Khuroson District. He has been working in the fabric sales business for 10 years already. He sells his goods at the Fakhrobod market of the Khuroson District. He is 46 years old, married, and has five children. To increase sales he decided to take out a 12 month loan. This will allow him to expand his business and increase profits, which he needs to do to support his family.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase Sales

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en:
“I was running out of stock that’s why I need to buy additional sacks of rice,” Epifania says. Epifania P. is engaged in rice selling at Tumauini Public Market, Tumauni, Isabela. She is married to George who once was a Barangay Captain in their village, and now manages their farmland. Their four children are already professionals: Joyce, 34 years old, is a nursing graduate, Michael 37 years old, is an engineer, Jose, 40 years old, is a business administration graduate and Marilyn, 42 years old, is a teacher.

For almost 28 years of being in the rice business, Epifania was able to support the studies of her four children and supported their daily living at the same time. Even though she finished supporting the education of her children, Epifania never stopped working hard for their future. She wants to avail a loan amounting to PHP 23,000 as additional working capital. Her business requires large capital because the price of rice is very high and the demand is continuously increasing. Compared to other basic foods, rice comprises the major source of food and energy of everyone. With a lot of competitors doing the same kind of business, Epifania has a strong determination and dedication to work hard so that her business will survive.

loans.use: Epifania would like to buy more rice to sell.

loans.name: Marry

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 34-year-old Marry M. from Dar es Salaam. She is married with four children between the ages of 8 and 17 years. Additionally, Marry is responsible of supporting one child because he is an orphan. Marry has been running a bar business since 1998. Her bar is a good place to relax with a beer if you manage to finish work early on a Friday afternoon. You can relax on a plastic chair under a tree, with a local beer in hand, the aroma of roasting ‘mishikaki’ (kebabs made on an open fire) wafting around you, and talk to everyone who happens to wander by.

She works at her business for 14-16 hours per day, 7 days per week and is assisted by one employee. Marry currently earns about 150 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 225 USD in order to purchase additional stocks of beer, soda and other drinks. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Marry thanks you for your support.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of beer, soda and other drinks.

loans.name: Babak

texts.en:
Babak lives in Khachmaz town. He is 32 years old. He has been in this business for 2 years. His minimum net profit is 400 AZN. Now he needs a loan of 950 AZN to buy a lot of types of sweets.

Babak's future plans: He would like to increase the sorts of sweets he has for sale and after getting more income, he would like to build a bakery.

loans.use: to buy a  lot of types of sweets

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
La plupart des femmes du groupe DANAYA sont  mariées  avec  en  moyenne 25 ans, 4 enfants et vivent  dans des familles traditionnelles conjugales dans le village de WEREKELA, sous préfecture de Fana, préfecture de DIOÏLA, région de Koulikoro république du Mali. Elles se sont connues à travers  des relations professionnelles et font généralement l’achat vente du charbon de bois. 
Dans l’intention d’augmenter leur stock de charbon de bois et de satisfaire le besoin de la clientèle elles ont décidé d’adhérer  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur cinquième prêt de groupe dont quatre prêts agricoles. Les précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Ces femmes comptent ce prêt pour acheter, 13 tonnes de charbon de bois auprès des charbonniers de WEREKELA pour les revendent au comptant et en détail au bord de la route principale BAMAKO – SEGOU à une clientèle composée essentiellement de voyageurs et de revendeurs.
 Elles comptent obtenir avec ce prêt un bénéfice de 15 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour   la prise en charge des frais scolaires des enfants.
texts.en:
Most of the women in the DANAYA group are married, are on average 25 years old with 4 children, and live in traditional nuclear families in the village of Werekela, Fana sub-prefecture, Dioila prefecture, in the Koulikoro region of the Republic of Mali. They met each other through professional contacts and are engaged to a large extent in the buying and selling of charcoal. With the intention of augmenting their charcoal stocks and satisfying the needs of their customers, they decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, and are seeking their fifth group loan. They have obtained four previous agricultural loans, which were all repaid without problems. These women plan to use this loan to buy 13 tonnes of charcoal from the coal sellers in Werekela, in order to re-sell their goods in cash and at retail on the side of the main Bamako-Segou road to a clientele composed mainly of travellers and retailers. With this loan, they intend to generate a profit of 15,000 FCFA, which will be used to take care of and pay for the educational costs of their children.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: Dante

texts.es: Dante tiene 25 años, vive en casa de sus padres. El ofrece el servicio de electricista desde hace 5 años, implementó en su misma casa un taller para realizar reparaciones de  equipos electrodomésticos, realiza también instalaciones eléctricas para casas e instituciones, es por ello que en ocasiones viaja porque solicitan sus servicios en instituciones lejanas a su localidad. La demanda que tiene es a razón de que sus trabajos son de buena calidad, esto le genera a Dante la rentabilidad que desea y también la satisfacción de  realizar un trabajo independiente. Ahora quiere mejorar su taller de electricidad y comprar más instrumentos innovadores que potencien la calidad de sus trabajos. Es la primera vez viene solicitando un préstamo con MFP, y tiene muchas ganas de emprender un trabajo solidario con sus demás compañeros de su banco comunal. La cantidad que está solicitando es para invertirla en la compra de herramientas y materiales que utiliza en su taller como; cobre, alicates graduados, desarmadores de diferentes medidas, etc.
texts.en:
Dante is 25 years old and lives with his parents. He has been working as an electrician for five years, and set up a workshop in his own house to repair household appliances. He also does electrical installations in houses and institutions, and so occasionally must travel because his services are requested in institutions that are far from his town. He is in such demand because he does high-quality work, which helps Dante earn the income he wishes, and also gives him the satisfaction of working independently. Now he wants to refurbish his workshop and buy more tools that will boost the quality of his work. This is the first time he's requested a loan from MFP, and he is eager to work in solidarity with the other members of his communal bank. He is requesting this sum in order to purchase tools and supplies that he will use in his workshop, such as copper, pliers, screwdrivers of different sizes, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tools for his workshop

loans.name: Nora Jeaneth

texts.es:
La Sra. Nora Zaleya se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, ella tiene una pulperia  desde hace 8 años , su ubicacion es estrategica ya que no tiene competencia en esa zona, ella es casada y tiene 2 hijos, uno de ellos esta cursando educacion primaria en la escuela publica, ella inicio este negocio con mucho esfuerzo y con los ingresos que percibe logra sacar adelante su hogar y lo mas importante es que su negocio queda en su casa de habitacion y asi no descuida a sus hijos.
su mayor deseo es tener un negocio bien surtido para poder ofrecer los mejores productos y asi mejorar sus ingresos logrando asi un mejor nivel de vida,
texts.en:
Nora Zaleya has sold groceries at her own local, home-based store for 8 years now. She strategically selected its location as there is no competition in this area. She is married with 2 children, one of whom is a primary student at a public school. She worked hard to set up this business and maintains her home with her earnings. Her greatest priority is to keep her business running from home so that she doesn't neglect the needs of her children. Her greatest wish is to have a well-stocked store with which to offer the best products, increasing her income and providing a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Stilgoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, rice, butter, soap, eggs, sardines, chicken and coffee

loans.name: M.c.a Primary School, Sanbaia Bendugu Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of the M.C.A Primary School, Sanbaia Bendugu. M.C.A Primary School, Sanbaia Bendugu, was founded in 1955 by the Missionary Church of Africa. The school has a total of ten staff and two hundred and eighty-six pupils.

Teachers of this school have come to SMT for the first time to seek a loan. Teachers and other monthly wage earners come to SMT to seek a loan for several reasons: some use such loans to pay college fees for themselves, others use it to pay their children’s school fees, some invest it in their businesses or in their wives' businesses, some use it to buy pieces of furniture, and others invest it in building a house. At the end of each month, the school’s bursar will deduct the repayment amount of each teacher (borrower/group member) and deposit it with SMT’s cashier.
 
Martin J. S. (right) is the Head Master at the school. Mr. S. was born in Kono, in Eastern Sierra Leone. He is fifty-eight years old and married with five children. All of his children are attending schools – some in primary schools and others in secondary schools. He has been a teacher for twenty-eight years. With this loan, he will invest in his house-building project. He will use it to buy bundles of corrugated iron and zinc.

loans.use: Buy bundles of corrugated iron and zinc

loans.name: Vesitacion

texts.en:
Vesitacion A. is on her 2nd loan from HSPFI micro-finance. She is from Hinaplanan, Clavera, Mis. Or. in the Southern Philippines. She is married and blessed with seven children.

At present,the family's main sources of living are Vesitacion's variety store coupled with her husband's cultivated land which is planted with corn. At the age of 56, Vesitacion's humble desire is to expand their current business. Therefore, she is applying a loan from HSPFI, Kiva’s field partner, for a loan of PHP 6,000.

loans.use: To buy additional stock for her variety store and finances for her cultivated area

loans.name: Estefita

texts.es:
Estefita es Socia del Banco Comunal ”LA FLOR DE LA CANELA 2” vive en La Urbanización Municipal Mz. H3 Lt. 16, tiene 67 años y 7 hijos mayores de edad .
Desde muy joven Estefita vendía plátanos, la primera vez que obtuvo su préstamo de S/. 300.00 soles lo invirtió comprando abarrotes para formar su tiendita.
Con este préstamo de S/. 1000.00 surtirá mas su tiendita con abarrotes, golosinas y también comprará plátanos y así tener mas clientela.

Ella agradece Manuela Ramos por que es la única institución que le presta dinero y se siente feliz porque comparte  momentos inolvidables junto a las demás socias de su Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
Estefita is a member of La Flor de la Canela 2 Community Bank. She lives at La Urbanización Municipal Mz. H3 Lt. 16. She is 67, and she has seven grown children. From a very early age she has sold bananas. The first time she got a loan for 300 PEN she bought groceries to set up her small store. With this loan for 1,000 PEN, she will stock her little store with more groceries and sweets. She will also buy more bananas, and that way she will have more customers. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos because it is the only institution that lends her money. She feels happy because she shares unforgettable moments together with the rest of the members of her Community Bank.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy groceries, sweets, fruit.

loans.name: Rubby

texts.en: Rubby A. is divorced and has seven dependants. She has received schooling through primary school. Rubby sells assorted soap in Abotoase near Hohoe. Rubby, as a divorcee, is finding it difficult to take care of the family with her little income since she is solely responsible for all the financial needs of the seven dependants and other housekeeping expenses. Rubby will use the loan to purchase soap in large quantities to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Rubby plans to save.

loans.use: To purchase soap in bulk

loans.name: Adela Megina

texts.es:
Adela, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santa Ana”, Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia de Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 44 años y es madre de 01 hijo que aun depende de ella.

Con la seguridad de tener una buena sazón para la preparación de diferentes tipos de comidas, por iniciativa propia con  su primer crédito de S/. 300.00 emprendió su negocio de venta de comida diaria tipo menú, ubicada en su misma casa.
