En la actualidad, pese al tiempo transcurrido continúa con el mismo negocio, contando con una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acude a su puesto de venta, donde ella los atiende con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/ 2.000.00, comprará insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como sacos de arroz, azúcar; aceite en paquetes, pollos en javas y también  algunos utensilios  para implementar su negocio y dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Esta preparada para todo y aun se siente con muchas fuerzas para continuar trabajando y seguir adelante, Adela, agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Adela belongs to the Village Bank “Santa Ana” in the Moyobamba District, Province of Moyobamba, Department of San Martin. She lives with her partner, is 44 years old, and is a mother to 1 child that depends on her. With the security of having a great seasoning mix to prepare different types of foods, and with her own initiative, she used her first loan of 300 PEN to launch her business in the sale of food; she sells meals daily in her business which is located in her home. Currently, though time has passed she continues in the same business, relying on a loyal client base that seeks her food stall daily, where she attends to them with the charisma that she is known for. With this loan of 2,000 PEN, she will purchase supplies to prepare her daily meals such as a sack of rice, sugar, oil in packages, chicken, and also utensils to use in her business that will allow her to give her clients a better service. She is ready for anything and still feels strong enough to continue working and continue moving forward. Adela thanks the Manuela Ramos Movement for contributing to the fulfillment of her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies to prepare her food.

loans.name: Hope Group

texts.en: M. is a 38-year-old Ghanaian who dropped out of junior high school. He is married and has 2 children. He decided to get into business seriously when he encountered some difficulty continuing school. He is a fisherman who is involved in the sale of fish brought from overseas. He has been in this business for the past six years. He dreams about generating enough money to switch to another business and be able to send his children to school, provide good meals, medical care, etc.

loans.use: Additional nets and make additional canoes

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is 43 years old and married with 4 children. He is a goldsmith and he also sells gold jewelry to make a living. He hopes for the loan amount of N150,000 to purchase more materials to make more gold jewelery to sell.  He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials to make more gold jewelry to sell

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Cette dame a décidé en 2008 de vendre du fufu (tubercule d’igname pilée) accompagnée des sauces de mouton et de bœuf. Elle a pris cette décision, parce que son mari a eu sa retraite et il était difficile de subvenir aux besoins de leurs 03 enfants. Son mini restaurant est très fréquenté par les travailleurs du quartier Wéssomé de Lomé. Pour avoir de la viande à conserver pour la restauration, elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 2 moutons et 20 kilos de la viande bœuf.
texts.en:
Yawa A. is married and the mother of three children. When her husband retired, they found it hard to provide for them. She decided therefore in 2008 to open a mini-restaurant in which she sells fufu (pounded yam tuber) served with mutton and beef sauce. She has many guests among the working people in the Wéssomé neighborhood in Lomé. Yawa applies to WAGES for a loan to stock up with meat. She will buy 2 sheep and 20 kilograms of beef.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 2 sheep and 20 kilograms of beef

loans.name: Massan Kake

texts.fr: Massan Kake G. est une femme de 42 ans qui habite qui habite à Dafo avec son mari et ses 4 enfants. Elle est revendeuse d’oignons. Son activité consiste à s’approvisionner à Lomé et de revendre ses marchandises dans les marchés environnants. Avec les bénéfices de son activité Massan souhaite améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Massan Kake G. is a lady aged 42 who lives in Dafo with her husband and her four children. She is an onion retailer. She gets her supplies from Lomé and sells them at nearby markets. Massan wants to use the profit from her business to improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy onions for resale

loans.name: Gladys Yolanda

texts.es:
En el municipio de Somotillo, la señora Gladys S. se esfuerza grandemente para mejorar las condiciones de su negocio que es una pulpería cuya propietaria es ella misma por lo que está comprometida en el bienestar del negocio para lograr la satisfacción de cada uno de sus clientes.

Por esta razón es que ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar el crédito para la compra de los productos para llenar sus estantes y de esta manera mejorar las condiciones del negocio. Confía en que su crédito le será otorgado satisfactoriamente y así aumentará sus ingresos y continuará llevando el sustento a su hogar.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Somotillo, Mrs. Gladys S. works very hard to improve her business, which is a convenience store. Since she is the owner, she is very invested in the success of the business and satisfying every one of her customers. For this reason Gladys has come to CEPRODEL to ask for a loan to be used for the purchase of merchandise to fill her shelves and thus improve her business. Trust that her loaned funds will be delivered to her appropriately and that she will increase her sales, enabling her to continue to earn a living.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products to stock her general store.

loans.name: Allah Is One Group

texts.en:
Allah Is One is a group of 2 borrowers led by Fatu K.. Fatu is 35-years old and married with three children ages 6-15. She also cares for two orphans. Fatu is an illiterate due to muslims parents not educating their female children. Fatu and her family live in the  Sheriff Quarter, Voinjama, the capital of Lofa county in northern Liberia.

Fatu's business is selling house wares.She buys the goods wholesale and sells retail in the Voinjama central market, a business she has been doing for five years. Fatu's family depend on her business for their daily expenses, so she is eager to improve and expand what she sells. She is requesting a loan for this purpose. Fatu dreams of building a house for her and her family, and of giving her children better education.

loans.use: To purchase more house wares to improve business.

loans.name: Ericka Delfina

texts.en:
Ericka is a client of Asociación Arariwa. She is part of a communal bank consisting of 26 members in Cusco. The group is called El Amanecer, which means daybreak in Spanish. She is from Cusco and lives in Cusco. She is 24 years old and single with two children. One studies and the other is still a baby.

Ericka has sold groceries out of her house for the past two years and takes cares of her children. She will use this loan to buy more groceries to sell.  She sells approximately 200 – 250 soles per month.

Ericka appreciates and thanks you for the loan, and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 48 years old, married with 3 children aged 11,15, and 20 years old. Jacqueline lives in the Gicumbi district approximately a one hour's drive from Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda. Jacqueline is an experienced entrepreneur, owning a shop selling a variety of clothing styles since 2006. The hours of her business require that she work from 7 AM to 5 PM every day.

Jacqueline is seeking a small amount of additional capital to allow her to expand her business. For that reason, she is requesting her first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to purchase a greater variety of attractive clothes so that she may attract many customers as well as increase her sales and profits. If this business is successful, Jacqueline will be able to continue paying school fees and provide more food for her children. In addition she will be able to build a secure future for them.

loans.use: A GREATER VARIETY OF CLOTHES TO SELL

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 37 years old and married with two children, who are both attending school. She has a tailoring and dress-making business and has been in business for three years. She employs one person in her busy shop and says she mainly sells dresses and suits. She also earns some income from small-scale farming. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings from Faulu, a Kiva partner, and requested this loan for Kes. 60,000 to buy material and one sewing machine. 

Rose says she is hardworking and in the future, she would like to buy water tanks for irrigation and become an importer of materials and accessories.

loans.use: Buy materials and a sewing machine

loans.name: Eyra De La Soledad

texts.en:
Eyra is 58 years old and has two grown children. Her business is raising pigs and hens for resale. She chose to start this business about seven years ago when she and her husband needed to find a way to increase their household income in order to support the careers of their children. S

he is an excellent client of Fundación Leon 2000 and will use this loan to purchase pigs and hens and feed for both. Eyra dreams of having her own farm and of being self-sufficient. She reports that for a small family they don’t have any problems.

loans.use: Animals and feed

loans.name: Ndèye

texts.fr: Ndèye L. est une femme mariée sans enfant, elle est âgée de 27 ans. Elle est membre de Banc villageois depuis 3 ans et demi. Elle fait de l’embouche bovine et ovine et les profits générés par son activité lui permettent de soutenir  son mari dans la prise en charge de la maison.
texts.en:
Ndèye L. is a married woman with no children and she is 27 years old. She has been a member of the village bank for three and a half years. She carries out bovine and ovine fattening, and the profits generated by her business allow her to support her husband in covering the household expenses.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen her animal fattening business

loans.name: Channa's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Channa V. is 49 years old. She is a member of a group loan which consists of six people and is located in Sambour village, Kandal province. The entire group loan will be used by its members for different purposes. 

Mrs. Channa V. and her husband, Mr. Thorn Khim, are farmers who own a piece of land where they cultivate rice. They are facing some problems because the soil on the field is infertile and there are a lot of insects.  So she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides. 

Mrs. Channa V. is the mother of three children, one of whom is a waiter and the other two are students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Feryal

texts.en: Feryal is a married woman and has one child. After having her first baby, she decided to open an accessories and gadgets shop in 2005 after seeing a need for such services in the region. This market is very large and known, which is the reason why she opened such a business to make a good profit. Today, Feryal is asking to borrow $1,200 to develop her shop and buy more merchandise such as accessories, gadgets and bags to attract more clients.

loans.use: To expand her shop and buy more merchandise.

loans.name: Tendo Development Group, Mukono

texts.en:
M. Saidat is the leader of his lending group in Mukono. He appears in the small photo on the left and also in the large photo.

M. is a friendly and hardworking man with a strong determination to grow his business. He is involved in the sale of charcoal in Kavule and in brick-making in Bukasa. 

In his business transactions, Saidat is faced with the challenge of transporting charcoal from the villages to his work station. He needs a loan to be able to buy more bags of charcoal and to prepare soil for making bricks during this rainy season.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal and to employ labor to prepare soil for making bricks.

loans.name: Jovanna

texts.es:
Jovanna es una mujer muy entregada a su trabajo, tiene 26 años y es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos y vive en la casa de sus padres.

Es amante de la agricultura, ya que la realizó desde su infancia; siembras higos, mangos, paltas y manzanas en la chacra de sus padres. Después de cada cosecha, laboriosamente encajona los higos y demás frutas que siembra para enviarlos al mercado de frutas de la ciudad. Hace ya 4 años que se dedica a este negocio y una vez por semana compra y vende otras frutas con la finalidad de captar mayores utilidades. Por el momento trabaja con la ayuda de sus hermanos y el apoyo de su padre, pero para más adelante quiere independizarse y dedicarse el mayor tiempo a la compra y venta de frutas, ya que lo considera muy rentable.

Este es su quinto préstamo con MFP y no ha tenido problemas de retraso en sus pagos, pues en todo este tiempo ha participado satisfactoriamente en su banco comunal, ya que es la presidenta de la junta directiva. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará fertilizantes químicos para sus cultivos, además de incrementar el capital para su negocio de venta de frutas.
texts.en:
Jovanna is a woman devoted to her work. She is 26 years old, is a single mom with two children, and lives in her parents' house. She loves agriculture as she has been involved in it since her childhood. She sows figs, mangoes, avocados, and apples in her parents' farm. After each harvest, she diligently packages the figs and other fruits to send them to the fruit market in the city. She has been working in this line of business for four years. She buys other kinds of fruit once a week to sell in an effort to increase her earnings. At the moment her brothers and father support her but in the future she would like to be fully independent and devote more time to the purchase and sale of fruit as she considers it very profitable. This is her fifth loan with MFP. She hasn't been late in her payments and has participated responsibly in her communal bank where she is president of the executive board. With the loan she is asking she will purchase chemical fertilizer for her crops and increase the investment in her fruit business.

Translated from Spanish by Rocio Vargas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer

loans.name: Leinh

texts.en:
Mrs. Leinh M., 55, is a local farmer who is assisted by her husband in her farming business. They live and work with their six children in Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. Three of their children are employed in different jobs and provide a small income to support the family. Leinh M. and her husband make about $3 USD per day. They work hard every day because they need income to support their family. Leinh M. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and a pumping machine for her farming business.
Note: Mrs. Leinh's husband is shown in the picture above.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and a pumping machine

loans.name: Tsedenjargal

texts.en: Tsedenjargal is 45 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, the traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, on a plot of land with a yard, which belongs to his aunt. Tsedenjargal manufactures men's suits and coats and his wife, Davaasuren sells them at Narantuul, the biggest market in Mongolia. In addition, they purchase suits in China and sell them at their counter. They have been planning to purchase a large amount of suits in anticipation for the upcoming university and high school graduations in the spring. Tsedenjargal has been operating his business since 1995 and has steadily expanded his business. Tsedenjargal is a very hardworking person and says, “My oldest daughter is going to graduate from her university soon and I started saving money for her graduation. In addition I would like to provide a good education for my son.” He is requesting a 1,500,000-tugrug loan to purchase more inventory for his business.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
Sem S., 31, is married and resides with her husband and one child in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for clay and ceramic products. She raises ducks and chickens for an income of about USD $2 per day. Her husband works cutting glasses, earning an income of USD $6.50 per day to help cover the family expenses.  

S. has requested a loan of USD $1000 to purchase groceries to sell at home. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva Field Partner in Cambodia. S. and her husband are pictured together.

loans.use: To buy groceries to resell

loans.name: Juana Gloria

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE ECCE HOMO”; Nuestra socia vive en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la  Sra. JUANA,  ella tiene 24 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos de 3 y 1 años de edad, Nuestra socia alterna sus actividades con el comercio minorista. La socia envía pollos vivos al departamento de Puerto Maldonado; a su hermana mayor para que ella los venda y luego les envíe el dinero de retorno, Nuestra socia viene trabajando 1 años con la modalidad de bancos comunales; La socia también vende verduras su conyugue es obrero. Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para comprar pollos, verduras y con una pequeña parte su conyugue comprara herramientas, nuevo serrucho y martillo. 

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our partner belongs to the Senor de Ecce Homo village bank and lives in the Huanchac district in Cusco, Peru. Her name is Juana and she is 24 years old and a single mother of two children, 1 and 3 years old. She works as a retail saleswoman sending live chickens to her sister in the department of Puerto Maldonado who sells them and then sends Juana her share of the money. She has worked with village banks for the past year. She also sells vegetables; her partner is a blue-collar worker. She is seeking a loan to purchase chickens, vegetables and with a small part for her partner, she will purchase tools, a new saw, and a hammer. She is grateful for the support she is receiving through this loan and commits to pay her debts on time.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chickens, vegetables, tools, a saw, and a hammer

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina B. is from the village of Old Damulog, Damulog Bukidnon. She is 46 years old. Cristina is married and has 5 children. To make a living, Cristina owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Cristina has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 7,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Cristina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cristina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Cristina is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Cristina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is married with four children. All of her children are in school. Sofia also looks after other family members. Sofia resides in and owns a three-room house, and her family has access to electricity and piped water. Sofia's main monthly expense is school fees.

Formerly, Sofia dealt in charcoal, but she changed her business to a retail shop. She has been in this business for a few months. Her customers are the local people. Sofia plans to use this loan to buy more merchandise, such as bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, and cooking oil.

Sofia works seven days a week. She depends on this job to make a living. Sofia aspires to begin selling by wholesale only. She decided to work with MCDT in order to acquire more capital for her business.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise, such as bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, and cooking oil

loans.name: Dios Proveera 1 Group

texts.en:
Fior is the coordinator of her group, Dios Proveera (God Will Provide), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti).

Fior’s group is located in the lush rugged Samana peninsula, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home there in a simple structure with her longterm partner and their two children.

Fior is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza and she is excited to invest in her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling underwear by adding a jewelry element to it. With this loan she will purchase the jewelry that she plans to sell. She will use the profits to invest in school supplies and medicine for her children.

loans.use: To buy silver jewelry to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine C. is a 48-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating 2 business ventures: a small eatery (carinderia) and an electronic reloading businesses. She lives in Poblacion, Oslob, Cebu. 

Josephine has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2003 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her small eatery and electronic reloading businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average income of PHP 20,000/month. 

Josephine is now borrowing PHP 29,500 to use as additional working capital for her small eatery. This will be her 16th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 29,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom.  Josephine aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en: Juvy P. is a widow who lives in Prk. Kaisdaan, Brgy. Daga, Cadiz City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a general store and a food-vending business. She has seven children who are between the ages of 6 and 23 years old. One of her children helps her run the businesses. Juvy joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 because she wanted something better for her family. With the help of her past 17 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, and by the sweat of her brow, Juvy has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty. Her previous loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of 6,000 PHP, improving the family's standard of living. This time, for her 18th loan, she is borrowing 18,000 PHP, which she intends to use as additional working capital for her general store and food vending businesses. She wants to continue to save up for the future of her business and family. Juvy P. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: For additional working capital

loans.name: Lupe Irene

texts.es:
La Señora. Lupe Irene L. es socia del banco comunal Unión Progresista, vive en la comunidad de Pichacay que  pertenece a la parroquia de Santa Ana, esta parroquia se caracteriza por su gente  que es muy amable y cálida,  se dedican a la cría de animales y a la agricultura, este sector tiene un clima frio.

Doña Lupe tiene 42 años, es casada y tiene  un niño de 12 años de edad que este año ingresa al colegio, su esposo es negociante de ganado, esta actividad más el trabajo de su esposa les ha permitido construir su casa propia.

La Señora. Lupe Irene y su esposo se dedican al negocio de compra y venta de ganado, venden los días de feria y ya tienen varios años en este negocio.

Es nuestra socia hace 8 años y los créditos le han servido mucho en su hogar y también en su negocio, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de ganado para seguir creciendo con su negocio.

Su meta es comprarse un terreno.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lupe Irene L. is a partner in the Unión Progresista community bank. She lives in the town of Pichacay, which is part of the parrish of Santa Ana. This parrish is known for its warm and kind people, though it has a cold climate. She works raising animals and crops. Lupe is 42 years old and is married with a 12-year old son who is starting high school this year. Her husband works in the cattle business, and his business along with her work have allowed them to build their own house. She has been a community bank partner for eight years and the loans have helped her business and her home. She will use the loan money to purchase cattle and thus continue growing her business. Her goal is to buy a plot of land.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Wendy De Fátima

texts.es: La Sra. Wendy de Fátima A. H.   ella  se desempeña  como Maestra de Educación Secundaria, tiene  tres años de trabajar como docente, tiene un niño en edad escolar, es casada actualmente. Ha tenido  cuatro créditos con CEPRODEL y los ha realizado para comprar materiales de construcción para mejorar su casa de habitación los cuales los créditos con Ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Wendy de Fátima A. has been employed as a secondary school teacher for three years. She is married and has a school aged son. She has had four loans with CEPRODEL that she’s used to buy building materials and supplies to make some home improvements. Ceprodel loans have been of great use to her in that they have made it possible for her to improve her and her family’s living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies: paving stones, sand, cement, etc.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina P. is a married woman who lives in Santa Cruz, Brgy. Don Virgilio, Medellin, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a fishing  business.  Her husband, Elenito P., who is 47 years old, works as a plumber to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have seven children between the ages of 3 and 24. Three of them have their own jobs while the other four children are currently going to school.

Gina joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past seven loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Gina has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. 

Her previous loan of 23,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of about $342, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 8th cycle loan, she is borrowing 23,000PHP which she intends to use to buy fishing gear so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Gina P. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF:  
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase of fishing gear

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline B. is 41 years old, married and has three school-aged children. She is from the village of D'ban Calamba in Misamis Occidental province on the Mindanao islands. Evangeline sells furniture for the home to tourists and local community members. Evangeline has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Evangeline joined GDMPC to gain access to its financial services. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP from GDMPC that was used to purchase the raw materials needed to make her furniture. Evangeline is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used for the same purpose. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to supplement her family's income.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to make furniture

loans.name: Baltazar

texts.en:
Baltazar P. is from the village of Matusalem. He is 47 years old. Baltazar is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Baltazar owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Baltazar has been engaged in his business for over 18 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Baltazar joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Baltazar has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. Baltazar is requesting a new loan of 26,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the 9th loan taken out by Baltazar from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 34 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Paulina Enoe

texts.es: La señora Paulina Enoe C., tiene un negocio en su casa de habitación a cuatro cuadra del bisne, es madre un hijo que estudia en la universidad y por el que se esfuerza bastante, lleva cuatro años de trabajar con nuestra institución y se siente bien agradecida con el personal que la ha atendido ya que con estos financiamientos ha sacado adelante a su hijo y su casa ha mejorado bastante.
texts.en: Ms. Paulina Enoe C. runs a shop in her house, located four blocks from El Bisne. She has a son who attends university, and it is for him that she works very hard. She has been working with our institution for four years and she is deeply thankful to the personnel who has assisted her, as thanks to these loans she has provided for her son and has made a few improvements to her house.

loans.use: To buy fruits to prepare drinks and plastic bags.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en: Geoffrey is requesting for a loan of Kes. 50,000 to buy a computer and a tool box for his business. He operates "Mass Wave", a mobile phone repair shop in a busy part of Nairobi. He is 25 years old and married. Geoffrey is a member of Kikwetu SHG and the group has guaranteed this loan. He describes himself as quiet, humble, hard-working and focused.

loans.use: To buy a computer and a tool box

loans.name: Juana Elisa

texts.es:
Juana Elisa S. Z. tiene 31 años. Es casada, vive con el esposo y los hijos viven  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDOS SOMO MAS, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto el Marañon, por la parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo viejo, esta ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz fréjol. 

Juana se dedica de manera especial al cultivo de maíz, arroz y fréjol desde hace 8 años. Los productos lo comprar en Comercial López en Ventanas y los vende en el mercado de Ventanas y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es  comprar casa y terreno.
Le gusta escuchar música.
texts.en:
Juana S. Z. is 31 years old.  She is married and lives with her husband and children in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.  She has 2 children.

The 'Unidos Somos Más' (Together We Are More) community bank is located in Marañon district, in Puerto Pechiche parish, in Pueblo Viejo canton.  The members of this community bank work in short cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice and beans.

Juana has been growing corn, rice and beans for 8 years. She is requesting this loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for her crops.  The support of this loan would help her financially to cover her needs.  She faces challenges such as insect infestations, crop diseases and changes in the climate.  Her dream is to buy her own house and plot of land.  She likes listening to music.

loans.use: Farming supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca N. lives in the Kisaasi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has three children, all of whom are in school. 

Rebecca sells half bricks as a business. She has been in this business for 10 years and she works one day out of every week. Rebecca sells her products in a shop on a wholesale basis. 

Rebecca has requested from MCDT SACCO a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings, which she will use to buy more half bricks for resale. She also generates additional income through her beauty salon.

The main business challenges for Rebecca include transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked hardware shop.

Rebecca lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more half bricks for resale

loans.name: Lourdes Celia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “BUENA ESPERANZA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Lourdes Celia; ella tiene 48 años de edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa deportiva, ella tiene una tienda donde vende buzos, pantalones, polos y short, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia quiere mejorar y ampliar el negocio de venta de ropa deportiva. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para hacer la ropa deportiva.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Lourdes Celia belongs to the "Buena Esperanza" (Good Hope) community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Lourdes Celia is 48 years old, married and has four children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling sports clothing.  She has a store where she sells tracksuits, pants, tops and shorts.  She works from 8.00am to 7.00pm.

Lourdes Celia would like to improve and expand her business selling sports clothing.  She is requesting this loan to buy materials for making sports clothing.  She is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy materials for making sports clothing

loans.name: Oung

texts.en:
Oung K. is a 38-year-old lady who lives with her family in the Moulkorl Borey village in Banteay Meanchey. She is an internal officer for a private company. She has been working in this sector since 1999, and earns an average of $5 per day. 

Recently, to harvest her rice crops, she had hired a few domestic laborers.  Now it is the time to pay them.  However, her savings are not enough to pay this cost in full.  Oung K. is asking for a loan to supplement her personal savings to pay for this harvesting cost.

loans.use: To pay for harvesting cost

loans.name: Mariluz

texts.es: Mariluz tiene 30 años, tiene dos hijos. Su actividad económica de es la venta de mercadería en general como ropa, calzado, perfumes, cremas entre otras cosas. Hace más de 5 años que ella decide iniciar este negocio porque no tenía un trabajo estable y necesitaba proporcionarle a su familia el pan de cada día, es así que ella empieza a visitar a sus amigos vecinos y otras personas que le realizaban encargos. Ella solicita este financiamiento para la compra de lápiz labial, polvos, bolsos y calzado. Siempre está soñando con aumentar su inventario y tener su propia tienda.
texts.en:
Mariluz is 30 years old and has two children. Her business involves selling general merchandise such as clothing, shoes, perfumes, crèmes, and other items. She started this business more than five years ago because she did not have a stable job and needed to provide for her family’s daily needs. Therefore, she began visiting friends, neighbors, and other people who placed orders with her.

Mariluz is requesting this loan to buy lipsticks, powders, purses, and shoes. She is always dreaming about increasing her inventory and having her own store.

loans.use: Purchase lipsticks, powders, purses, and shoes

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: La Sra. Margarita  vive con su hija quien se encuentra en su primer año de universidad. Ellas viven en la zona de alto san isidro que esta a veinte minutos del centro de la ciudad. La Sra. margarita tiene una tienda de barrio desde hace cuatro años. Ella es divorciada pero a pesar de esto ella trabaja mucho para que su hija pueda terminar sus estudios superiores. En esta oportunidad ella solicita el préstamo para aumentar el capital de su tienda con material escolar debido a que ya comenzaron las clases en los todos los colegios y necesita abastecerse para poder vender a sus clientes  que ya le están solicitando, es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Margarita lives with her daughter who is in the first year of university.  They live in the Alto San Isidro zone which is twenty minutes from downtown.  Margarita has had a neighborhood grocery store for four years.

She is divorced but despite this she works hard so that her daughter may finish her higher education.

On this occasion she is asking for the loan to increase her store’s capital with school supplies since classes have started in all the schools and she needs to stock up to sell to her customers who are already asking for things.

She is a responsible, hard working person who is grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: To buy school supplies.

loans.name: 'juah Nyansuah' Group

texts.en:
Togba N., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of two borrowers called 'Juah N.'. He is 56 years old, married, and has nine children who are between the ages of 32 to 6 years old. He is a Physician's Assistant. 

For 26 years, he has been operating a clinic at Caldwell Junction, Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 20,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 40,000 Liberian Dollars business loan to buy more drugs and one hospital bed. 

He describes himself as patient man whose goals are to improve his business and open a block factory.

loans.use: To buy more drugs and one hospital bed

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
This is Milagros R., 62, a mother of one child who is currently studying in college.  Milagros works hard to help her husband Perlito who is a taxicab driver.  Together, they live in Apilo Cuz, Pasay City.

Milagros has a business buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing for infants, teens, and adults.  She buys these items at wholesale prices and sells them to her patrons with a minimum markup.  Monthly, she earns an estimated income of around Php6,000.

To help her grow this business, she is requesting a loan of Php15,000. She intends to use this money to buy additional merchandise from known local brands. She is thankful because this loan will enable her to meet the growing number of orders as the number of her regular customers increases.

Milagros strives hard, knowing that her income from this effort will make her prepared for any urgent, unexpected need. She also dreams of a good and happy life for her family.

As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she receives.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to restock her clothing business

loans.name: Svet Sharshekeeva's Group

texts.en:
Svet S., 51, is the leader of this group. She is married and a mother of a nine-year-old daughter. She lives in the village of Kochkor. The couple managed to make furnishings for their house and purchase some electrical appliances.

Svet breeds various types of cattle and resells them in a local market to meat-packing firms. Svet and her husband are members of a local farming group that is actively involved in promoting agriculture and cattle breeding and defending the rights of farmers.

The loan from Kiva lenders will be spent on purchasing extra heads of cattle for further breeding and reselling. Svet is very thankful to lenders, since they will pull her family out of a very tough financial state.

This loan is being presented by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious, socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of its “3-Ps” concept: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow larger) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year.

To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team—Supporters of Kyrgyzstan—at: http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase more heads of cattle

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Fifty-one-year-old Anahit G., who lives in the city of Vanador, has been selling women’s clothes for over 14 years. Purchasing clothes from Yerevan and Turkey, she resells them in the Vanadzor clothes market where she rents a stall. Now requesting her 12th loan for 1.000.000 AMD to buy dresses, skirts and ladies' trousers to resell, she has always made her repayments in a timely fashion.

Anahit lives with her husband and her daughter-in-law, while her son is currently in Russia.

loans.use: to buy dresses, skirts and ladies' trousers to resell

loans.name: Erwina

texts.en:
Erwina M. is from the village of P-2, Taboc Norte, Oroquieta City. She is 29 years old. Erwina is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Erwina works in a family member's fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting and selling farm-raised fish in the local community. Erwina has been engaged in her business for more than a year and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Erwina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erwina is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Erwina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks & nets

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
La señora Guadalupe M.  x, es casada con el señor  Cirilo Sánchez Sánchez y tiene tres hijos a su responsabilidad: Elba areli de diesi seis años de edad en segundo semestre de preparatoria, lucia Guadalupe de nueve años en quinto de primaria  y el más pequeño es Ignacio de Jesús de siete años en segundo de primaria.

    Ella solicito el préstamo en la compra de ingredientes, como son: harina, aceite azúcar, huevo, entre  otro para la elaboración de panes, en donde lleva  tres años y siente meses en donde nos comenta que le va bien pues con ello ha logrado tener ingresos y construir su horno .

    Comenta que ella aprendió gracias su mama  que desde muy pequeña la a poyaba  cuando ella los elaboraba y salía a venderlo en las  comunidades cercanas de su localidad y cuando creció decidió dedicarse a lo mismo y dice que le va bien.

      Su más grande deseo es que con esta actividad y t el préstamo pueda seguir trabajando para así tener más ingresos   y apoyar a sus hijos que están estudiando.
texts.en:
Guadalupe M. x is married to Cirilo Sánchez Sánchez and has 3 children in her care.  Elba Areli is 16 and in the second year of high school; Lucia Guadalupa, 9, is in  5th grade; and the youngest, Ignacio de Jesús, is 6 and in 2nd grade.  

Guadalupe is seeking a loan to buy ingredients, including flour, oil, sugar, eggs, etc., to make bread, which she's been doing for 3 years and 7 months.  She says it's going well and she was able to earn the money to build an oven.  

She says that she learned thanks to her mother. From the time she was very young, she helped her mother out when she made bread and went out to sell it in nearby communities.  When she grew up she decided to do the same thing and says she's doing well.

Guadalupe's biggest wish is that with her work and the loan, she'll be able to keep on working so she can earn more and help her kids, who are in school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make bread, including cheese, flour, oil, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Morning Dew Group

texts.es: La Sra. Laura  es conviviente  y tiene 21 años D. edad, actualmente es integrante en la alcancía comunal “El Roció del Amanecer”  conformado por 9 socios que se dedican a diversas actividades D. comercio. Laura trabaja desD. hace 6 años en la venta D. productos D. belleza y a la venta D. ropa en el mercado, Laura  nos cuenta que empezó este trabajo desD. que tenía 15 años ya que su familia también se dedicaba a este negocio,  también porque quería obtener mejores ingresos económicos para poder estudiar, pero ahora que tiene 2 hijos desea mejorar la calidad D. vida D. sus hijos, darles una buena educación. Gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación se ha comprado sus cosas por ejemplo platos, cucharas, una cómoda, cocina, artefactos. Su sueño D. Laura es vender ropa al por mayor.  El préstamo que se le otorgo fue para comprar mercadería.  Sabemos que Laura  cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos D. Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en: Laura is married common-law, 21 years old, and she is a member of the communal bank "El Rocio del Amanecer", meaning "Morning Dew". It is maD. up of 9 members who carry out various business activities. Laura has been working for the past 6 years in selling beauty products and clothing in the market. Laura tells us that she started her business when she was 15 years old especially because her family also had this type of business. She also wanted to have a better income to be able to go to school. But now she has 2 children and she wants to improve their quality of life and to proviD. them with a good education. Thanks to her efforts and dedication she has purchased some products such as plates, spoons, a cabinet, a stove, and kitchen implements. Laura's dream is to sell clothing in wholesale. The loan that has been granted will be use to purchase merchandise. We know that Laura will meet her goals through handwork and effort and that the loans from Edaprospo (Kiva Field Partner) will help her.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for wholesale

loans.name: Dilfuzahon's Group

texts.en:
Dilfuzahon is the leader of this group. She is 42 and married to a cook. Her husband works in Kazakhstan, so Dilfuzahon takes care of two sons by herself. The first son works in construction and earns 3,000 KGS per month. The second son studies at school. 

In order to contribute money to the family budget, Dilfuzahon cultivates cotton and breeds livestock animals. In this way she earns an additional 5,000 KGS per month. With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase more sheep for breeding. She hopes that the loan will help her to expand the business. With money gained from reselling livestock, she wants to finish a house construction.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 28 years old, married and has two children.

Khaled is a carpenter. In 2005, he opened his own workshop. He has much experience, a good reputation and is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $2,000 loan to buy a diesel generator for his workshop. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a diesel generator for his workshop.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is 26 years old and lives in the town of Njeru in the Jinja region of Uganda. He is single and has no children. Henry has a business of a boutique that sells clothes, which he has had for less than one year.         

To help expand his business, Henry has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase clothes for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Henry hopes to generate greater profits and take care of himself like buying new clothes.  

In the future, Henry hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale.

loans.name: Duncan

texts.en: Duncan is a hardworking 22-year-old single businessman. For the last 4 years, he has been making his living by selling cakes. He was previously engaged in farming. In the next 5 years, Duncan wants to have started other similar businesses. Duncan is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to buy cakes for sale. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, his business can easily access finances.

loans.use: to buy cakes

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for seven years. Nenita works hard to support her family. 
Nenita has requested a loan of 14,000 PHP through Kiva partner, NWTF, to purchase fishing gear and equipment.
In the future, Nenita would like to save enough money to provide good living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing gear and equipment.

loans.name: María Rosario

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Señoras. De Taguan, vive por la parroquia de San Bartolo, este lugar es de clima frió, su gente se dedica a la ganadería y agricultura, muchos laboran diariamente en la ciudad de Cuenca regresando a sus hogares en la noche, son personas muy amables y mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.

Doña María tiene 57 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 7 hijos, dos de  sus hijos son casados e independientes, sus cinco hijos solteros trabajan y le ayudan  económicamente. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad. 

La Señora. María se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos, en su casa cría  gallinas, cerdos y ganado los que los vende en su comunidad.
 
Se encuentra en su sexto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de cerdos y su alimento.
 
Su meta es tener ganado.
texts.en:
María is a member of the “Señoras de Taguan” (Taguan Ladies).  She lives in San Bartolo Parish, a cold climate location.  Its residents raise livestock and farm.  Many work daily in the city of Cuenca returning home at night.  They are very kind people who maintain their culture and traditions.

María is 57 years old and she’s had seven children.  Two of her children are married and live independently.  Her single children work and help her out economically.  Her husband’s a farmer.  The house they live in is their own.

María does domestic chores and raises chickens, pigs and cattle at home that she sells in her community.

She is in her sixth loan with the communal bank and she is going to use it to buy pigs and feed for them.  Her goal is to own cattle.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed for them.

loans.name: Ka

texts.en:
To earn a living, Mrs. Ka, age 35, works hard to provide for her family. She now has four children who are living under her income. All of her children are school-age. Presently, she is a fish seller in one market far away from her community. From this business, she earns about $5 per day. Currently, she would like to have a new motorbike for supporting her business. So, Ka has decided to request some funds through HKL partner with Kiva in order to purchase a new motorbike. She hopes that this fund will improve her business. 

She said that she is very grateful to all lenders that support funds to her family. In the future she will send all her children to study at high level, as other families in her community.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike.

loans.name: Goodwork Group

texts.en:
Amiri, who is in his late 20s, is married with two children, one of whom goes to school. He is a driver and also has had a fruits and vegetables business for three years now. He works from 7am to 9pm daily and is able to generate decent monthly profits.

This will be his third Motisha loan from Kiva's partner, Tujijenge Tanzania. A Motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that motivates borrowers with good credit ratings who pay back their loans smoothly to receive half the amount of the existing loan before their original loan term has ended. He used the previous loans to increase his stock and cover household expenses. He has paid back all his loans successfully. Amiri is now requesting a loan to increase his stock of fruits and vegetables. His dream is to one day be able to build his own house.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Goodwork" which has a total of 12 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To increase his stock of fruits and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
This is Magdalena, 61, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Pacifico and mother to their three children. 

She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Magdalena operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located near the roadside of their community. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,200 in sales every day. She also earns additional income from room rentals in her house.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 33,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Magdalena hopes to add rice grains in her store and prays to God for her family to always be in good health. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 4 children. 
Rogelio has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. He has had this business for 11 years. He requested a loan of PHP 9,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages .
Rogelio has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future,Rogelio hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Silvia Lorena

texts.es:
Doña Silvia tiene 33 años de edad y tiene una pulperia, ahi vende todo tipo de abarroteria, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitacion en el caserio San Bernardo, Namasigue. Silvia se levanta todos los dias a las 5 de la mañana para atender su fiel clientela.  Silvia es madre de 2 hijos los cuales los tiene estudiando en el centro educativo de la comunidad.

juntos con su esposo trabajan duro para sacar adelante a sus hijos.
en sus tiempos libres Silvia cria gallinas.
texts.en:
Silvia is 33 years old and she has a small grocery store. She sells all kinds of grocery items. Her business is located in her home in the small town of San Bernardo, Namasique. Silvia gets up every day at 5:00 in the morning to tend to her loyal customers. Silvia is mother to 2 small children. They are studying in the local school in the community.
 
She and her husband work hard together to help their children get ahead. 

In her free time, Silvia raises chickens.

loans.use: to buy beans, tortillas, flour, eggs, soft drinks, juices, sugar, coffee, bread, dairy products, oatmeal, cereals, toilet paper, sanitary napkins, candies, chips, soups, pastas, and soaps

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr:
Abra est une femme âgée de 43 ans. Elle est mariée à un maçon et a 3 enfants tous scolarisés. Le premier enfant a 9 ans et le dernier a 3 ans. 
Abra travaille comme revendeuse depuis 1985.  Elle achète et revend des produits d’alimentation générale à toutes personnes à son domicile. Elle achète ces produits au grand marché de Lomé et est souvent aidée par ses enfants dans son activité.  
Abra a requis son troisième crédit de  WAGES afin d’acheter des produits d’alimentation générales destinés à la vente. Elle veut avec les profits supplémentaires de son activité, développer une autre activité secondaire.
Dans les prochaines années, Abra voudrait agrandir son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit payer la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
Abra is a 43-year-old woman. She is married to a mason and has three children all attending school. The eldest child is 9 years old and the youngest is three.

Abra has been working as a retail merchant since 1985. She buys and sells grocery products to all-comers from her home. She gets her supplies from the great market in Lomé and is often assisted by her children in running her business.

Abra has requested her third WAGES credit loan to purchase grocery products for resale. With the profits gained from her business, she wants to develop another sideline activity. In coming years, Abra would like to expand her business. She said that with the profits she expects to pay for their children's schooling.

loans.use: Buy grocery products

loans.name: Melony

texts.en:
Melony is 37 years old, married and lives with her husband and children. Melony is a very patient person and a hardworking mother. She will do anything for her family.

Melony has a retail shop located in their village. She is asking for a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos to purchase different products that she can offer to the village to have additional income. For the future, Melony dreams that someday her business will expand so that she can meet all the needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy spices, snack foods, canned goods and drinks for her store.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is married and blessed with three children who are in school. 

She has run a tailoring business for the last four years to support her family. She has stayed in business because of her hard work. In the next five years, she plans to establish a wholesale business. 

Christine has requested a loan of 23,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a sewing machine and to add to her stock of fabric.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and to add to her stock of fabric.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 34 years old, married with two children and she's from Clarin, Misamis Occidental. 

Marivic is operating a specialized retail store, selling a variety of food products in the local community to earn a living. She has been 7 years in this business and she earns 3,200 PHP a month. 

In 2010, Marivic joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marivic is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. Marivic hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Gary Zaldy

texts.en:
Gary Zaldy has been engaged in selling dry goods in the public market while his wife works abroad. He is 34 years old and has no children yet. The couple aims to earn and save more income to build their own house and establish a home-based business. In this regard, Gary Zaldy plans to improve his business by selling different kinds of dry goods to meet his customers' demand.

Due to inadequate capital, Gary Zaldy is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy additional stocks of dry goods such as pants, t-shirts, blouses, jackets, short pants and underwear to sell in the market. He believes that when he works hard for it, he will make his business grow and achieve his goals in the future. Gary Zaldy mentioned that the loan will help him to work out his plan.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of dry goods to sell

loans.name: Heang

texts.en: Heang, 56, is married and resides with her husband and five children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She and her husband are rice farmers. Two of her children are garment workers. Heang requests a loan of USD 300 to buy an ox to plow her rice field. In the future, she plans to grow rice twice a year, build fence around the house and support her youngest son to study until he gets Bachelor degree.

loans.use: to purchase an ox  to plow her rice field

loans.name: Rebecca G.'s Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of a primary school based in Kenema city. This school was founded in 1954 by the Catholic Mission to improve education. Teachers of the school have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, to seek a loan. 

This is the second loan that teachers of the school have benefited from SMT/Kiva lenders. They requested a loan of 6,000,000 SLL for the entire group. With the help of this second loan, these teachers are in a better position once again to buy or invest in something that their mere salaries cannot let them do.

Rebecca is the leader of the group. She is age fifty-five. She was born in Bonthe. She is a widow and has four children – two in secondary school and two in college. Rebecca has been in the teaching profession for twenty-eight years now. She has requested this loan in order to pay her son’s college fees.

loans.use: to pay her son’s college fees.

loans.name: Mama's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Bonna Soforal est créé le 04 décembre 2009. ses membres habitent le même village et sont liés par un bon voisinage. Leur activité principale est le commerce de détail de divers produits saisonniers.
Mme Maïmouna Sibo est l'emprunteur vedette. Elle est âgée de 36 ans, mariée et mère de 03 garçons et 02 filles. Sur la photo, elle est debout à droite, levant la main gauche. 
Elle achète des balais et autres produits saisonniers qu'elle vend à la capital. Elle y achète des chaussures et sacs à main qu'elle vient vendre dans le village. 
Avec les bénéfices, elle va aider son époux à prendre en charge la scolarité et la santé des enfants.
texts.en:
The Bonna Soforal group was created on 4 December 2009. Its members live in the same village and know each other because of good neighborhood relations. Their primary business is to sell all sorts of seasonal products on a retail basis. 

Maïmouna Sibo is the featured borrower. She is 36 years old, married, and the mother of three boys and two girls. In the photo, she is standing on the right, with her left hand raised. She buys brooms and other seasonal products that she sells in the capital. She then buys shoes and handbags to sell back in her village. With the profits, she is going to help her husband provide for their children's schooling and health needs.

loans.use: to buy a variety of goods to sell on a retail basis

loans.name: Retiayo 2 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe RETIAYO 2 est composé de trois personnes qui sont dans le même quartier et sont membres d’une même association dans le quartier. C'est la quatrième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Amina est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo et n'a pas fréquentée l’école. Amina  est âgée de 30 ans et vit au Bénin. Amina est mariée à un couturier du nom de Kassim. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Amina vend depuis dix ans des sachets de façon ambulante. Amina s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Amina ensemble avec les membres du  groupe RETIAYO 2 sollicite un quatrième crédit. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des sachets.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 42 years old. He has 4 children and his main business is poultry. He began this business because of a very high demand for eggs.

Peter will use the loan to buy poultry feeds and more layers. He hopes to collect 500 trays of eggs daily. His challenge is high prices for poultry feeds. He is optimistic that with continued financial support, the sky is the limit.

loans.use: to buy feeds and chicks

loans.name: Ingrid

texts.en:
Ingrid has a business where she raises and sells chickens. She started off a couple of months ago when her husband gave her $20 to invest in 60 chicks. With another $20 she had in savings she bought the chicken feed and set up her backyard as the raising grounds. The chickens have already been pre-sold to her clients and they will be ready for delivery in early December.

She is looking to take out a second loan in order to invest in 300 more chicks for her operation. She will also need to buy feed and prepare her backyard. Ingrid is a mother of 3 small children. Her husband is a handy man and helped her build the cages for the chicks.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy more chickens to raise

loans.name: Atik

texts.en:
Atik is 40 year old, and she makes "lontong" and "bacang," local delicacies made of rice wrapped in banana leaves, to be sold in her small kiosk that is constructed out of bamboo. Atik has been selling only "lontong," but she would like to broaden her offerings by selling instant noodle, sugar, sweet ketchup and other snacks. From MBK, Atik requested a $50 loan, to be partly used to make bamboo hats that she sells once a week to a collector that comes to her house. She expects to sell 15 hats in a week (Rp. 1000 / about 10 US cents each), and for the kiosk to net her about $5 profit a day.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: To buy more bamboos

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en: Hadija lives in the Buza area, on the outskirts of Dar es Salaam. She is married with four children and she sells maize flour to shops and food vendors. She prepares the flour by herself. She buys the maize in retail, sends it to the milling machine and packs the product in packets of 5-10 kilograms. She also sells bi-product as animal feed. She is planning to increase her stocks of maize as she is usually faced with being out-of-stock. To meet her planning target she is need of $1000.

loans.use: Hadija would like to add to her stock of maize.

loans.name: Domingos Pequenino

texts.pt:
Domingos Pequenino N. is a carpenter. He was born on October 28, 1952 in Inhambane, previously known as “ Terra de Boa Gente” – the land of good people. He studied until the 4th grade at he Escola Oficial de Catembe. When he was 15 years old, Domingos started working at the MI commercial enterprise until in 1967 it closed due to bankruptcy. Domingos then moved to Ribeiro Furnitures which also closed. Domingos then started working for himself, counting on his 30 years of experience.

Today Domingos employs 5 people. One of whom is his son. With the loan of 50,000.00 MT he strengthened his business and, since he was working from a home in the interior region of Guaxene, Domingos decided it was important to move the business to a shop close to the market.

With the loan of 10,000.00MT Domingos hopes to expand his business and be able to better cope with the demand of his clientele. Domingos work has a positive impact in his community because it generates employment and makes furniture available at a convenient location, thus saving his clients transportation costs.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Cliente: Domingos Pequenino N. Actividade: Serviços Valor do emprestimo: 10.000,00MT (400.00US$) Aplicação do emprestimo: Compra de matéria prima para estofaria Início: 13/07/2007 Fim: 31/07/2008 Domingos Pequenino N. carpinteiro estufador de profissão, nasceu aos 28 de Outubro de 1952 em Inhambane antes conhecida como “Terra de Boa Gente”, filho de pai que era ajudante alfandegário e mãe doméstica.Estudou até 4ª classe na Escola Oficial da Catembe. Aos 15 anos começou a trabalhar como ajudante de estufador na antiga empresa M.I. Comercial em 1967 onde por motivos de falência desta veio a ingressar como estufador na empresa Moveis Ribeiro a qual veio também a fechar por tempo indeterminado, motivo que lhe levou a optar em desenvolver a mesma actividade a conta própria uma vez que ja contava com larga experiência acomulada durante 30 anos de trabalho. Conta ter ja trabalhado com 5 ajudantes tendo sido um deles seu filho, embora estes tem lhe abandonado logo que se sentem capazes de fazerem o trabalho sozinhos.

Com um emprestimo de 5.000,00mt reforçou a sua actividade, adquirindo materia prima para estofaria em quantidades sufucientes para responder à demanda na altura, e como trabalhava em casa localizada no interior do bairro Guaxene, sentiu a necessidade de se instalar num local aberto e próximo do mercado para melhor colocar e publicitar as suas obras. Recorrendo ao segundo empréstimo de 10.000,00 mt, peretende aumentar seu volume de produção e responder às necessidades dos seus clientes embora de forma não cabal. Como perspectiva, almeja ter um espaço próprio na zona comercial da Catembe, ja que o actual é arrendado, como forma de minimizar os custos de produção fazendo face à concorrência . Conta actualmente com 5 pessoas na sua responsabilidade e trabalha com 2 ajudantes, daí o impacto positivo da sua actividade em sustentar a sua família para além de garantir o emprego e fornecer mobiliário às pessoas residentes poupando-lhes o tempo e o custo de transporte.

loans.use: To buy wood

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
Felix has a tailor shop where he makes sportswear, short vests, and sweatshirts. His home and workshop are located in the 14th of September neighborhood of the city of La Paz. This is the fifth time he has requested a loan from our institution. He has been a client of ours since 2005. His history with our institution qualifies him as a level-1 client, which is to say he has good compliance in the repayment of his debt. The amount he is requesting will be used to buy basic materials (fabric, lining, thread, interfacing).

His work and credit histories allow him to accept this loan, since he has experience in this business, and it gives him income to cover the loan.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Felix tiene un taller de costura donde elabora ropa deportiva, chalecos cortos y buzos. Su domicilio y taller se encuentran ubicados en la zona 14 de septiembre de la ciudad de La Paz. Es quinta vez que solicita un crédito de nuestra institución. Es cliente nuestro desde el año 2005. Su historial en nuestra institución lo califica como cliente 1, es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su obligación. El monto solicitado será destinado compra de materia Prima.( tela, forro, hilo, pellon)

Sus antecedentes crediticios y trabajo le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio, el cual le da ingresos para cubrir el préstamo.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Frederic

texts.fr:
Born on 27 April 1967 in Lomé, Mr. Frédéric K. is a reseller of coal in Gbadago. Unmarried, he has one (01) child in his care. Coming from a destitute family, he was unable to go to school because of a lack of means; thus, he began a small business selling coal about 10 years ago.
